It received a software upgrade a few days ago, and now, after playing a number of songs, it randomly starts making a loud unpleasant kind of burbling sound. If I say “Alexa, skip” it goes to the next song and plays properly. Then, some songs later, it burbles again. It is not any particular song file, and a song that made the noise will play properly if I say, “Alexa, play ‘song name’”. Amazon support is really nice, but apparently I am the only customer that has reported this. Of course, if they replace it, I will receive a refurbished unit; when I spent this kind of money a few weeks ago, I don’t want refurbished. They say they will escalate my problem to an engineer, so I will keep it for a while, but if they can’t fix it, back it goes. (I still really like the great sound quality when it isn’t burbling.) Sigh.
title: Nice Audio Easy Setup

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jeff Helmes
content: Alexa works flawlessly. Big plus since I bought it to replace a glitchy stereo pair of 3rd Gen Echoes in bedroom used for music & ocean wave sounds to help drift off to sleep. The stereo pairing suffered frustrating dropouts, with one or sometimes both speakers quitting in the middle of songs & very rarely played the ocean sounds through morning. But so far the Studio has worked perfectly. However, in spite of the Dolby Atmos credentials, the Studio doesn’t sound nearly as spacious as the paired Echoes (which I had in opposite corners of the room on the headboard wall, mounted about 5 feet high on candle sconces.) Paired also with an Echo Sub, this filled the room with sound rather nicely... well, whenever it all worked simultaneously. But the glitches simply became untenable, so I grabbed a Studio during Prime Day... At first I put the Studio near a corner of the room on a dresser, pointing the front toward the bed. Sounded tinny. Made sure I had upgraded to Amazon HD & played Best of 3D... Still barely any immersion of sound whatsoever. Very disappointing. Moved speaker to center of wall, still on dresser... Better but still not very impressive. (And yes I did keep the Echo Sub, now paired to the Studio.) I let it play all day while at work to break in the speaker & allow the room tuning to recalibrate... No avail. Finally I moved the Studio to a speaker stand, centered on the far wall facing the bed. The sound was significantly improved. Still not what I’d expect from a product claiming Dolby Atmos, but certainly better sound immersion. I think the side-firing speakers work far better in space, rather than bouncing sound off a near surface. Clearly the Studio is intended to point at the listener’s face & it must to achieve any reasonable degree of sound immersion. Regardless I did prefer the sound of paired Echoes with Sub over the Studio + Sub... but not enough to go back to all the frustrating glitches. No doubt paired Studios would sound better than the paired Echos, but I don’t want to return to the annoying dropouts. Besides for $300-400, a stereo pair of Sonos Ones would be better sounding with rock solid reliability. Bottom line is I will stick with the Studio because it has been so reliable & good enough sounding for a bedroom. The Echo pair absolutely demanded a Sub for quality music. However the Studio doesn’t depend on it since it has a woofer, unlike all other Echoes. So at $150 (on sale) I would recommend a Studio for a bedroom or kitchen where music will be played, but stereophile audio quality isn’t required. But for a living room or den where you may prefer excellent sound quality, I would highly recommend a Dot & a stereo pair of Sonos One SLs, or better yet the Sonos Five.
title: Studio is a stretch, but certainly the best sounding Alexa device.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jose Hernandez
content: I bought this Echo Studio from Best Buy last month because they happened to have a really good sale (loss-leader, maybe?) that included a free Amazon Echo Show 5 and Phillips Hue lightbulb.  At the time it was a better deal than what AMZN had to offer.  I got it to enhance the sound in my study where I already have a Logitech Z625 speaker system connected to my high-end laptop.  I thought it would provide better sound for when I was on a treadmill or rower vs my Logitech Z625 system.  It does provide good sound -- better overall than the Z625 -- if you don't mind losing out on bass.  The highs and mid-ranges are much better than the Logitech, but it really is lacking in bass.  I wish there was a way to combine the two systems (OK, there probably is...I'll try to figure out a cable of some sort or splitter so they both get inputs from the laptop) so that I could have a good balance of bass and mid- to high-frequency sounds.  If you're looking for "crisp" sounds and great Alexa integration but don't mind poor bass response, then the Echo Studio is for you.  It's great for a party atmosphere and high volume, just not good if you want to truly experience a well-balanced, high volume, sound.
title: It's great if you don't mind lack of bass

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Angela F.
content: I love the Echo product line! The speaker is phenomenal and sound quality is perfect. The only reason it didn’t get 5 stars is because even with a brand new smart TV with Alexa integration, every time I turn the TV on I have to manually connect the speaker with the TV. And if you don’t have a smart TV, you have to use the auxiliary/optical port which every time you use the voice recognition feature for Amazon Alexa, it mutes the line in and you can’t get it undone unless you unplug the audio cable and plug it back in.
title: Great with an Alexa-capable TV!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Brandon creasy
content: Pros: decent sound if you have a multi echo system and are using it for music only Cons: it's massive Not loud enough to use for a fire TV system Not nearly loud enough for TV shows 3d music is still ... Strange
title: I would wait a bit before buying

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: G. Mauldin
content: I will start with the cons. Home Theatre, I can't tell Alexa to turn off, I only can un pair in the app. When listening to the tv/home theatre, the sound drops completely if my wife is talking to Alexa in another room, perhaps hearing her through the wall. Yet while using home theatre she often doesn't hear me as if I'm drowned out by the audio she's producing, when she does hear me all TV audio is dropped while listening. If I pause the video the sound isn't in sink for 30 to 50 seconds on resuming, it gradually catches up.  Announcing the studio is bluetooth paired when I turn my computer on too early in the morning to be making noise.  Much of this can be fixed with Amazon programming so get to work people. Pros- Seems like a great centerpiece for the smart home. One studio unit but home theatre sounds good but not 5.1 good. Fantastic sound, the bass is so solid and clear without being excessive, makes me want to stereo a pair while tossing my old fashioned high quality components. Love having it play music from my home computer. The bonus 2 light bulbs work perfectly with the built in zigbee unit and with some struggles I eliminated a sengled unit for the bulbs I was using already.
title: Mostly fantastic

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Rob Blackwell
content: The Echo Studio is like my new best friend. I can't say much about the 3D audio--it feels gimmicky to me--but that's not the reason to buy this speaker. It just sounds so much better than the other Echos. I had a 2nd generation Echo in my kitchen, and I set the Studio up in the living room. I hooked them up to play songs at the same time. Walking from the kitchen into the living room was a whole other world of sound. You can feel the thrum of the bass and the lower notes. In a single word, it sounds terrific-- so good I'm considering replacing all my Echo devices with Studios. That may be taking things too far--the Studio is a rather big device, be warned--but the sound is so amazing I miss it when I'm in other rooms. Definitely consider the Studio in lieu of the more expensive offerings from Sonos or Bose. As far as I'm concerned, this speaker can't sound any better, and integration with Alexa is top-notch. Plus, you can form music groups so that multiple Echo devices can play your music together. I love this functionality and use it all the time. Overall, if you're looking for a great smart speaker, the Studio is amazing. You'll be happy you bought it.
title: A terrific speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Mr. A. McMillan
content: In just two weeks I went from a free echo 3rd generation dot (with a Sirius subscription), to two more dots, a echo 3rd generation,  and now the echo studio since Best Buy and Amazon had a one day sale.  My entire condo is now a symphony hall and I've been in heaven ever since.  Each echo does its job as promised and because you get what you pay for,  each upgrade of echo produces higher quality sounding music.  The echo studio has a 3.5 mm line in, so I was able to connect my 18 year old Panasonic plasma tv with deteriorating speakers into the echo studio and the sound is incredible.  I can also use the same line in to connect to my high resolution audio portable music player (which I use at the gym) and hear lossless quality sound from the echo studio...and...tell Alexa to "play the music everywhere " so all my echoes produce music throughout my home.  I don't ask Alexa many questions but I'm just 100% satisfied with my home being a symphony hall.  I hope all my echoes hold up over time,  but I'm content knowing I have great value for what I paid for.  My first echo dot is connected to my home theater in my living room,  my other dot is in the kitchen on the wall in a echo holder, my echo 3rd generation is in the guest bedroom and my echo studio is in my master bedroom where my older plasma TV is on the wall.  With music coming at me from everywhere,  my entire condo sounds like stereo in every room.  I gave one of my echo dots to my 85 year old neighbor that lives alone,  so if she falls, she can tell Alexa to call me and talk to me and I can be there for her right away.
title: My home is now a symphony hall with all my echoes

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Coach Parker
content: I have many Echo devices even the original and the car echo.  I recently bought the Echo Studio to replace a 20 year old TV speaker on our old Vizio Plasma TV. Unfortunately for the Echo Studio, the 20 year old internal sound bar sounds better than the Echo Studio. I am not impressed for $199 or even $169.  I am trying to decide if I should keep it or return it.  I will probably keep since the voice recognition in the E Studio is very good.  Its really only an sub par average speaker.  It does appear that older speaker tech was and is much better than many new speaker.  Speaker is a 2 and voice recognition is a 4, so an average of 3.  Sorry Amazon this one is not as good as the Echo Plus for value.
title: Disappointed, Just ok.  Louder but not better sound over Echo Plus.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: VirtualMirage
content: I bought this to replace my original Echo that was in the living room.  It is the main area where we listen to music in our house and I wanted something that could produce decent sound quality with range.  This is where the Echo Studio comes in and excels.  The rest of it's Alexa capabilities are just like any of the other Echos that I have used and works well.  It's microphones and ability to pick up requests has improved over the original Echo, but that's not what I bought it for.  It's speakers is where it really shines.  I use it to play music from Pandora, Apple Music, and Amazon Music.  There are notes and instruments in songs I have never heard before on other speakers, which goes to show how well this thing performs. The product is well built and has some heft to it.  It's base has a non-slip material to it, so it does stay in place.  The activity ring on the top is not as visible when lit as the other Echo units, which is a bit of a double-edged sword.  On the one hand, it makes it a little more difficult to see when it is listening/responding to you.  On the other hand, it doesn't distract you when you catch it lighting up out of the corner of your eye or late at night. I haven't tried the 3D audio capabilities, so I don't have much to say about that. The only thing that may make this sound better is pairing it with a subwoofer and a second Echo Studio for true stereo. I like this Echo Studio so much, I am contemplating picking up another one for a different room.
title: Excellent sound quality out of a compact size

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Stephen D. Frost
content: Bought this for line-in feature, but Echo has a 'feature' that turns off line-in when signal is too quiet. The only way to turn it back on is to reset the Echo, or unplug/re-plug the line-in cable. A quiet signal would include quiet parts in music, movies/tv, or if you turn off the connected device (i.e., if it's a turntable and the album ends, you'll need to restart the Echo to get it playing again). You can read more about this on forums across Amazon and Reddit, but there's been no solution so far. Definitely returning.
title: Line-In doesn't work - widespread and well-documented

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: bitbuckets
content: Astonishing! Price/ Performance is off the charts ... will be adding second Echo Studio to pair with initial purchase as soon as it becomes available.
title: Astonishing!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Customer for almost 2 decades
content: The sound quality on this is significantly more comparable to a sound system than any other Echo device I've used. I like the sound balancing it does when placed into a new room, it seems to really affect the sound quality. Even moving it in the same room changed the output levels that seemed to really enhance the quality of the sound. I will say I was shocked at how large and heavy the Studio was. I don't know if I just didn't read the description that well or look at the pictures closely, but I was anticipating something a lot closer to my echo and got a much larger device. I like the sound balancing it does when placed into a new room, seems to really affect the sound quality. Even moving it in my same room changed quite a bit the output levels it seemed to really enhance the quality of the sound. I will say I was shocked at how large it was, I don't know if I didn't read the description well or look at the pictures but I was anticipated something a lot closer to my echo and got a much larger device. I took a picture of it next to a Wii game so you can kind of get a concept of how big it is it's just as wide as the game is also. This device seems that a better microphone for picking up anytime I say Alexa. I had to shout it a bit and some of my other devices. The downside to having must be so large is I can't put it in my bathroom which is where I wanted to put it for when I am showering or getting ready in the morning. I currently us an echo dot in my bathroom to save counter space. Amazon it's time to make a better quality speaker, in a reasonable size, that is safe in moderately high humidity! But all in all this is a great party speaker and creates sound quality that reminds me of my surround sound system from 10 years ago in the size of a basketball.
title: Great speaker, larger than I thought.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: gr8shopper
content: Sound is excellent!! I did not think that I needed an echo until I bought my first Echo dot. As a Prime member, I figured I could at least listen to music throughout the house. Alexa has become a member of the family. In one year, I now have 3 Echo dots, 2 Echo Show 8 (one was gifted to my mom), 1 Echo Show 5, 1 Echo Original, and now the Echo Studio. By far the Echo Studio has the best sound quality, especially for larger spaces and outdoors. I plan to use the Studio for Outdoor movie nights with a portable projector. The only con that I have is I have not figured out how to "synchronize" my Echoes. The Studio and Echo Show sometimes get confused. I use the Show in the Kitchen Area and the Studio is in the Family Space near the TV. Overall I love the whole Echo Family. I live with a disability that causes chronic fatigue and severe shortness of breath. I am able to communicate with my kids using my Echo without having to over exert myself. We organize our shopping list on the Echo. Then use the Alexa app to retrieve the list while at the store. The Echo connects to my Chevrolet vehicle which is not just convenient but also really cool. LOL. The Echo Show 5 entertains my tween daughter and her friends with music and videos. My teenage son uses the Echo when he works out. His only complaint is that it is not wireless. We LOVE Alexa.
title: Sound is EXCELLENT!! Helps with organizing and so much more than a speaker.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tracii Kunkel
content: I've been on the fence about trying one of these since they were announced, but finally took advantage of the sale and thought maybe it could be a nice replacement for my home theater sound. Well, setup was nice and easy, and the demo sounded great. Although I did note that in order to REALLY get the effect you have to have it center screen.  Which means if I keep this I'm going to have to raise my television a few more inches so this behemoth doesn't get in the way. But I would do that...if it worked. I've had it 3 days, used it 2, had to reset it and set it back up at least 7 times so far. Most because I have 2 wifi connections in my home (one for me and one for guests), and although I set this up with the main one and NEVER gave it the password for the guest wifi, it's already in Amazon so it kept switching over. And there is no way in the app or anywhere else to change wifi connections without wiping it and starting over fresh.  This happened even after I went in and told Amazon to forget the guest wifi altogether.  It's also just come disconnected from the Echo Cube randomly, resulting in having to go into the app and unpair and repair the home theater setup.  I haven't made it through a single movie yet without it having to be reset.  Sound is great, as long as you have it centered. The home theater is great - when it works. Also disappointed that it won't work with my other echos, but I just wish I could get it to stay consistently connected to the Echo Cube.
title: So frustrating...

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: skitch
content: I was excited about the hype behind the Echo Studio and the technology looked great.  But for me it was a bit disappointing sound wise from what I was expecting.  The sound separation was not as good as just a simple left end right speaker set up.  The bass at set levels was lacking so I needed to adjust that in the app.  Even with the Ultra HD Amazon music songs and Dolby Atmos movies, there wasn't a lot of blow you away-ism. A bothersome thing was that in the app they have a setting to pair the Echo Studio with a remote.  I thought this would be very helpful because I have an Echo Show 8 next to were I sit and to voice activate the Studio with the remote would save some "alexa" confusion.  Also it would be good to use the volume controls on the remote for the speaker.  After many tries to pair a new remote.  I could not get it to work.  So I called Amazon support.  They told me that I could not use the 4K remote and to use any remote the Studio could not be pairs with any other group or Echo devices because it uses bluetooth and only one blurtooth could be paired at at a time.  So to use a remote and have it also used with Fire TV was not possible.  I was told even a remote from just an Echo 1st or 2nd gen would not work.  Disappointing.
title: Good but not great with a remote issue.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Sptwriter
content: I used this as an alternative to a soundbar to the TV on my patio, plus as a smart speaker replacement for music, so it's doing double duty. The sound quality is not on par with "dumb" standard wired speakers like my NHT 2.1 that requires separate amplification. Still, the sound is the best of the smart speakers, definitely better than the original Echo Dot, the original Echo and the Echo Plus 2nd Gen, all of which I currently own. One negative: The Alexa app doesn't walk you through syncing with your TV even if it's already connected to a Fire TV Cube, as mine is. I did a chat with support and got connected to the cube, but it still didn't sync with a fairly new Sony TV. So I grabbed a second device to search for how to do that and eventually that worked. The Echo Plus has pretty darn good sound for a device that has a much smaller footprint and heft but the Studio's size gives it better bass and maybe a tad more richness. They're in separate spots and I haven't done a long comparison so that's just a general feel. Overall, I like it and more colors and more instructions will only make it better.
title: "soundbar" alternative

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: JHatt
content: Bought 2 of these to pair in stereo.  At full volume it has the punch I wanted to jam out and the sound is a hi fidelity sound.  One thing to be aware of the default sound setting is the 3D space sound and unless specifically listening to this type of music will probably want to turn off the 3D space sound using Alexa App.  At least that was my preference anyway.  If you buy these don't review or judge until you've played around with 3D sound setting. Also, like the equalizer options to adjust.  Stereo pairing was easy and works great. Have already had a couple neighbors over to listen and the 'wow' reaction is fun to see. These speakers also have the ability to stream the hi fidelity larger file sizes that Amazon offers at an extra price.  I'm currently trying out this feature.  Sounds great at the regular industry standard file sizes.  I think I do notice a little bit of a difference with the large hi fidelity streaming.  Nice to have the option for the higher bit streams. The bass is adequate with the 2 Echo Studios, however I'm going ahead and ordering the echo sub to get the full effect.  I'm told you can do the stereo pairing of the 2 studios and also stream to the sub as well.  So should be exciting when I get it setup. I did buy these on prime day which save me some dollars. Overall very happy with this purchase.
title: Powerful hi fidelity sound I was wanting

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Bill G
content: I am exceptionally pleased with the quality of sound and the ease of installation for this product.  Basically, it was a ten-minute setup, including adding it to several groups in my home.  As a person who is hard of hearing, the depth of sound in these speakers makes the music I listen to much more enjoyable-- I don't need the volume to be turned up loud to hear the dots.  I also appreciated that this system "sounded out" the room to adjust itself--making it appear that the entire room is filled with sound, not just the locus of the system itself. I would buy more if I had a bigger apartment... this is a great piece of equipment.
title: Great addition to the Alexa family

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: LowcountryGuy
content: The Echo Studio is an excellent product. It does deserve the 5 star rating, when you consider the price point and the features it provides. While the sound is excellent it wouldn't compare to a full Klipsch surround sound, but your also not paying 1/10th of the price.  The bass and mids are excellent for such a small speaker, and the sound fills our living room perfectly. The design is very aesthetically pleasing, and it blends in with our contemporary farmhouse interior design. The microphones do a good job of picking up our voices even over the sound of music playing out of its speakers.  I will definitely purchase another one of these speakers for my loft.
title: Premium sound for the class of speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: EM
content: I'm so frustrated. I have spent countless hours trying to create a stereo pair and a home theater. I only purchased the two studios and the fire tv cube to create a home theater and a stereo for music. I have tried absolutely everything to just pair the two studios, one studio to the fire tv, and all combinations. I have searched forums, videos, etc. None of my devices show up when searching for devices to stereo pair. Amazon customer service is useless. They seem to have zero tech knowledge or anyone employed to deal with tech issues. They won't call back, take notes so they don't ask you the same things you tried 100x! I have wasted a bunch of time and money. Now I have to figure out how to return this junk. I wish I had room for proper powered bookshelf speakers. I hate the fire tv. I love roku, but made this purchase for the stereo audio for my TV and music. Amazon is a multi billion dollar company, yet they can't invest in proper tech support. Many others are having issues with stereo pairing any of the echo devices in the forums..I wish I could afford to throw the $400 equipment in the trash.
title: Won't stereo pair

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: jeffer
content: I am now wishing I had just bought another echo dot and went a different route for music, etc.  The sound is okay, but not worth the price I paid. Sometimes when Alexa speaks the volume suddenly drops to a level that I can't hear and then returns to correct volume when I make a new request/question. Sometimes when I enter the room after being gone for a while, Alexa can't understand a simple request like "Den Light On" (even if I consciously pronounce the words clearly).  It may take two or three tries to get the command to work.  This is frustrating when you have your arms full of objects. There are numerous questions that Alexa can't answer when I ask them.  I can then speak to Google Assistant on my cell phone and get a precise answer. Alexa system keeps losing color for bedroom light.  I set it to red and then suddenly it turns back to bright white at some random point.  This is very frustrating when you wake up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom.  Red doesn't fully wake me up.  White wakes me up completely.
title: Not getting my money's worth

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Matthew R French
content: I just initiated my 2nd Echo Studio factory reset and figured it was time I spoke my mind about this product.  I was truly excited to get one of these.  I own an array of Echo products including 2 Echo shows, a 1st generation Echo and an echo dot.  I live in a semi-smart home (mostly lights) and while this isn't my number one hobby, I'd like to think than I'm an enthusiast.  But, Sadly, this device, or at least my particular unit, is a lemon.  Most recently 'she' lost connection to the internet.  I tried restarting a few times but that didn't help.  This is a pretty regular occurrence, but usually a reboot fixes it.  Music playback can also be problematic.  This device is in my bedroom, my wife and like to enhance our intimate encounters with a little music.  Well, let me tell you, nothing really sets the mood like random playback failures.  A change in mid song, or long delays between tracks can be very distracting.  I would be more forgiving if this where through Spodify, but I subscribed to Amazon's Music streaming service just so I could take advantage of the Atmos feature.  To be clear, when it works, it's great.  But more often than not, there is something buggy happening.
title: Worst echo device I own :(

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ryan D
content: I bought two of these. (For music you really need two speakers). With Amazon Music HD, the sound is good. But.....I still don't think it matches a traditional stereo setup with an amp/receiver powering passive speakers. What I wish Amazon would do with the HD service is offer an amp with the app integrated in. And with a DAC that can play the full 192/24 resolution for songs in that format. Power that through a pair of passive Klispch or Polk speakers and you might be in music heaven. You would get the best of both worlds: the hi fi sound of a traditional stereo with the convenience and cost effectiveness of music streaming. Come on Amazon......do it!
title: Here Is A Headline

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: DJ Jimmy D
content: I have purchased eight Echos for my family and others since its debut. Being an audiophile, when I heard about the Echo Studio, I KNEW I had to have one. Dolby Atmos, 3D High Definition Music?? Yes sir!! Read great reviews and not-so-great reviews. Still ... I had to have one. And I wish I had listened to the not-so-great reviews. The sound quality is maybe slightly better than the Echo Show. I haven't heard anything yet that sounded like "Dolby Atmos". As far as 3D?? That's a joke. I purchased a subscription to Amazon Music HD and nothing there sounds any better than normal Spotify on the first generation Echo. Because I'm a fool, I will hold onto it for now on the slim chance that I'll buy another when they come down in price as I've read THAT'S the way to listen to it and I can imagine it'd sound slightly better with two speakers simultaneously rather than just one speaker. I dunno. Maybe I'm an idiot and a glutton for punishment. We'll see. In the meantime I say do NOT buy this. Get the biggest Echo Show you can afford and enjoy that instead.
title: Don't Believe The Hype

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: J. Richards
content: I bought this to replace my original Echo that I bought in pre-releaase in 2015 that has sat and worked away as a loyal soldier in the kitchen all of this time without an issue playing hundreds if not thousands of hours of music and answered uncounted numbers of questions... WHAT AN UPGRADE! The sound of music out of this device in the poorly located position (for a music device) for the Echo in the kitchen (tucked in next to a small convection toaster) is amazing. I am listening to Ed Sheeran songs on it right now, while it sits in the kitchen, and I am in the living room 20+ feet away and it is crystal clear with actual bass. Configuration was child's play. I unplugged the Echo, I plugged in the Studio, I started the Alexa app, clicked a few prompts, it went through some sound tests and within 3-4 minutes it was up and running playing a Classic Rewind channel for me for validation tests. Now I have to replace the Echo in my office with one of these Studios as I regularly listen to music there as well. Great job Amazon! :)
title: WOW! What a great upgrade from the Echo

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: A. Pascual
content: As soon as I plugged it in, it registered itself and did the whole setup on its own. I never had to open the app or anything. At first listen I was very disappointed in the sound quality. It did not sound any better than the Echo Show it replaced. It sounded like music was coming from a canister or drum. Then I turned off Stereo Spatial Emhancement in Alexa App settings and maxed out the equalizer. After a few minutes it started to sound great! Bass was deep and tight, mids and trebble were clear! I read in another review online and they described it best: this speaker "has no chill." Hard to deacribe. You gotta hear it for yourself.
title: Exceeded my expectations!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Miron Lior
content: I have Echo Studio and Echo Dot in my house and every time I connect one of them to the Bluetooth from the phone, laptop, or iPad, I get a beep, and then an announcement to tell me "Now playing from... name of the device".  The message is loud and unnecessary. I know - I just manually connected you!!! But the worst thing is that Alexa announces it even if the device has been connected for a while. For example, if I get back to using a laptop after some idle time. So if you have someone napping it will surely wake them up. If you are listening to relaxing music before sleep it will scare the hell out of you. This feature can not be turned off with "Brief Mode". This feature can not be turned off with "Do not disturb mode". THERE IS NO WAY CURRENTLY TO TURN THIS OFF After lengthy research, I found that there is a whole community of people complaining about this on Amazon's Alexa forum since 2016, but nothing has changed. I am seriously considering switching to Google Home. The only thing that is stopping me is not Alexa, it is the sound quality of the Echo Studio speaker. It is better than any other smart speaker out there. But if it wakes up my pregnant wife once again I might just quit it, unfortunately.
title: Giving up on my Echo Studio because of this small but most annoying feature

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Camilo J. Quelquejeu
content: ENJOYING IT TREMENDOUSLY AS A MUSIC CENTER HAT MAKES IT EASY TO PLAY WHATEVER MY FAMILY WANTS TO HEAR , WITH MINIMUM EFFORT , SINCE ALEXA DOES ALL THE SEEKING AND SEARCHING FOR ME. FOR SOME REASON  ALEXA HAS A VERY DIFFICULT TIME FINDING THE MUSIC OF MY FAVORITE PIANO PLAYER , [ WADZIU ] WALTER  VALENTINO  LIBERACE ,  SINCE NO MATTER WHAT I CALL HIM , OR HOW I CALL HIM , OR HOW I PRONOUNCE HIS NAME , IT TAKE ME A LEAST TEN TRIES TO FINALLY MANAGE TO GET ALEXA TO LOCATE HIM ! AND I TRY:  LIBERACE , WALTER LIBERACE , WADZIU LIBERACE , LIBERACE WALTER , LIBERACE WADZIU , LIBERACE , ETC.  AND IT REQUIRES LOT OF TRIES TO FINALLY GET ALEXA TO UNDERSTAND MY INSTRUCTIONS. BUT WHEN IT FINALLY DOES , I CAN SPEND ALL DAY LISTENING TO HIS WONDERFUL MUSIC IN HIGH DEFINITION. WHEN USING TWO ECHO STUDIOS AS A STEREO PAIR IT IS ABSOLUTELY ESSENTIAL TO CHOOSE ONLY ONE OF THE TWO SPEAKERS TO RECEIVE THE INSTRUCTIONS , AND KEEP THE OTHER MIKE AT THE RED DISABLED POSITION , OTHERWISE YOU WILL GET CONFLICTING INSTRUCTIONS AND CONFUSED RESULTS !
title: GREAT WHEN COMBINED WITH AMAZON MUSIC UNLIMITED ! BE CAREFUL WHEN USING TWO AS AS A STEREO PAIR !

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Brian Roberts
content: This sounds just as good if not better, and costs just 200 bucks. Worth it for big sound. + Alexa built in, I'm sold. I've hooked it up to my xbox via a mini-toslink to toslink cable I bought on amazon for 6 bucks to play racing games as well and it sounds great.
title: I've owned a lot of $500+ systems

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: WR
content: The Studio is great as a stand alone Alexa speaker, but isn’t very good paired with a FireTV. You’ll constantly be annoyed by the lag between picture and sound. The sound lag on YouTube and Hulu make them completely unusable. If you don’t mind hearing the words 2-3 seconds after seeing lips move, this is the speaker for you.
title: Not ready for TV use

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Gil
content: I don't know how you can beat the sound of a stereo pair of Echo Studio's for the money.  I ordered 2 and have mine set up as a stereo pair. Will they fill up a large room at concert volume? No but for a smaller room/apartment or for a whole house or secondary system they are amazing.  I don't have them paired with a Fire TV so can't speak to that but my wife and I listen to them by streaming Amazon Music HD and I really do hear things in songs particularly on the high end I've never heard before.  They are so good you tell the difference between an HD stream and an MP3 service.  I don't consider myself a true audiophile but I do spend a lot of money on 2 channel and home theatre gear and I'm very impressed with the sound of these speakers.  I had them set up in under 10 minutes.  The Echo Sub is sold out and not available at the time of this review but I have pre-ordered it and I'm really looking forward to adding it to the speaker group. Note to Amazon: You have a great product here.  I would suggest making a larger scale version of these - say 1.5 or 2 times the size for people who want to fill up a bigger space.  I'd gladly pay more for something like that.
title: Stereo Pair of Echo Studios Sound Amazing

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Justyn Acord
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Although this is a great device, I have to give it minimal stars.  I specifically bought this device as a sound bar for my amazon TV.  The problem is, I have to replay up to 5-10 minutes of any video before it syncs up to actually play.  I’ll go 5 minutes into a program before any audio actually is heard.  And once you sync up, it is a pain in the butt to un sync it and reconnect which doesn’t always repair the problem. By itself, a great device.  But don’t expect the claim that it gives you surround sound.  It does when it wants to, but falls flat on regular usage.
title: Don’t buy for surround sound!!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Avg Consumer
content: Just a little background on my taste. I’m pretty deep in both amazon and apple products for many years now. And I’m a bit of an audiophile. I don’t have speakers like these in my house but I wanted to set up a hub to control lights etc. in my apartment so two birds is what I thought. Especially since I don’t want to have a full blown sound system in my small apartment. I’ve had the older generation Echo dot and it sounded terrible. I ordered this Studio when it first came to market expecting an upgrade but was pretty disappointed. It’s rather flat sounding in my opinion hence the mediocre review. I really should have returned it. In any event, I am giving away my old Dot after receiving the new generation Echo yesterday. At a hundred bucks it sounds better than the Studio. So now I have the new Echo in my bedroom and Studio in living room. Both handle voice commands well. But I’d recommend the new Echo over the Studio. The sound is open and airy. Highs are crisp and the bass is punchy in a smaller footprint. The sound on the Studio is just blah. Everything else works fine so 3 stars.
title: I would choose the new Echo over this.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Robert
content: The good: The sound is good, not great, even when paired in stereo mode with another Echo Studio and an Echo Sub. I also think they look pretty cool, although my wife disagrees. The bad: The price is much too high for what you get. The sound quality is good, but for $200 I expect something that sounds much better, cleaner, and with more depth. The "Alexa" smart assistant feature is terrible. It can barely hear me and often requires me to repeat a command 3 or so times (which is much worse than even my original (beta) Echo v1. These things are huge (about the size of a volleyball) and are difficult to place around the home, especially when paired with another Echo Studio and an Echo Sub. I really expected much better, richer sound quality for the price. Considering what you can get for the cost of two Echo Studios and an Echo Sub in the traditional speaker market, I'm pretty disappointed with the sound quality, and I'm not even an Audiophile. Finally, it doesn't look like you can use these as TV speakers unless you have one of the newer Amazon Fire TV devices. I expected these to play sound for my TV, including my Roku, PS4, and other video devices, even if that was limited to stereo quality sound, but these lack that capability apparently.
title: Not polished enough for the price

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Frederick Dunne
content: The speaker is as expected. I had to move it around a bit an re-calibrate it a few times. If you are in the same boat, hold down the action button, it will go into setup mode, showing an orange ring. DON'T let go of the button and keep holding it down beyond this for a wee bit more. It will then kick of the whole process of starting up as it did the first time and do the wall bouncing thingy. Anyways, my gripe is not the speaker but the bulb that came packaged with the purchase. I already got a Philips hue bulb in a previous Echo purchase and that works fine.  No need for a Philips hue hub, just the built in zigbee hub that the Echo plus (which I have) or this Echo Studio has. However, this bulb does require a Philips hue hub. What numb nuts is not paying attention to this in Amazon when they put these items for sale as a package? Why not the Philips hue bulb that works with a zigbee hub that the Echo you are purchasing has built into it? Other than that, the speaker works as expected.  I do prefer to turn off the 'Stereo Spatial Enhancement' under the audio settings for the Echo Studio in the Alexa app under 'Audio settings'.
title: The Philips hue bulb that it comes with does not work with the zigbee hub that the Studio has.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Robbie Cooper
content: I was actually looking for ways to improve the sound on my TV and saw a promo of the Studio. I went ahead and order one and got it quickly, set it up in my master and played around with it. I have Amazon Music, played some of their 3D demo music and was sold on Rocket Man. Immediately upgraded to Prime 3D Music. Connected it to the TV and pulled up Blade Runner 2049, Thor Dark World and Avengers EndGame and on a single Studio was wowed by the sound filling my master. So withing days, I order a second Studio and upon arrival, moved both into our family room and now have it fully integrated with our large TV. That room has 26 foot ceilings and opens to several other rooms but the sound reached everywhere. It also sets up with left and right speakers and you can hear some really crazy subtle noises that I don't even remember hearing in the theater. I now stream every app I can through the Fire Stick (get with the program on HBO Max, Amazon!!!) As for just music, the bass can be a bit overwhelming and there is not a lot of control in the equalizer on the Alexa app. I don't claim to be an audiophile but I own thousands of songs via iTunes and know good v great sound quality. Amazon is better than good and on most songs, especially those that are in 3D, the quality is pretty fantastic. But I also really like heavy metal and given drums and bass dominance in bands like Tool, the really deep tones can be a little overwhelming. But Tool also has tracks in 3D and the nuances that sneak through the heavy bass are really interesting. On more pop or pop rock music, it's not as prevalent and really quite enjoyable. We'll see if I can survive the holiday season streaming my wife's Christmas music. If you subscribe to Amazon Music, I recommend pairing this with a TV whether you intend to use it for a sound system or not. With Fire TV, the remote syncs to the Studio and controls TV and speakers. It makes access to the music catalog and all of their HD and Ultra HD quality music fairly simple. There could be some improvements like better access to genres and then sub sections within but overall a decent way to get artists or albums to play. They also have quite a few playlists pre-created, some of which are pretty good. Overall, for $400 to get 2 Studio's and a couple more Hue lights, I can't think of a better way to get a serious TV sound improvement (that really will rattle the rafters) and a much better than good smart speaker.
title: Very good sound, excellent Fire TV integration and audio

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: AmazonMan
content: So here it is...plain & simple. Any Echo device that advertises quality sound...especially heavy base...be prepared to be yelling at it; And, be prepared for it not to listen. I've bought this model for the rich sound, but half the time I just end up screaming at it to "STOP!"  In short, it won't catch your commands if you have the volume high. More importantly, talking to an Echo (aka Alexa) is still like talking to a 5 year old toddler.  You have to speak slow & pronounce everything to the "T" if you expect to get the correct response. And that my Amazon friends, gets really old super fast!
title: THE REAL TRUTH ABOUT ANY SUB ECHO DEVICE-MUST READ

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Andrea T.
content: We have a number of Echo devices and were excited to add the Studio in our main living area and also use it to watch movies. The audio is great compared to all other Echo devices. The home theater feature is technically very exciting and connects seamlessly with the fire TV, too bad that sometimes audio skips and with some apps the audio is a few milliseconds delayed. The audio skipping made the feature unusable for movies. When you have this feature on if you play music say from Spotify, that also turns your TV on and plays Spotify from your fire TV. This is also unreliable as sometimes the fire tv doesn’t actually turn on OR it turns on but it doesn’t open the app. We even went to buy an optical cable and this also has two different issues a) you can only change the volume with your voice and b) audio is ALSO unreliable is it sometimes suddenly completely mutes and you have to unplug the cable and when you turn te TV or program off you get some sort of residual audio. Overall a disappointment that I hope a software update will fix.
title: Disappointing as a speaker, best Echo device

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Vuvuzela
content: Bought two and paired them as stereo speakers in the living room.  They replace a 15-year old Bose large CD-player boom box that died of control malfunctions.  I had hoped this new technology would equal or surpass the Bose.  It doesn't even come close, which I suppose I should have expected considering that the Bose box cost 6 times as much and has a lot more technology in it than these.  If this is Amazon's attempt at decent sound, they have quite a way to go.  The mid-range sound on these is very muddy.  This is not high- fidelity quality.  It's OK for what it is, and the stereo arrangement is sufferable.  Hooking up just one, however,  was not adequate for my background "easy listening" purposes.  I was on the edge of sending them back, but, I love being able to bounce all around the history of music just by asking Alexa to play this or play that, or asking WHat song is this, or Who is playing this song.  That part, I love.  But of course you have to pay around 150 a year or so for Amazon music access.
title: Works well with Amazon Music; sound quality completely mediocre

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: bdfromsd
content: We tried to use it as a sound bar, DON'T. If you switch to a smart speaker, you can't switch back without unplugging it and waiting for it to boot up again. If you command it as a smart speaker, it switches the input off, but there is no command to allow it to switch back to input. Tried emailing support 4 times, no answer, because there is not one and Amazon does not care to provide a simple fix. The only work around is to switch off the microphone and not set it up in a group. If you are not going to use it as a smart speaker, there are much better sound bar speaker options out there. If you are going to use it as a smart speaker, get an echo or echo dot, save a lot of money.
title: Good speaker, no functionality or customer support. Look for better value

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Marc
content: Shockingly good sound from such a relatively small device. Setup is mostly easy. Had some issues setting up home entertainment system mode with fire stick. It did not work independently and respond to Alexa requests. Had to remove, reinitialize etc and then it worked. Was frustrating. I have two of these in different rooms and one was effortless the other a pain. Got over it quickly when I put on a movie and it filled the room with 3D-ish sound and good low end. I’m sure if I put 2 together with a sub it would be killer. I use the fire stick for everything so it isn’t as limiting as I thought it would be. I have a DVD player (rarely use) and Nintendo switch and use the tv sound. Not enough of a deal breaker to make me get a big clunky sound bar. Kids don’t care that switch sound comes from tv. Wish list item would be ability to re-calibrate room sensing thing without reinstalling. I moved it around a bit and it doesn’t feel like it automatically fixed the positioning.
title: Great addition to Echo devices with pleasing sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Vikram Rajasekaran
content: I tried to replace my desktop speakers with this echo studio since it saved space and combined speakers and my existing echo dot. The problem is the aux in takes forever to turn on, so for cases where I'm using this for meetings, lots of sound is dropped every time there is a pause in the room and returns. They need a way to force aux input as default for this case.
title: Terrible as a desktop speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Stephen T.
content: When the echo products went on a limited time sale, I purchased the Studio to replace my Echo 2nd gen.  The setup was effortless as it recognized my network and added itself via the app.  To my disappointment, I immediately realized that the mid and upper range was directional.  The speaker was in a central location on top of a kitchen counter almost in the middle of a large open space (kitchen, den, and dining areas).  When I walked around the unit the sound was not uniform.  For a few hours, I contemplated returning it, then I moved the studio to a corner of my 11" x 29" enclosed lanai with the unit supported about a foot off of the floor.  What a difference!  Now I love it!  The bass is so much deeper than the Echo 3rd gen and voices sound more lifelike.  Where you place this unit matters.  When you find the right spot, the sound quality is wonderful.  I gave the studio 4 stars because I could not use it in the location that I purchased it for.  For that spot, I bought an Echo 3rd generation.
title: The sound is wonderful, but .... Echo Studio is not a 360 degree speaker. Location matters.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Kyle
content: Let me start by saying that when I purchased the Studio, it came with an Echo Show 5, and Phillips Light Bulb, for free (as Charlie Sheen would say, "Winning"). As with most Alexa products, set up is simple and intuitive. It really is just a large plump Echo, but upgraded.  The voice recognition, is tremendous. It sounds amazing, and it is sleek in design. What I don't like, is I feel that it could be louder. It is loud.. it was difficult for my son and I to converse, while it was set at 8. It's loud enough honestly, but you know....Americans. I also suppose that the device, while a speaker, is also an Echo, so it needs to be able to monitor its wake word (privacy issues aside). Regardless, it sounds boss in my living room. but in my living room it's still loud. I get that there are alternative speakers, with Alexa integration, on the market that are louder, but I've drank the Echo Kool-aid and am invested. The other thing I don't like, which is vexing, is the inability to use this as a Surround Sound/Home Theater option. ***evidently you can use it in this mode, but only if you are using a more current generation Fire Stick*** I tried to pair it with my Samsung 8 Series, but no dice. Im not an expert, so if someone knows, bring it. Let me close by saying this, I hated this product so much that now I have Two Studios, Two Echo Show 5s, and Two Phillips Light Bulbs. And yes, the two Studios paired together, is sexy. As "The Dude" would say, "It really ties the room together man."
title: If You Are Down With Echo, Then This Is For You!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Zoo
content: Bought to use in Florida room. When listening to music, there isn't a huge difference between listening to my original Echo device. Would probably sound better if paired with another, but then for the price of two, might as well buy a Bose.
title: Not much different sound than Echo.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Organ Grinder
content: Everything about the Echo Studio is great except that it can't wake me up in the morning to near perfect sound.  I have an additional Echo and Echo Sub which together combine for fantastic, near perfect stereo/3D music.  But...the alarm (wake up) function will only allow the music to come from the Echo Studio.  Granted, I can wake up to "good" sound from just the Studio alone.  The drawback here is that I have two different equalizer preferences; one for just the Studio and one for the entire system so this solution does not meet my idea of perfection since only one equalizer setting can be stored at a time.  I have since moved my Studio and Sub to another room and have fantastic sound there and have reverted to using my Echo Show 10" as my alarm clock pending a hopeful Amazon upgrade. An additional note is that the Echo Studio sounds great by itself but sounds MUCH better when paired with an Echo Sub.
title: Needs One More Update for Perfection

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: John J. Toye
content: This is a well built and great sounding speaker for the cost. Amazon is really competing with the big brands with this one. Still evaluating the 3D music but Amazon Ultra HD music sounds fantastic on this speaker.  Plenty loud and clear. Can't go wrong with this speaker.
title: Outstanding sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jim P
content: I had a pair of Bose speakers in my bedroom, voices were always difficult to decipher at the lower volume levels needed in the bedroom to keep peace with my wife. After hearing several speakers in the $200-$400 range I decided on the Echo, brought it home, hooked it up (easy peasy). I'm amazed at the clarity of the voices coming from this speaker even at the lowest levels. Exactly what I needed.  I paid $169 for this and it came with a free light bulb, what else could I ask for? Update! This speaker sits next to my right ear. I'm watching football last night and I hear cheering from the left side of the room!! Thinking I'm hearing things I muted the speaker, sure enough, voices were coming from the right but the sound was bouncing off the walls, all the while at a low volume level, this is a good-sized Master bedroom. The separation is almost as good as the 10K system in my living room. Love this speaker!!
title: Just what I've been needing.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Joel Frese
content: The best speak system that I've ever owned! The pairing in Home Theater node via Amazon Fire Cube Gen1 was sketchy at first but it seemed to have sorted itself out. I can hear things in old movies and shows that I have never heard before! Often, while watching a show, one of the cats will think they heard something in the house and immediately respond but it's only the speakers. That's house realistic they sound!! These have excellent bass. The sound quality and richness is better than anything I have ever owned, hands down. Complaints? I don't know. I wish I could ask it to place music without flipping on the TV. It's cool to see the lyrics though. The Echo Studio has incredible microphones. They are better than any Echo device. I could be in another room and they hear me better than the Echo that's in the room where I'm at. Not cheap but worth every penny. Honestly? Now I want more for the bedroom.
title: The best sound system I have owned.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: C. Perry
content: If you have Alexa devices for home automation this is a really nice addition if you care about how your music and/or home theater sounds.  It's a Dolby Atmos audio system if you have a Fire TV, which is really nice.  It sounds better than sound bars, but not quite as good as a Dolby Atmos home theater system with components, unless you pair 2 of the Studios with an Echo Sub.  That's where the really good stuff happens.  But, for just a single unit, it pumps out some really nice sound with plenty of bass, but not overpowering or muddy.  It sounds very tight and accurate.  Compared to the Apple Homepod, it's not quite as accurate and clear, but it's close, and the Studio gets quite a bit louder.  The Studio also has a built-in hub for Hue lights and other devices.  At normal price, it's a solid purchase for home automation and audio.  If you can catch the Studio on sale, it's very easy to recommend.
title: A solid home stereo system

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: SMcDonaldx
content: I played all kinds of music then decided to go full blast Metallica and Rammstein and Korn. I fully expected this little echo studio to faulter crack and possibly explode. Impressed by what I heard and was not hearing I closed my eyes and it sounded not unlike a 200w stereo with 10 or 12 inch floor speakers without a sub. I asked my wife n the next room if it was loud. I got a "he'll ya, it was loud" to which I replied " man, this thing is from outer space. Must be some alien tech. Haha seriously though, it's pretty amazing. The bass is tight and the mids and highs have allot of clarity. I haven't messed with the equalizer because I've been listening to ultra HD tracks and want to hear it like the artist intended pluss didn't really feel a need to adjust anything. Welp, there's my take on the little echo that could. Don't regret buying it and am impressed.
title: Out of this world!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Moxley S.
content: The sound quality of this unit is great. Unfortunately, how I use it the most is listening to music, and it often fails at that. Sometimes, when I tell Alexa to "play Spotify", nothing happens. When I open Spotify on my computer, it shows that it is connected to the unit. When I press Play, nothing happens. The song does not play. After restarting Spotify on my computer, it often resets, and everything works. Sometimes it doesn't. When it doesn't, I have to unplug the Echo Studio to restart it. I also have an Echo Dot, and there has never been any problems getting Spotify to play on it. For the price of this unit, I would expect it to work better.
title: Has trouble talking to Spotify

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jax
content: We went straight from an antiquated Dot - which was definitely showing its age and becoming very "laggy" to the Echo Studio. Whereas you could never really get the Dot to play loud enough, you'll find yourself saying "Alexa, turn down the volume" more than you'd expect (and that's a good thing). With shockingly good bass, and the ability to broadcast sound far beyond its immediate vicinity, the Echo Studio is a massive step forward and essentially a replacement for all but higher end home sound systems. We all unanimously agree; worth every penny.
title: A massive upgrade over the Dot

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: MD 20/20
content: About to purchase another one and two wireless subwoofers, this echo studio ain't nothing but the truth and I'm a Bose owner of several types (companion 2 and accoustimass 7).
title: Studio Sound Master

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Shubydoo
content: I wanted this to use as a soundbar for my TV when watching and for an Echo when I am busy and want to listen, and it does both perfectly.  I plugged in the optic cord and it works better than I expected to fill the room and clear up the TV audio, and I just say "alexa, mute" when I get or make a phonecall, then "Alexa, unmute" when I'm done - don't even have to reach for the remote to turn it down.  If you want to impress someone with your audiophile knowledge and say the highs or lows or middles are not to your liking, feel free.  As for me, I think it overall sounds absolutely great, it does double duty as both a soundbar and an Echo, and the price point is absolutely right for either of those things.  I love it, and am thinking hard about getting another for my bedroom TV once my credit cards stop crying over the damage I did to them during Christmas!  LOL!!
title: Does exactly what I wanted

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Travis
content: Voice recognition is terrible. Most of the time Alexa only hears her name and nothing else. Set a timer? Be ready to say it 3 times. Want bluetooth off? 3rd time's the charm! The dot has it beat here and that's bad at 8x the cost. Also drops bluetooth a lot and doesn't remember previous devices. Hard to play Spotify, constantly disconnects and switches to another device. Boots me and defaults to the PC a lot. Sound quality is decent for what it is but I still prefer the top 2 JBL models for that. Plus they're portable... But really, if I want high fidelity I'll throw on a record or pop in an SACD disc. Takes a lot to impress me in this department and a $200 product ain't gonna hack it. Remember the original Echo? They don't make 'em like they used to...
title: Worst Echo product to date.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Will
content: The speaker started off nice. The 3d sound capabilities are pretty nice. I bought this for the purpose of listening to music based on the fact that its supposed to have bigger and better speakers than the smaller echos or echo plus, and also had a built in subwoofer. The sound was good until about 2 weeks after I got it. Now it just sounds buzzy and distorted. I'm pretty disappointed. I wasn't expecting Bose levels of quality, but I had expected it to last longer than 2 weeks. It still works for alexa commands, but if that's all I wanted, I would have bought a dot for $30 instead of the almost $200 for this one.
title: Speakers buzzy after only 2 weeks.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: John A.
content: Welcome audio files May poo poo this unit I think it is fantastic for its ability to provide instant music on demand with a high quality of resolution. It may not be the best but it certainly in the ballpark for competition with Sonos Bose and the rest. I already had Alexa and various places the voice recognition was pretty good this one's even better. And I might add that the base is admirable as well. Lots of pretty good quality sound and functional capabilities with this unit. You might even buy another one for a bit more stereo sound.
title: Surprisingly excellent sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: VHV
content: As a sound designer, I spend a lot of time in front of high -end studio monitors. Can echo studio match them? Of course not, but then again, that is not the point (besides being economically impossible). The point is accurate reproduction of a mix, and this device does the job in a very pleasant and unassuming way. With six inch woofer and smartly positioned tweeters, it almost manages to create a stereo image while covering a full spectrum of frequency response. I would expect that paired with another echo studio it could sound better (and more accurate) than many low end, smaller studio monitors, and certainly better than “multimedia” monitors like Mackie CR series etc. The reason for this, besides pretty smart and good engineering, is a built in “room correction” that measures frequency response of your room and adapts echo’s output accordingly. In professional audio, we pay a lot of money for this kind of calibration, and here you get it as if it were nothing. All in all, for the price, this product is pretty amazing.
title: Pretty amazing device

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ronald F. Snoke
content: So far there is nothing to dislike about the Amazon Echo Studio.  I have an Amazon Echo and have been happy with its performance since I purchased it several years ago.  However the sound quality and sometimes the voice recognition was not the best.  It was located in a large open area that includes a large kitchen and living area.  The Amazon Echo Studio now occupies that space and eradicates the issues I had with the smaller Amazon echo.  Voice recognition is exceptional.  I can in a normal tone and volume instruct the Amazon Studio from another room and always get the correct response.  And the sound is extraordinary for a single speaker unit.  I do not have the time to listen to a lot of music, but when I do the sounds from the Echo Studio are excellent.  Aesthetically the unit fits the décor of my living area perfectly.  The Echo Studio flawlessly connected to all my in house devices and makes life much easier for me.  Very happy with the unit.
title: Enhanced sound and voice recognition

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: austinwolf
content: Clear sound, great bass
title: Its good

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: JW
content: I have to be honest, I was hesitant to make this purchase due to the price point, but I'm so glad I did!! The quality of the sound is theater grade, and you pick up so much more with it. I had family over to watch the Polar Express this weekend, and they were all impressed with the sound, even noticing previously unobserved details in the movie because of the heightened sound quality. I'll be purchasing another to complete my home theater experience ASAP!
title: This is a buy now, don't wait!!!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ronald Harris
content: Not too much to add to add to the other 215 reviews. I cant explain the excellent quality any better than what has already been said. Very high-end audio device.  Produces a very wide frequency response at low and hi volume levels.  When placed correctly in a room the sound is expansive and wraps around  you due to is well thought design,  teamed up with the SUB you will have audiophile quality sound.  PRICE is very comfortable for what your getting in quality.  If you demand Hi fidelity sound , here you go...wont go wrong.  Nice Job. Amazon!
title: Another super quality audio device by Amazon, a lot of bang for your bucks!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: R. Langill
content: The low rating is for the volume issues I'm having. When listening to my tv the Echo Studio loses sound, the Echo then has to be reset by disconnecting the power cord. When listening to my fire stick 4k the volume resets to zero. I turn the volume back up and it will again reset to zero. This does this a few times and will correct itself or I will have to reset the Echo Studio by disconnecting the power cord.
title: Volume Issues

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Stephen Vanek
content: Two months after I bought and set up the Echo Studio the red ring of light (so devilish)  came on and the microphone stopped working. Alexa no longer listened to me.  The published solution is to push the microphone button which unmutes the microphone which I’ve somehow muted. But when I push the button for four seconds she searches for a WiFi network.  I bought Alexa to listen to me and despite my considerable research and pressing all of her buttons in various combinations the ring of red light remains. Sad. I feel rejected. She, at least, remains a lovely blue tooth speaker.
title: Refuses to listen- red ring of light

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Music Dude
content: It was excited. But then turned to sadness once I opened and installed the unit.  As an audiophile and gadget guy it "sounded" to good to be true. Everyone said. "hey where's the bass sound" so they threw in a bass speaker. But no matter how you tune.  Volume low Got nice crisp high range but muffled bass Turn it up. Bass over powers with it's muffled bass. And no high end Tried to go to their app and tune. Couldn't get around the lack of balance Going back to my little tall echo. Crisper cleaner sound. And I can do without the muffled bass and a heck of a better orice
title: Lacked balance

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Dr J
content: It's a nice speaker, but as a replacement for my Bose sound bar, uh, not, not the greatest sound. But the Bose shuts off after 30 minutes and you need to really point the controller in the right way to start it up again, so the Bose got exiled into my office. But the Bose had much better sound. I expected more from the Studio, but it is nice and much better than the Echo, which sits sadly on the kitchen counter. I had to call customer support to get it up and running. I like the fact that the Studio permits me to include it in multi-room audio as well as use it as a "Home Theater" (which it is not). Anyway, it is way better than the Echo and serves for TV sound output, but I don't get the nice stereo sound of jets flying across the living room as one would wish. I am considering adding a second Studio to connect in stereo, but that could end in divorce. Does anyone have experience using 2 Studios for stereo? Is it worth it or is it better to get a good sound bar?
title: not as great as I had expected

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: pgeorge08
content: The first official Echo device to feature really great sound. I’ve been looking so long for an Alexa-integrated high-quality speaker, since the Echo and Dot don’t quite achieve that for me, and the fantastic Dolby tech integrated into the speaker pulled me towards the Studio (plus, unlike non-Amazon devices, this being an Echo device means it’s backed by Amazon’s excellent support team. If you’re looking for a speaker with great sound and worth the price, I’d highly recommend this one.
title: Finally, an Amazon Echo device that you’ll want to use as your main speaker system

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: dman
content: Pros: - Sounds excellent! Incredibly good sound! Tight bass, excellent clarity good mdis, and great highs. I am a picky sound person and this really sounds good! So good!!!! - Aesthetics - Looks good! I like the space underneath it. It looks cool and modern! - Buttons are high quality Cons: - I have the first generation echo and I think the mic pics up my voice better for waking up on the first generation echo - I wish the notification light was not recessed and brighter. This sits on my breakfast bar and you can not really see when the unit is activated. On my first gen echo, the light was clearly visible. - I miss the physical round knob for volume that was on the first gen echo. It is so much easier to adjust volume on the first gen echo with the round knob versus the buttons on the echo. Overall, I am really happy with this purchase. The sound is just incredible!  I am going to buy a second unit for my bedroom. Amazon really knows how to make a good product! Way better than the Google Home products that I have.
title: Sounds excellent! I am so happy!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Nick
content: I started with an Echo Dot (3rd Gen) and an Echo Input (connected to my stereo receiver).  I have since added 2 more Echo Dots, an Echo Flex with Motion Sensor, and now the Echo Studio.  The Echo Studio was very easy to setup, looks beautiful, and fills our living room with nice sound.  My one complaint is the microphone doesn't seem to hear commands very well.  Our Echo Dot upstairs will often pickup commands said downstairs, but the Echo Studio seems to have trouble hearing commands said in the same room.  The only other feature I wish it had was Apple Airplay 2. I created a speaker group with the Studio and Echo Input so that I can play music "downstairs" in multiple rooms.  I also created a routine that will turn off all music on all Echo devices, cause sometimes Alexa just gets confused and starts playing out of the wrong device.  So far I have found it very easy to use and very flexible.
title: Great for the Living Room

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: MattInLAX
content: The Echo Plus is a fairly "bass" heavy speaker.  Like lots of its competitors, they emphasize bass, so you think you're getting great sound from a small speaker.  The Studio certainly has an impressive woofer, but it delivers a much more even range across the spectrum of the music being played.  So that should be great, right?  Well, that depends on what you're playing.  If you ask Alexa to play "best of 3D Music" (which Amazon will keep reminding you to do) - OMG - it's fantastic.  But then check on the price of a subscription to 3D Music, and not so fantastic.  Regular music through Amazon Music Unlimited is a lot flatter.  But then I do a bluetooth to my phone and play from my YouTube Music Premium account, and it sound great.  So I can't help but wonder why Amazon Music sounds worse than that.  It seems to be a push for you to get the 3D Music subscription.  That's why I give 4 stars.  Otherwise it works well as an Alexa device and the mics are very sensitive. By the way Amazon - time for some new "wake word" options.  You want us to load up on devices that end up being close to one another, and yet you have 4 wake words, and 2 of those are not easy to say.
title: Certainly an exponential improvement over Echo Plus for sound, BUT...

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: D. W.
content: i’m very picky about audio and this just isn’t doing it for me. MAYBE if it was in a perfectly square room it might sound better? i’m not a fan of the “stereo spatial enhancement”, you lose things in the music. with that enhancement turned off it still doesn’t sound that great, it’s very mid heavy. you really only get good rich bass on songs that are already bass heavy otherwise you don’t get much at all. The songs that are mastered in 3-D don’t impress me at all. I would DEFINITELY purchase two third gen Echo’s and the sub over this. i’ll just Bluetooth the audio from my echo show to my sound bar and save the $200.
title: Not a Fan

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: J. Olson
content: I bought the Echo Studio in early April along with a FireTV Cube so that I could have easy voice control over my TV, and good quality sound without spending an arm and leg on the sound quality (like with Bose, Sonos, or other highly rated soundbars with Alexa integrated). Setup was very easy as with other Echo products. But setup and pairing with the FireTV cube was a bit more complex and confusing - took a good 5 minutes. The Studio speaker is not listed in the FireTV soundbar options, only a generic Amazon soundbar. So I was concerned whether everything would work correctly. For the first few days, everything worked beautifully, just as I had expected. After using it for a few days with the FireTV, Cube we noticed that the audio would just cut out for a couple seconds in the middle of someone saying something on a show. Had to rewind so you could understand what was going on. It didn't seem to matter whether the show was on HBO Now, Netflix, or Amazon Prime. Very annoying. The frequency and amount of time the sound would cut out got worse the longer we used the speaker. To solve the problem, I had to reset the speaker and re-pair it with the Cube - not something you want to deal with in the middle of a show. I put up with this for another week or so, as it seemed to work OK for several days at time. Then when I was trying to reset/re-pair with the Cube, the speaker would say "Sorry, the internet is not available right now". That wasn't true because the Cube was connected over the same Wi-Fi router in the same room. For some reason, it would not recognize my Wi-Fi router. The only way to fix this was to unplug the speaker and start all over again. This happened a couple more times so I gave up and decided to return the speaker. FireTV Cube works great, but not with the Studio speaker. I'm going to break down and spend the extra cash on a Sonos soundbar.
title: Sound cuts out & back in while watching a show, keeps dropping Wi-Fi connection

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Kenneth D (Dallas, TX)
content: It's bigger than I thought. The bass and treble, well it hits high highs and low lows, but the mid range is rather muddy. I imagine they can fix that with software after feedback encourages them.  3D sound is cool, but there is little content at this juncture. Only had it a day and my neighbors know I have it. It is by far the best sound device in the Echo series. I initially gave this 5 stars. Came back to give it 4 stars then while writing the part of the review below I changed it to three stars. After using it a bit the sound levels are so inconsistent that the unit requires constant attention.  Played songs by Maurice Ravel. It started with Bolero. I didn't hear anything until finally I heard the faint whispers of the song. So I said next song. Impressions de France came up loud and clear. This happened with multiple other songs. One song played, I adjusted the volume. The next song came on either a great deal louder or lower. This has happened several times. Update 10/28/2020 Changed my review to 2 stars. My Echo dot in the bathroom, on the other side of the apartment understands me. But neither Echo Studio understands me that well. It is so inconsistent as a speaker system and voice control. Frustrating...
title: Bigger than I thought
