product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Liz D
content: This is no louder or better than my echo plus.  The first day I had problems with the sound going up and down.  I’ve got six echo dots, 2 echo 2nd gen, 3 echo 3rd gen, 1 echo plus, a few echo inputs and an echo show in every room.  I love all of them except this one.  It is a huge disappointment. Update.  A week or so after my review Amazon called and was able to walk me threw something that helped the volume problem. Tonight I moved the Studio to my Den and set up a Home Theater with my Fire TV 4K.  OK, what a difference in the sound.  I previously had an old Bose 5 speaker and bass home theater set up to my tv.  There is no comparison to the sound I am getting with the Echo Studio.  I can feel the bass and the sound is so clear.  No more need for close captioning to read what didn’t come through clear enough on the Bose.  I am so impressed.  I will for sure be getting another Echo Studio to pair with it.  Can’t imagine what that will sound like.
title: Echo Studio is AWESOME

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Sergio
content: You guys..... help me! I have a few echos throughout the house, from the plus to the show and the latest one is the Echo Studio. I’ve had the worst time with music streaming. I’ve upgraded to all the premium memberships. HD, family plan, unlimited we’re purchased because echos weren’t playing music in different rooms with the membership I had before. So I upgrade to the best so I can enjoy and it’s been so glitchy and totally not HD sounding. I’ve compared the same songs on amazon and Apple Music and Apple Music has the incredible clarity and rich defined sounds on several songs. Apple Music doesn’t even advertise “ultra hd” or whatever and their music is SOOOO much better. Unfortunately I’ve purchased so many echoes and smart home items that I will not return them all like I did last year.  This time around I’m having a horrible problem where my echoes play explicit songs bleeped! What actual f word????? AMAZON, really???? I have called tech support several times and they’ve guided to turn off the filter (not like I hadn’t done that a million times before) such a turn off, amazon! We pay extra for HD and sounds sub par, tired in several speakers and Apple Music sounds way better. And another thing is the false advertising. I’ve had several songs clearly indicating explicit and then the words are bleeped. I can’t 😔
title: Explicit filter does not work!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: skisan
content: Simply put, not worth the price. The speaker lacks consistent volume output. A device this expensive should have an internal volume stabilizer so all music plays at the actual volume you select. As for the sound, look it's only going to be as good as what it receives and if you're going to be listening to music from the Amazon music playlist, you will really be disappointed. Little care goes into actually matching the mood or category you select and even then this speaker lacks clarity and definition, let alone adequate bass without pushing it. True, the Studio has its own HUB and that's a plus, but, so too, does the Echo. All in all. It's an average sound and does not give good base unless played at a level greater than, I suspect, most people care to listen to. Spend $200 if you feel the need, as I did. I only hope you're not as disappointed as I am.
title: Disappointing sound.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ashley Jenne
content: We have had this for like 4 months its amazing sound... But for some reason I needed a extra cord that doesnt come with it to hook it up to our brandnew 4k tv shame on Amazon then on top of that... The sound dissapears all the time forcing me to get up from my seat... Unplug it and plug it back in very frustrating having to to do this several times a week if not more... It was alot of money for it to come without the ability to hookup via blutooth or at least come with the damh cord u need to hook it up to the tv the reason why I gave it as many stars is the sound is better than anything u can buy out there its amazing sound I may buy a second one just for that movie theater feel ... Even tho u need a cord for it. Amazon please fix this ... I guess u dont need a cord if have a fire tv ... Didnt know that
title: Love it but.....

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ola Tungee
content: I purchased 3 units and am still becoming acquainted with the system. However, thus far the sound is awesome, especially so when playing HD and 3D music but in truth, everything sounds better. The Amazon 'Ambient' station features a delightful selection of all HD music and consequently my listening seems to be migrating to it almost exclusively. Amazon's 3D enabled music selections seem more raucous and  'contemporary' but still the listening experience is excellent there as well. My one negative, and this has nothing to do with the Echo Studio speaker, Amazon's music frequently doesn't play through the entire music selection and skips mid-song to another selection. This is apparently not a function of our personal wireless network as our Sirius XM Echo Studio connection plays consistently and fully through the Sirius music selections, never a premature skip.
title: A Remarkable Listening Experience...

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Prestige PRIME Shopper
content: OMG I’m beyond impressed!! This thing had superseded my expectations and then some! Watching movies on the 4K Fire TV stick is something else! You can hear every single sound, note & melody flying all around your head and let’s not forget the bass! It is clean and does not distort! Each time it pounds your chest pounds with it! Also amazon music HD unlimited is amazing with the speaker! HD, Super HD & 3D HD music blows my mind away! I will be purchasing another one soon! I was so impressed I purchased the Echo Sub to pair with it, that will be delivered tomorrow! My room is going to be bumping and slapping so hard! All while crystal clear! Mind boggling!!
title: I have it paired to 2 Echo Studios, Echo Subwoofer 🔊 & 4K Fire TV & it’s mind boggling! 🎶 🔊 🎶

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tyler Forge
content: I got carried away during the “Amazon day” sale and bought two more echo studios thinking I could do a three way pairing with the one I already have. Nope, you can only pair two into a stereo thing us. Which sounds fine and all. I think what I really wanted was to add in a thumps bass. A real bass with a big ol’ speaker. Way bigger than in the studio. Over all, these echo studios are performing as expected and I expect a lot. I’ve been using various echo units for years and have been migrating toward more of the more capable ones. Seems reasonable because the things keep getting upgrades and more capabilities. Meanwhile, I use them for more stuff. A virtuous cycle. Hey Amazon engineers -  I want to receive VOIP calls on these via my old POTS phone number. Can you make that happen?
title: Mostly happy with it

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Red Rob
content: This is replacing a 1st gen Echo in a very large room. The sound quality is much better and it does OK for a huge room where the original Echo was weak and tinny. Unfortunately it is really buggy. It becomes unresponsive and needs to by unplugged and plugged back in at least once every 2 days. Also the volume is really inconsistent. Sometimes Alexa is whispering, and each response can have very different volumes. For example when asking Alexa questions she might answer in her current volume, but if instead she reads something from the news or from Wikipedia the volume may be much louder. Depending on the station music might be either very faint or very loud compared to Alexa's responses. Overall it is probably worth the Prime day 2020 price of $150 but could be much better. The problems do seem to be software related though so hopefully it will get better in the future, although the Studio has already been out a year.
title: Buggy and inconsistent volume - Nice speaker though

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tom
content: I love the sound coming out of this for Amazon video programs that support the dolby Atmos.  I then wanted to see how it works as a PC speaker. I purchased the optical cable with the 3.5mm end for connecting to the Studio. Not Bad as a PC speaker. It does duty wirelessly for Amazon shows on my HDTV and wire connection for the PC.
title: Connected to Echo cube and PC

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: James Burlander
content: First I have to thank the awesome customer service at Amazon, my shipment of the Echo Studio was pushed way back - so they refunded my shipping cost. My Echo Studio arrived yesterday.. I've been hunting for a decent, but sleek, stereo system for my master bedroom. For anyone who uses a small bluetooth speaker - they may be good, but they're not great... especially in the bass/sub-woofer category. I plugged in the Echo Studio and it immediately went through the boot-up and set-up process. Within a minute of it talking to my iPhone's Alexa app, it was on my secured home wifi network. It did a system upgrade quietly and rebooted itself... after that, setup was done. Man oh man this thing sounds phenomenal! For "one" speaker (with a bunch of tiny speakers inside) - its spatial stereo sound is nearly jaw-dropping. I had Alexa play me some of their "3D Music" - and you can tell it's been specifically mastered for a speaker like the Echo Studio. You can fine-tune the speaker with a three band EQ within the app as well. I recommend this speaker for sure... it's got wifi, bluetooth, and an AUX input if you need it.
title: The Echo Studio Is Worth It

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Kenbola
content: Seriously nice sounding speaker! nice job Amazon! Speaker is 100 times better than an echo spot 3rd gen. im only listening to a single speaker set up.  it actually sounds close to stereo.  you can hear the soundstage.  bass is pretty clean.  im anxious to pair it with a second speaker for true stereo.  i see it has mini 3.5 optical in. haven’t heard of this but if you can do audio out from tv or cablebox that would cool for mini home theater set up.  i also havent had any issues with audio dropping out but i’ll follow up after i have this a few weeks.
title: Big upgrade

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Raymond W. Kent
content: The Future Value of $179 for five years until now is $202, so from my perspective I paid more for my retro Echo, and got so much less. But in technology time 5 years is a long time, and now I have so much more than I got with my original Echo. I have watched as the number of things that Echo can do has grown past my needs. Did anyone know that you can ask your Echo what the Net Worth of most celebrities is, and get an answer, or how tall they are, or what year they where born, and usually get an answer.  My new Echo Studio has its own electronics Hub built in to it, and it has much better speakers, more of them, and in a configuration that provides a board listening stage, with much more accuracy, and real bass too.  From my point of view, the new Echo Studio is just short of a miracle.  But using any Echo is a matter of experience, and seeking to know the capabilities. Buy a new Echo Studio NOW.
title: Echo Studio is a Quantum Leap beyond my original Echo, which retailed for $179.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Cody W.
content: Ordered the Echo Studio last night and received it today, setup took all of 2 minutes because we already have several Echo devices and an account. I’m pretty blown away with the sound this Studio produces. I purchased it to “replace” our Echo Plus in our living room and it’s incredible how much better, and louder, it is over the Echo Plus. I was also surprised at its size (see photo comparing the Echo Plus to Echo Studio). Overall very satisfied with it! Sounds better than ANY other Echo device we have (have 2 dots, 2 spots, 1 plus). Putting the Studio in our living room and the Plus in the kitchen in a speaker group fills our entire first floor with the quality sound. Don’t forget to adjust the equalizer in the Alexa app to increase bass, miss and treble to your liking!
title: Sounds awesome - better than Echo Plus!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: LaurieBSmith
content: We are returning the Studio.  Neither of us like it at all, for several reasons. First, it does not hear us or understand what we are saying and we speak ordinary plain English. I don't care to shout at my Alexa.  Second, the sound is better but not $200's worth.  Third, it integrated with the Fire Cube (which is also going back) and did almost nothing without repeated commands,  I don't want to shout at my TV either. Four, one cannot see the lights and that's just dumb design. This is my fourth Echo, and I thought I was stepping up to replace my big ole first generation, but I am truly sorry I tried. I do not recommend and figure we need to wait for another generation or two, especially one with a proper design.  I gave it a generous three stars, but I think it's a bad item, not yet ready for consumers who are familiar with Alexa and use it a lot.
title: I really dislike it

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Bumper Warehouse
content: I bought two of these and the Echo Sub and they sound great. I only hope the neighbor doesn't hear the sub. Maybe I shouldn't worry about it. The Echo Studio pair without the "Sub" base unit sound great on their own, just not as much bass. I love the fact that i can adjust the sound with the equalizer on my Echo app. (treble, mid-range, and bass) I recommend. I had the first generation Echo which I still love, and i have the Prime music subscription which is great with some 20 million cd's to play. With this you have a "library" on line and create your own play lists.
title: Great sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ernst Bakerquist
content: We have a variety of Alexa devices - and love them. Took advantage of a deal to get a Studio, Show 5, and a Hue bulb for $199. Moved our ‘original’ Alexa from the living room to the wife’s office and put the new Studio in its spot. Took 3 minutes to set up and run the EQ check. BIG Pandora users, and typically play stations through home theater A/V receiver. (Denon AVR...marvelous machine) Now listening to one of our favorite stations via the new Studio...WOW. Quite good for a single column of parts. The much hyped 3D sound is not that apparent yet. Tried the suggested playlist and it was just annoying. BUT, the music we are playing sounds wonderful. Now, I wouldn’t have normally spent $200 on a speaker with limited use. That said, the bundle deal was great and there is ZERO regret for this purchase.
title: Amazing sound from a small package

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tim G.
content: I don't want to draw this review out so I will just get to the point. My wife got me the Studio for Christmas because I wanted to use it in home as the central Sound system for the main area of the house as we have an open floor plan. This one speaker fills our whole upstairs with plenty of sound for us. The problem is that when I went to bluetooth it to my new Samsung Qled TV it pairs just fine but will not play the audio from my TV. I tried for hours to trouble shoot the problem unpairing and re-pairing, changing audio stream formats, even factory resets a couple times but nothing. We own Echo Dot(s), Echo Plus, Echo, Echo Tap, 2 4K Fire Sticks, and Fire Tv Cube. As a test, I paired one of our Echo Dots and the Echo Tap to this TV and it worked just fine. So I gave up and called support. They informed me that this flagship $200.00 Echo Studio Speaker cannot be paired to a TV without the use of an Amazon Fire Stick/Fire Cube. That is just crazy to me. Why can I pair my $29.99 Echo Dot to my TV (Which no one would do) but not this $200 speaker? It took me literally half a day to reconfigure the devices around my house to get the Fire Cube into my living room and set up with the Studio. There is no reason for this, it says right on the box that it supports DOLBY ATMOS, so why do I need to pair it to a Fire product??? Anyways, I just wanted to write this review for anyone looking at this speaker to do what we are using it for and does not feel like dealing with the headache. If I did not already own a Fire Cube and I was not able to rearrange my setup to keep everything working pretty much the same at the end of the day I would have returned it and gave it a 2 star. Which is too bad because now that it's set up it's doing and sounding like what we wanted.
title: Decent Sound but will not pair with a TV without the use of a Fire product.(Per Support)

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Areviewer
content: Really like this speaker. The sound is the best I have ever had on any device. Alexa isn't as smart sometimes as I wish she would be. I also, wish you could change her name to more than the options available.  I finally need a catalogue of sorts on what is available with amazon unlimited besides everything. Other than those ideas this is an awesome device. The news briefs are fun. The songs unbelievable. The price is quite reasonable.  I think I would go so far as to say this is the best amazon device on the market in terms of quality and price. The speakers work great together. The subwoofer has excellent deep base. I looked up songs on the browser to see which test the quality of the speaker and found some awesome songs for the tweeters and woofers. Really an enjoyable experience. A must have for anybody that loves music.
title: Excellent Sound in our Living Room

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Bernard Eisenfeld
content: The sound quality is simply excfellent. Now this bad boy is perhaps 2-3 times larger than it's smaller cousins so think about where you want to put it. The soundbar for my TV was nearly two thousand dollars but I believe pairing two Echo Studios would give me better sound at less than half the price.
title: THE KING OF ALEXA SPEAKERS

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Balu
content: I bought this smart speaker as prime day deal, In my mind I had more expectations that are not reached up to the mark that's the only reason I'm giving 4 stars . Actually I bought this speaker for my projector and expected good home theater sound but its not as expected but when we see it as induvial smart speaker then its good. For my projector I used Amazon fire stick and amazon speaker. As "Smart" devices FireStick should integrate(connect) with speaker but that is lagging. Thats the Alexa integration given 4 stars. Coming to sound quality. No doubt sound quality is very good but at this price range we should have more volume of sound. I'm using  8 or 9 pts of sound out of10 pts to enjoy the music.. Actually by using 6 or 7 points volume we should get expected volume level. Overall product is good if it is around 120 to 130 price range if more than that... better find alternative if you have concern  particularly about volume levels.
title: Good speaker but should be more smart

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Frank
content: I recently cancelled cable and purchased Fire TV Cube to stream.  The cube has decent sound but does not bring home theatre quality entertainment.  I purchased the Echo Studio and Wow!  The Echo Studio is great and integrates perfectly with Fire TV Cube and Alexa. We enjoy movies with surround sound and booming audio.  The 3D audio blew me away when listening to Amazon music.  We actually tend to watch less TV because of the enjoyment of having the Echo Studio.  Many evenings the wife and I will ask Alexa to play a variety of music while we chill.  My wife will ask Alexa to play an upbeat song in the morning and force me to dance with her until the song is complete.  Good excdercise and gets you moving in the morning before work.  I highly recommend the Echo Studio for hours upon hours of entertainment.
title: Great sound and works well with Fire Cube

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Lawrence L.
content: I bought the Echo Studio to connect to my 43” Insignia Fire TV but the only way I can get it to work is via Bluetooth. Bluetooth works fine for music, but for regular tv programs I have a terrible lip sync problem that I have been unable to solve. Others have the same problem. The only solution might be to connect a separate fire stick to the TV so that I can get audio via WiFi, not Bluetooth. The Studio works fine, but not as a speaker for Indignia Fire TV. It looks like Amazon is not supporting the Fire Tv app built into a smart Insignia Fire TV.
title: Echo Studio as speaker for Insignia Fire TV

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: John C.
content: Purchased this so I could pair this with my Fire TV 4K.  The audio cuts out for a second or two every few minutes.  I contacted support which they had factory reset it, but the same issues exists.  After researching online, I see a lot of customers have this issue.  I don't know if this is a hardware issue or a software problem, but it's a problem.  I don't think it is a hardware problem since streaming music works flawlessly.  When I have the Fire TV 4K play audio from the TV speakers, there is no audio cut out.
title: Audio cuts out for a second or two every few minutes

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: jarreeddd
content: Amazon really came through with this product. A few things to take into consideration: Sound Quality: While the sound quality is extremely good, especially given the price range, it’s definitely not on the top of the audiophile list. That being said, for the average person, this is a great speaker. It lacks luster in the mids so lyrics themselves aren’t as crisp as other high fidelity speakers on the market. However, the bass is awesome. No distortion. Also, this thing gets LOUD. Great for a house party or if you feel like rocking out. Alexa: While this may not be the BEST speaker out there, the Alexa integration and capability is great. The mics will pick up your voice from across the room even with music blasting. If you’re a heavy Alexa user then the great sound quality and seamless Alexa integration makes this the speaker for you. I personally run all my smart home devices through Alexa so having one more assistant in the room is great. Size: This speaker is chubby. Kind of looks like a chopped off robot head. It will definitely not just blend in the background. I have it on the corner of my desk 60x30 and still have plenty of room multiple screens and peripherals. Room adaptation: This speaker will definitely fool the room with sound. As far as the “3D Sound goes”, it’s really going to depend on the placement and structure of the room. If you place this in the corner of a room and try to listen to it from the opposite corner, you do loose some of that full sound effect. Also, the size and material of your room are going to effect the acoustics and how the sound bounces off the walls. It seems you really only get that full 3D sound effect if it’s directly in front of you and you have 4 solid walls for the sound to bounce off of. I have mine on the corner of the desk with the front speaker facing me. When I’m sitting at my desk I really get the full 3D effect. To manually reset/calibrate to a room hold down the command button for about 15 seconds. 3D MUSIC: This speaker performs optimally when playing 3D Music from Amazon. Something to keep in mind though is that there are only about 1,000+ 3D song a offered. Who knows what the future has in store but that shouldn’t be the selling point if you’re looking at this speaker. Either way, you’re still getting great sound from any music app. Built in Zigbee: I don’t use any zigbee devices so I can’t comment on this. I also couldn’t figure out how it really works. Competition: For the same prize you could purchase a smaller Sonos One. Which one has better sound quality is up for debate but what’s lacking in the Sonos is Bluetooth connectivity. Also, the built in Alexa is limited. Using it as a sound bar: I personally only use this for listening to music while I’m at my desk. I can’t really see this being better than a a bar and subwoofer around the same price range or even slightly more expensive. I think it would work great with two Studio’s but then again ... there might be better options at that price range. User preference. Summary: I truly am impressed with this speaker and really enjoy using it. If you’re a casual music listener Like me and currently or plan to utilize Alexa, this is a great speaker. If you really want to fill the room then I would consider buying two and strategically placing them somewhere in the desired room.
title: Great Smart Speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jonathan Murphy
content: WARNING. Do not buy the Echo Studio if you want to hook up other echo devices to it thinking you can create a surround sound system. The Echo Studio IS NOT compatible with two Echo Dots. I was told by my local Best Buy that if you have a Fire Stick, you can create a home theater with the Echo Studio + (2) Echo Dots. This will not work. Unless someone can assist me on figuring it out, it is not possible. This was very disappointing.
title: Echo Studio no compatible with Echo Dots

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: A Stewart
content: I purchased two of these to compliment my FireTV 4k setup and 85" LG 4k TV. Well, the sound is just okay and the whole 3D sound/home theatre concept is not apparent to me whatsoever. I am no audiophile, but as a layperson I am unimpressed for the $400 investment. With that said, my actual complaint is that it is a CONSTANT in and out connection with the FireTV...near constant crackle, repeat noises and missing sounds. I have to unplug it, and wait for it to reconnect and then have to deal with the voice/sound being off. Frankly, I am disappointed. I expected it to work flawlessly with another Amazon product...it does not. Also, note that the speakers flank the TV so it's not a "too far from the FireTV" issue. It's become so annoying that will most likely replace them. Think long and hard if you plan to use it as a home theatre system. You've been warned!
title: Meh - don't have high expectations if you're connecting to FireTV!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: PC Guy
content: Great addition as assistant for your home. When on your network it can help with answers to thousands of questions. The unit fits into your life anywhere. I put it at a central area so you can hear music on the ground level and the first floor. Sound from music is very impressive; for the size of the unit. We have an echo dot in the living room to eliminate shouting at the studio. The echo dot & the studio are synced as one, if you start a timer on the studio and you’re in the living room the dot will tell you the remaining time. Also, either unit can do other tasks in independently. The studio has better sound; it’s also more expensive. I would purchase the studio again, yes, it’s expensive, I’m more interested in good sound. For me it was the right purchase.
title: Great addition as assistant

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Dennis D.
content: I'm updating my review again. I tried two regular Fire Sticks and neither worked without distortion. Went through a few optical cables and that didn't work. I ended up buying a 4K Fire Stick and an Ethernet adapter. The audio hasn't dropped or distorted yet, so switching to the 4K seems to have solved that problem. I still can't get the Fire Stick remote to control the Studio, but that's a different issue. No audio distortion is a win. The issue now is that the sound gets out of sync. I have to disconnect the Fire Stick and Studio and reconnect them in the Alexa app to fix it. The sound is good when it works, but it's been a weeks long, fiddly process to get the thing to work. And only sometimes at that. I definitely regret the purchase of the Studio. I'd return it if I could.
title: Finally got it to work... kind of

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Shibaguyz
content: We added the Echo Studio to our home network of Echo devices as the main device on the main floor of our townhouse. We have three other devices of different sizes on two other floors of our home. The sound quality of the Echo Studio is by far superior to even the most current version of the Echo towers and, when linked to the other devices and played all together, our house literally sings. The Echo Studio calibrates itself to the room it is in and the resulting sound quality is immersive and does justice to our wide range of musical tastes. We initially tested the sound on classic rock, dance, orchestral, choral, country, and pop. We play music and audiobooks on our devices daily and love how this device enhances our overall listening experience. The one feature we miss on this device versus the towers is the ability to check the temperature in the room it sets in. But that’s it. Love it. Would buy another one. Looking forward to the next upgrade.
title: Enhanced music experience

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Gary Durham
content: When I first saw and read everything I could find about the Echo Studio speakers I thought they would be a game changer.  Well, I still like them very much but with a very disappointing discovery.  After setting up 7 Studio stereo sub pairs, 1 pair of stereo Dot speakers, and a Netgear mesh range extender (total of 23 Echo device's) THEY WILL NOT ALL PLAY THE SAME THING AT THE SAME TIME.  That's the reason I bought them in the first place.  Customer service techs have told me Amazon has a limit of 10 devises'.  SUPRISE SUPRISE.  Now I'm angry that I have to adide buy a seemingly arbitrary Amazon decision.  I always try to be a positive person but from now on I will always resent Amazon's arbitrary decision to limit the number of device's that can be connected to 1 account.  IS THERE ANY SOLUTION TO THIS SITUATION?
title: VERY DISAPPOINTED CUSTOMER.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Cody Bellenir
content: I purchased two studios and an echo sub because my smart household is.l basically ran by Amazon. I really enjoy watching movies and TV but also listen to a lot of music and am pretty picky about good sound. I can safely say that I firmly believe this $500 combo (purchased on Black Friday) is likely better than most setups you could purchase with the same amount of money. I have never listened to the Homepod but I have listened to the Sonos One. Yes the Sonos One and Homepod both likely sound better than the Studio if you are critically listening. However, I do know that the difference is not so significant that I regret my purchase. It was a little difficult to set up the speakers to my fire stick 4k at first because it was my first time doing it. For some reason the speakers would show as unavailable and I didn't understand why. I contacted Amazon support and they helped me troubleshoot the issue and I had it up and running in less than 10 minutes. Movie sounds quality is night and day compared to the speaker on my TV. The experience has been seamless since they've been set up. The only thing that disappointed me was how little of a selection there is as far as Dolby Atmos streaming because as of right now Amazon only supports Atmos on prime video titles. I wish you could take advantage of Atmos on Netflix and other streaming services but hopefully with time they will work something out as far as that goes. Movies still sound amazing but that would've been nice to have seeing as the main selling point is their "3D sound". Overall these speakers in a 2.1 setup with the echo sub sound amazing and provide an excellent value for the money and I would highly recommend it. Totally worth it if you have Amazon Music HD.
title: Two studios + echo sub = amazing experience.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Denise Greene
content: We use this as our main source of music. As to immersive sound quality, it’s fantastic, but We had to adjust it’s height to find where that perfect spot was. My husband is an audiophile, and he is quite satisfied with Echo Studio’s sound quality. The challenge has been with Alexa. My husband was ready to send it back until we found that the best way to select music is from our iPhones. It was maddening when we would ask for a particular album cut. It seemed Alexa could usually find the album, but if we asked for a stand-alone song from the album, she couldn’t find it. I do love that she can create playlists or that you can be awakened with the songs of your choice instead of an alarm. I’m much more energized that way.
title: Even an audiophile can find this satisfying

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: MonsieurGlemaud
content: This was a bit of a letdown. I was excited to get it but it just doesn't provide the boom I expected. Voice activation of Alexa doesn't work from a distance while the system is at a high volume. I bought this thing to only work at high volumes so it sucks that Alexa doesn't wake up when I need it most. Another issue is it's ability (or inability) to connect to other Alexa devices. When connected it to the fire tv it would sound great but would constantly disconnect or reconnect with no sound. Sadly, it's just inconsistent. Lastly, the sound isn't that great. Compared to most soundbars, its a great competitor, but if you have a decent (5.1) sound system it doesn't compare. If you have a recent generation Echo and a good sound system, just connect your Echo to the system with an aux cord (with male connectors on both sides). You won't regret it. You can connect your fire tv to it and get surrounded sound without connecting directly to the TV. Alexa voice wakes up from anywhere in a 20×20 room. Plan and simple, there are better options. Hopefully the next generation will have less issues.  And yes my picture is deliberately upside-down to show a frown with the Amazon logo
title: Just okay

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Alex
content: Really wanted to love it. The sound as speakers are incredible.  Full sound in the highs and lows. Also purchased the subwoofer which adds even better bass. Why I don’t love it, well I purchased the set specifically as a home theatre system. When it works, the sound is incredible.  Unfortunately it disconnects from my 4K firetv constantly. Just about everyday, half way through the movie. So I’m left having to stop it and restart it so it reconnects.  I’ve gotten to the point where I’ve umpaired my 4K firetv from the speakers because it was so annoying.
title: Great speakers not great home theatre

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: AudioPhile
content: This does not having enough mid range nor does it have clarity. It gets loud but that's it. The single tweeter is way to directional any shift to any side that you move and it instantly sounds muffled. Decent bass but again no mid range so you have directional highs no mids and low end I hope amazons next generation adds more tweeters mids and better DSP. If all you care about is output you will love this. Anyone who knows quality sound balanced sound will hate this.
title: Not impressed

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: RT
content: I have echo and echo dot in the house.  The studio was a replacement for the dot in my bedroom, and frankly I’m very disappointed with the studio sound/bass.  Studio is pla mid-room, on a dresser, 3D is turned off, and bass in Alexa app is set at highest setting. I run it about volume 4 or 5, not ‘party’ loud.  It  doesn’t really sound better (bass) than the dot!  I should return it, but I’ve tried living with it for a week and its now used.  Hate to see it go to land-fill.  For comparison, I have a Marshall stanmore blue tooth speaker in my garage, admittedly costs $100 more but it has same size speakers and it’s awesome - I suspect the amp is a lot better....  I also have a Bose ‘sound Link color’ $99 for my kitchen TV, its more compact and sounds better than the studio.  I wished I would have shopped a bit more and compared to Sonos, but online the Studio ratings were good and  I was looking for the seamless Alexa experience of an amazon device, which I got, but the sound, base in particular, doesn’t cut it...
title: Surprisingly, really Not much better than my echo dot

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Erik V.
content: So we have several different style echos, including the old original echo. Our original echo is years old and while we loved it for its loudness and overall quality, this one blows it away. The 1st thing I tested and LOVED was that even with music at full volume, it still hears you. Our original echo could not hear you when the music is at full blast and you'd have to bust out the phone and use the app to get it to stop or push the button. 2nd, the music quality is GREAT. Studio quality, no, but love it and the bass is impressive for such a small unit. We originally were going to order an eco sub to sync to it but after hearing it, the sub is not needed. We like it so much we're considering buying more and placing them throughout the whole  house! Highly recommend it
title: Works GREAT!!! Finally a loud one that can still hear you!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Zach Mutchie
content: I really thought the sound of this speaker was top notch, especially for the price. If you plan to only use this as a music speaker, you'll be impressed. If you're hoping to use this for TV or movie audio I would recommend looking elsewhere. We connected ours to a Firestick 4k and the general functionality was pretty cool, although setup was more complicated than it should have been. Audio for shows on various platforms (Prime, Hulu, Netflix) cut out constantly, to the point that we were continuously having to rewind to see what we missed. In addition to the cutting out, there were multiple times that the sound would stop all together. Amazon support was eager to help. We spent over an hour trouble shooting but unfortunately nothing seemed to do the trick. Ended up returning the speaker all together after ~10 days. Might be worth looking at again if there is a software update or perhaps version 2.
title: Amazing sound for music, but cuts out constantly if linked to TV/Firestick

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Mark
content: If trying to replace a soundbar, do not buy these.  I got one when it first was announced, and a second as you definitely want stereo sound.  But I now write this out of frustration with this product.  I have both of mine setup in the same room and paired with each other.  Also created a “home theatre” group.  Works when I first set it up.  When I am finished and go back to it I have no sound.  The only way for me to get sound, is to reset both devices, unpair my “home theatre” group and do it all over again as a brand new unit.  It’s super frustrating.  Every time! Also, I have my gaming console plugged in to one of the speakers through optical fiber.  I get the same results.  I was using it fine last night.  Just turned everything on, and I have no sound.  How is this possible when it is directly plugged in? I am officially tired of dealing with these and not having sound.  Get a real pair speakers or a soundbar if that’s your thing.  I am gonna move on from these as a “home theatre” setup.  It simply does not work.
title: Not for Home Theatre Use

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jeffrey Walker
content: I love Alexa, and this just reinforces my decision to go with the Amazon ecosystem.  I've been an Alexa user since the beginning (I still have my first beta Echo), and Alexa keeps getting better.  I love the full sound of the Echo studio.  I have an Echo subwoofer on order and am looking forward to pairing the two together.  I have a set of Klipsch audio speakers for my computer that sits on the same desk, and I've considered replacing them with the Echo Studio plus subwoofer. My wife and I use Alexa for everything from reminders to alarms and timers, shopping lists and home automation (lights, furnace, A/C, etc) and I would have to say I'm 90% pleased with the system.  Any disappointment I have would be related to the fact that there are times I have to repeat myself when giving Alexa a command.  I honestly haven't had time to investigate whether this is room placement or Alexa itself. This round of Echo devices has been epic!  I can't wait to try some of the others, such as the Echo show with the screen that follows the subject to the security drone that's been promised for the near future. Amazon has definitely hit a home run with this series of Echo devices!
title: Great sound, Awesome features!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: R@UL'S OPNION
content: The Echo Studio is way louder than all the other echoes with superb vocals, which reproduce clearly but with room for improvements. The good: The product itself is impressive. As an audiophile, I love the way this smart speaker sounds. It has the right balance of bass with excellent mid-tones and trebles out of the box. Volume: As I mentioned before, it is loud enough to feel the music or to throw a party. I can see that pairing two of them will create enough volume for a large room when positioned correctly. Streaming: I can pair my SiriusXM and Spotify with no problem. Apple Music tested and no issues either. It’ll play music according to where it is available. For example, if I ask for a popular song, Amazon Music will probably have it, but when it comes to specific songs, Spotify will be your streaming service. The bad: Streaming Volumes: The music will play alright, but having different streaming services will mean that each of them has a different volume output. I find Spotify louder that SiriusXM. So adjusting the volume sometimes does bother me. I would like the Echo to analyze the volume input for every service and then output it at the same standard volume and even amplify it so that it can sound equal to the others. Voice recognition: Even though this speaker has more microphones around, I still experience problems when calling Alexa to turn on and off the lights. I have to raise my voice, even though my room is small. But don’t let this bring you down, it could be that I’m not clear enough. I sometimes speak fast. Sometimes calling for a specific song in Spotify from X artist will not work; it’ll instead play the This is X artist on Spotify. The vocals are reproduced easily on this speaker. However, I find it 4/5 on vocal reproduction. The vocals sound like if they were in the middle of the stage and not out in the front. Otherwise, I believe you will not go wrong with this premium speaker. Amazon will probably update them in 1 or 2 years.
title: Loud and superb speaker, vocals are clear but with room for improvements.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Dave
content: Very good sound for the size and power. Pairs well with another studio to fill a room.  Wish it would accept bluetooth connections as well. Note, once paired it doesn't seem to be able to act as a speaker for other Echo base systems like Dot or Show. But works well by itself/themselves and sounds great!
title: Pair with another for excellent stereo sound!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jnipper
content: When these first came out I wanted to buy one but decided to wait until some reviews came it. Well the reviews came in and they were terrific and they went on sale so I bought one.  I was not disappointed! It fills a room with music without being overpowering in any one area. I was so impressed I took it over to different friends houses and tried it there, even outside. I really don't know how it does it and don't care. I bought one for my sister (who already has 5 echo's)  and told her if she didn't like it she could just give it to me. Within 2 hours of her getting it she sent me the money. A friend who has a restaurant is replacing her directional speaker system with one of these. A real game changer.
title: Wow!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: John Augustine
content: So I just got it and it sounds really good, I have all the levels from the dot to the echo plus and now this one. It is the best one by far reflected in the price, But I would have to say the Echo plus is still very good and so far (with0ut hearing 3D extra music enhanced sound) Its a pretty good upgrade. Honestly I wish Amazon would just include a few 3d songs for free so as a buyer I could listen for myself but for now it is quite good.
title: It works very well

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Marcus Rosebrock
content: Good soundstage and audio quality if you subscribe to amazon unlimited + HD/SHD. However, this speaker sounds very ordinary with lower quality audio sources. It’s a studio speaker that reveals the flaws and brilliance of your audio source. Buy an alexa enabled Bose speaker  if you don’t plan on purchasing an Amazon subscription service.  Alexa Integration would be 5 stars if the speaker had a small lcd display to e.g. show title, album art, clock....
title: Good soundstage and audio quality...

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Walt C.
content: I linked the Studio to my Fire TV Cube via the Alexa app on my phone, and the process was straightforward.  The sound quality is excellent!  I love the Alexa integration as well as the hub functionality. I am taking 1 star off because of the limitations to connect my DVD player - the only options seem to be via Bluetooth (not sure whether my DVD player supports this) or optical-in, and from what I can tell, connecting this optical-in cable mutes the Bluetooth connection to the Fire TV (meaning, I can't leave the cable connected).  I'm still working on this, because my DVD only has Digital Audio Out, so I would have to use a switch box with Digital In to Optical out.  The Studio needs HDMI-in.
title: Great speaker for the price

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: FogShark
content: The Studio Alexa does have better sound than the others, so I'm happy with it. I listen to a fair amount of music and appreciate the quality. The only advice I would give is to put the speaker in your wish list or Cart, then "save for later". If you keep going back every couple of days, after a couple of weeks it just drops $40-$50 dollars - buy it right away as the price will go up again very quickly. This may be coincidental but I've had it happen on a couple of high priced items so I'll keep trying in future. The "3D sound" I signed up for and the demo songs do sound slightly better but it's unnoticeable when playing regular music so I will likely cancel the service before the free trial period is up.
title: Nice Speaker - Great Sound, but wait until on-sale for price. "3D Sound" unimpressive.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Mark G
content: Wow! What a sound from such a small speaker, the bass is good and clarity is excellent. I had read many reviews that were mostly very positive, but kept noticing some people had paired two and were blown away with the results. Now don't get me wrong, One is sufficient and fills the room, but two, well it's incredible. I did start off by purchasing one, but with the deal Amazon have at the moment for $169 I decided to go all in and get the second. I am so glad I did! Easy set up and pairing was a breeze. I didn't go for the Echo Sub like many have, as my use is mainly for music and not for the movie experience. Also Amazon no longer carry the Echo Sub, but it still can be bought from other outlets. If I see one at the right price I may be tempted, but as for now, I am more than happy. These are currently being offered with 5 interest free monthly payments if you prefer to spread the cost. Good Job Amazon! Happy and Impressed.
title: One is great but two is awesome!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Strasselm
content: This was not available when I wanted a good speaker with Alexa, so I got a Sonos.  The sound is good, but not as good as the Echo Studio and the Alexa integration on the Sonos is awful.  If you want a quality speaker for streaming audio in your house then I would get the Echo Studio hands down, and if you want Alexa its a no brainer.  Even after the big Sonos v2 update, it still had horrible integration.  There is no need for Sonos now that the Echo Studio is available.
title: Don't get Sonos!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Harlan D. Brandsgard Jr
content: More difficult to set up than I thought it took me longer and more attempts finally came together I am still having a problem with my Amazon music only plays for about a minute and then shuts off I have to go through my Spotify and use my phone to control the system I have nine devices in the house four small Echo dots one second generation echo two third generation Echo One first generation echo Echo sub wooferAnd last but at least the 3-D studio echo great sound when they all Play together
title: Alexa gets confused and it’s not as smart as she think she is

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jim McAfee
content: Both Google and Amazon have nice smart speakers, but both are far from where they should be. In the end, I bought a smart TV with Chromecast and Amazon Prime, and Google Max speakers. Hopefully, either Google or Amazon will get there, but it's still in Beta, as far as I'm concerned. The sound is really good. Linking two Echo Studio and one Echo Sub is maddening. Amazon's customer service needs to be revamped. In order to keep call time moving, Amazon constantly switches the customer from one agent to another. Each time, the new agent needs time to read through the notes. That's not customer service, but rather customer disservice. I remain a loyal Amazon customer. I remain hopeful.
title: Frustrated / Returned

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: J. Thompson
content: I purchased the Echo Studio to kill multiple birds with one stone: to replace a Gen 1 Echo, serve as a soundbar for my bedroom TV, as a smart home hub, and to serve as the master bedroom speaker group with my Fire Stick 4k. I chose this over an Alexa enabled soundbar because it was offered at a discount with a bundled Echo Show 5 and Hue smart bulb. Pros-It does provide very good sound quality. I would rate it a 4.5. The only drawback in that department is that, at least in my application, the dolby atmos affect is hard to notice. It could be my room or the content I watch, so it's not quite a con in my book. Otherwise, it does all of the things you'd expect an Echo device to do in the ways you'd expect it to do them. Cons-Normally it would only work as a soundbar when you're watching content from specific devices (like my Fire Stick 4k), but there's a mini-optical line in port that allows you to connect it to a television with an optical out with the proper cable. In my case, it would stop playing this port's signal at least once a day. Suddenly, for the past week it stopped this behavior and I thought an update may have fixed the problem. But alas, it happened again last night. Unplugging and replugging the unit is the only way I've been able to correct the problem. The other major issue is that it is out of sync with my Fire Stick, and not even the lip sync tool can adequately correct the problem. It seems like this should be a relatively easy fix with today's technology. So as an Echo device only, I would rate the Studio a solid 4.5 overall. But as a replacement for a soundbar (which is clearly an intended purpose of this device, which can even be paired with another Studio and Echo sub in a 2.1 system), I'd rate it somewhere around a 3.5. If they were to fix what I assume are two software issues, I would wholeheartedly recommend it as a soundbar as well!
title: Nearly excellent, but with a couple of significant problems

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: AZDad
content: There is a lot to like here. It really does sound outstanding, especially when you utilize the 3d sound; however, I sent my set back. The problem is I really wanted to use these for a home theater. I see a lot of talk on the web about this and they do integrate fairly well with the Fire Cube. The imaging is awesome and the volume is perfect. What I found ruined the experience was the lack of bass. Bass put out by the speakers is tight and accurate - it's quite good. There just is not enough of it for a small home theater. The experience is just ruined by it. Pairing this with a Echo Sub would be perfect, but that is discontinued. AMAZON PLEASE BRING BACK THE ECHO SUB!
title: Good product, just not for me.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Fran Szypula
content: Been using this speaker for a few weeks now and completely enjoy it.  I have it in my townhouse in a open room about 40’x15’ and it fills the room with perfect sound.  I had owned all the other Echo speakers before this one and this blows the previous products away!
title: Great Speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Doyle Jennings
content: The Echo Studio sounds great, just playing music from amazon music or apple music or any other streaming services.  Where it shines is with an amazon music HD subscription.  It seems the music is coming from all around.  The louder the volume, the better the sound, especially with ultra HD 3D music.  If this will be your first echo device, you can't go wrong.  I think I own most of the devices, and this is the best one yet hands down.
title: Echo Studio sounds great just playing music.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Berael Studios
content: This is my only complaint, and it's a big one, but before I start I have to say the good first. 1. 3D MUSIC - Ultra HD- is real (it is by Amazon amazon music HD only) Amazon unlimited and amazon unlimited HD are NOT the same, you have to add the HD PACK. 2. DOBLY ATMOS IS INCREDIBLE 3. the sound is incredible the bad things Now, dobly atmos only works WITH FIRETICK 4K AND ONLY IN AMAZON PRIME VIDEO, it does not work with Netlix, APPLE TV, DISNEY + and it doesn't matter if you are using the apps in the FIRESTICK 4k unfortunately you will never experience DOBLY ATMOS, to finish Destroying this incredible device for what was created, if I found only 3 movies or series on DOBLY ATMOS in Amazon Prime, is a lot. Almost all of his films are UHD DOBLY DIGITA PLUS, which are not Dobly atmos. 2. 3D music is fine but very limited almost unstable
title: there is almost no dolby atmos material for ECHO STUDIO

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Matt
content: I own about 7 different echo devices, dots, spots, shows, etc. Along with 4 fire tv sticks. I got this studio with the intention of replacing the built in speakers on my main living room tv, which is only really used with a Fire TV Stick. Setting up the device was a breeze, just as all echo devices are. The real exciting part was when creating the Audio System for the Fire TV stick, which also was an incredibly easy process, and then I was up and running. Overall, while I am not a sound engineer, I think the sound quality was pretty incredible. Granted, I’m moving from built in tv speakers, however, the bass was punchy and smooth, balance feels great. When playing music, it’s a fully immersive sound that fills the room. While it doesn’t compare to a full scale surround sound system for movies or watching TV, it does sound great and is a very easy solution. As all echo devices do, this studio integrates perfectly with my existing ecosystem, multi-room music, etc. There do appear to be a couple bugs, biggest one I found was when asking this device to play Spotify, it won’t play it on that device but in an entirely different room. I’ve seen reports of this bug and assuming that it’ll be fixed soon, as Amazon doesn’t seem to let bugs like this hang around too long. Overall, a great device and I’ll probably be getting another shortly to pair them in stereo.
title: The best Echo

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Hop  good game
content: The music is so clear and surrounds you. The Elvis Presley Ultra HD is the best I've ever heard. I'm 77 years old. So I've been listening to Elvis music for a lot of years.
title: Best Sound on a $200 speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Patrick Banks
content: Sound quality is fantastic.  But... it works for a bit then cuts out.  When trying to fix it- its a 'network error' - and I've tried all the usual stuff and everything people suggest online with resetting everything from the router up, using the alexa app to remove the home theater group and remake it...  then it works for an hour or two, then it cuts off again.  Gotten to the point I just enjoy my bedroom tv and ignore the big living room one.  Everyone does.  I killed the shared living space. And its really limited to Just the firestick-  (I've also reset that stick many times) which is a bummer. I wish that it came with a wire so that you had the backup option to just attach it directly to your tv. Going to be trying it out with "AmazonBasics Optical Toslink to Mini Toslink Jack Digital Audio Cable" and see how That goes.
title: when it works, the sound is great.  But...

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Marc H.
content: This unit is a very good value since it incorporates the ZigBee Hub.  I purchased the Echo Studio since I decided to begin a project of automating my house.  With one exception (the C by GE product), all the best of breed that I purchased worked great with Alexa. I have two complaints, one I knew from another owner.  The low end sounds contrived.  This is to be expected since the are faking the base with a relatively small woofer.  This is the small shortcoming I noticed.  Not a deal breaker but it would be nice... My biggest complaint is that Alexa in an Echo Studio is a bit hard of hearing.  I have to speak very loudly in order to execute the command.  My Echo Plus, Echo, Echo Dot and Echo Show are acceptably sensitive to inputs. Other than that, it is doing the job.  It is so cool to automate your house.
title: Alexa needs her ears cleaned

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: keith
content: I tried the echo 3rd gen pair with sub and it was good. 2 of these studios IMHO is better. Overall sound is better. Echo sub was kinda disappointing. It's small and cheap so it does what it's suppose to I guess but for my limited kitchen area I wanted as few devices and wires as possible. A pair of studios sounds great but pricy at 400$ for the pair. But compared to Google or Sonos or Bose at the same price, these studios win as a pair.
title: Alone or a pair these devices sound great but at a cost

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: TooLittleTime
content: I had been looking for a sound bar for my television and saw that this compared closely in price to many of the higher end sound bars I was researching.  The quality of the treble and bass are excellent for the size of the speaker and the separation is vastly better than a sound bar.  I made the right choice. Also, the 3D and HD music quality from Amazon Music is noticeable for those audiophiles out there. Unfortunately, the sound was so good, I kept disconnecting it from the TV and taking it to other rooms.  (Really upset the wife.)  I now have two of these.  The second is paired with a set of Echo Pluses and an Echo Sub.  The quality of this combined set rivals the best stereo systems I have owned.
title: Great separation and clarity

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Shane Vrana
content: This device gets loud so it therefore cannot hear its invocation word very well at times. Other than that I cannot think of another negative. I did try and use the Atmos effect form Amazon Music HD. It was not worth the price at the moment. It is only a $200 device but unless you have a $2000 plus receiver and true atmos speakers I do not recommend the Music HD Plan as a great upgrade with this device. Now on my surround sound system with 13 speakers 6 of which are Atmos the sound of the few soundtracks on atmos are quite amazing. Especially synched with my hue lights. Nice party, but that is a different review. I would recommend this product as a great stand alone device for outside or a relatively large room. It also works well with the Firestick or Amazon Firetv as a soundbar that can be utilized.
title: Excellent sound and Bass that work perfect for my outdoor Patio

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Edgar F.
content: I can’t not recommend this device. I have to reboot this device regularly because of stuttering issues. WiFi is solid though my small apartment so connectivity shouldn’t be an issue. Also, in combo with the FireTV, if I rewind whatever media I’m watching, 9/10 times the audio/video will be out of sync. Audio quality is good. Alexa integration is fine but these two issues are crippling and highly annoying.  I would go to optical input to eliminate these issues but then I lose most of the benefit of this wireless speaker , including not being able to transmit Atmos and 3D audio.
title: Terrible Syncing and Stuttering

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Kentucky's Big Kahuna
content: At my age, I spend a lot of time in the "Think Tank." I used to read a lot in there calling it "potty training." Along came Alexa so I put a Dot in there. It sounded OK, but at times it would be garbled. I thought about adding a Bluetooth speaker, but I haven't had the best luck with them losing connection, spotty connection, etc. I already have an Alexa Theater set up and knew how wonderful it sounds (near as good as my Bose system), so along comes the Echo Studio. Wow... It is awesome and I love it. Sound quality is very impressive, bass response is definitely great, and the highs are as clear as a bell. I highly recommend it for those who appreciate upper shelf sound quality.
title: Incredible sound quality from a compact package...

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Kindle Customer 29659824658934
content: It doesn’t work well as a sound bar. If I have it on 75 volume or less it’s basically a whisper. I bought an optical/toslink cable in hopes that it would fix the issue but no luck. I’m using it with a smart fire tv also, still has poor sound on lower volumes for sound bar usage. At this point I may as well just use the tv speakers. I’m pretty disappointed with this product and don’t know what else can be done. Maybe further updates will fix it.
title: Even if you have a smart fire tv don’t buy this for a sound bar.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: kehauw
content: I was extremely hesitant to buy this "expensive Alexa" as I called it. After reading the reviews, I bought it for my father for Father's Day. I set it up for him (super fast and easy to set up) and played the first song. I was blown away by the beautiful sound quality! I used to lose only Bose products and when I compared the similarly-priced Bose with Alexa, the Studio SOUNDED BETTER! The bass was slightly better on the Bose (barely noticable) but the overall sound quality went to the Echo Studio. And it was cheaper! I played the same songs on both. The integration for the Bose was much more difficult than the Studio and there is a slight lag on the Bose (the Studio is quicker to respond to requests). Hope this helps!
title: Amateur audiophile thinks it has amazing sound quality!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: John V Magisano
content: All I can say is Wow!  The sound is amazing.  I have had various Bluetooth and other all in one speakers like this and this is the best so far.  None of the others could fill a room like this can. With Spotify already attached to my account I can actively switch between any Echo including the Studio with easy control through the Spotify app as well as with Alexa voice control. It is now about 4 months old and going strong.
title: It fills the room with excellent sound.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: David Kevorkian
content: Utmost honesty, I have both Apple and Amazon/Alexa environment in my townhouse including smart gadgets. However, I initially bought Homepod and set it up that was not as friendly as I expected, when I found out that I couldn’t access Pandora, iHreart that’s what it turned me off and I did returned it back at Best Buy and bought Amazon Studio that was so much easier to activated and I was fascinated with its bass sound that I am enjoying it every beat of it.
title: Amazon Studio versus HomePod

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Steve
content: I really enjoy this speaker.  I use it for casual listening, mood music and love it.  I listen primarily to classic rock and blues as background music.  Dont get me wrong, I do find myself occasionally quietly listening with my eyes closed.  This speaker sounds great, it just doesn't have the detail of a high fidelity system.  No suprise there as it's a tenth of the price.  I did notice underemphasized mids in some tracks such as Stevie Nick's Leather and Lace, but overall I still prefer the Studio over my Sonos One.  I can't help but smile when listening to Pink Floyd or B.B. King.  It's a fabulous speaker!
title: I love this speaker!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: John
content: With a built in 24bit DAC and excellent sound, Echo Studio is a winner.  I spent significant time researching and in search of a upgraded bluetooth or wi-fi speaker to pair with the newly released Amazon HD music service.  There's always give and take with Hi-Fi purchases (in my opinion) and this was no different.  Although there were a few speakers on the market that boasted slighter better audio performance, it was at a price point more than twice the Echo Studio and none the a 24bit or higher DAC built in.  I have found the sound performance excellent and having the convenience of Alexia, it was a no-brainer.  Currently, I am satisfied with the bass performance, I find no need for the add on sub-woofer.  I will likely purchase more. Set up was simple and when I purchase another one and if I decide to pair them, the Alexia app makes the pairing process. Like anything else, I also see some opportunity for improvement.  I was disappointed there was not a built in Ethernet port.  (I purchased a USB3 Ethernet adapter, however not tested it yet, 5G Wi-Fi is doing the trick)  This speaker is not as visually appealing as a few of the other hi-fi spearkers I was looking at however, as stated above, none had the total benefits of the Echo Studio.
title: Take Full Advantage of Amazon Music HD!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Xavier
content: I got the Sonos One for Christmas, but was really interested in the Studio so I bought one to put side by side.  On it's own it sounds great compared to previous Echos, but playing the same song right next to the Sonos One allows you to hear that it is not as clean/crisp.  It sounds kinda muffled.  I expected the lows to sound a lot better on this than the Sonos since it has a 5" downward firing sub where the Sonos is just a single speaker.  Lows sound good  but not by much. The biggest disappointment is that even the microphones to invoke Alexa aren't as good as the Sonos or even my older Echo, not sure what's going on there.  I'll stick to the Sonos and send this one back.
title: Sounds good, just don't put it next to a Sonos.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: R.A.H.
content: There’s many fine reviews that leave little to add.  One point of personal view though is the Amazon prices that are fixed to their products.  Whether it be speakers, tablets, or earbuds I feel that Amazon is extremely fair in their pricing of products.  I’m an Apple guy owning IMac, Ipad, and phone.  The thing is Apple’s pricing is in my opinion extremely greedy, I mean something isn’t right when a new phone comes in at $1,000 plus.  Given that, as long as Amazon attempts to approach pricing fairly I will always remain a loyal customer.....
title: Great Speaker At A Fair Price....

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Koalaness
content: I may end up liking this 5 stars eventually, but not now.  The sound is very good.  I was using the  Echo.  There is one problem I have not solved.......  when I have Amazon music stations playing, it will play for a while... then all of a sudden it makes horrible noises that continue.  I don't know how to describe it--- maybe like people talking or noises underwater.. and it is loud.  Garbled noises.  It looks nice. Bigger than I expected.  One other thing I do not like is I can't see the light on top like I could with the Echo.  I suspect the noise problem has something to do with the connection, but I have no wireless problems with my Echos, internet, or Roku TV.
title: Not sure if I like it, but sound is good

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: P. Bekker
content: Sound is ok.  It is better than Amazon's other options but it won't blow you away.  Stereo option while "easy" to set up did take multiple tries for it to work correctly.  I also had quite a bit of difficulty getting these to work as part of a multi room group.  I ended up having to delete all my groups and start from scratch after which it worked flawlessly.  I'm also taking a star away because Amazon still doesn't have a way for one to listen to music they already own on the multi-room group.  Paid apps exist to be able to play music you might have on your computer but it will only play over one speaker at a time which really limits the utility of this speaker ecosystem.
title: Ok sound, really needs to be paired with the sub.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Marc Gamble
content: First, sound quality is great. However, I am extremely frustrated that the Echo Studio will not pair with my Toshiba Fire TV!!! The Fire TV is built in to this Toshiba model. I specifically bought it so that it would be in the same echo system as my other Alexa enabled devices. So, now, If I want the Echo Studio to serve as a home theater speaker for my TV, I have to buy a Fire TV device to put on my Fire TV. Seriously!!!! Not to mention that on the Studio, Alexa often doesn't respond. I have tried, "Alexa, find my devices." and she never responds. I have tried, "Alexa, check for updates." and she never responds. What gives? This is why I usually wait for subsequent versions to come out. I have learned my lesson. All I have now is a really expensive speaker that I can stream audio through.
title: Really frustrated

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: P.W.A.
content: I really like the quality of sound. It's definitely not super loud, but it does the job for a small or medium room. As long as you don't expect Bose quality and power [you get what you pay for], this thing is great. I actually think it's like the poor man's Bose! It integrates well with other Echos but they have to be 2nd generation or greater, and they all have to be on the same wi-fi. The app has a basic equalizer you can fine-tune the sound with (just mid, highs, and lows). It's a lot bigger than I thought it would be. It's the size of an exterior paint can. However, I've gotten used to it and it's kind of cool-looking. Overall, worth the money.
title: A Solid 4 Speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Michael
content: I bought this because I wanted more wow sound from my Echo Dot. I am not that impressed. At lower volumes it does not sound any better than my Echo Dot. At higher volumes it doesn't have me saying that sounds great. Maybe I was expecting too much. However considering it's more than 6 times the cost of an Echo Dot it shold leave me feeling that I really have something exceptional. The sound is not that great. I'll keep playing with it and see if I can get it to perform at a level that makes me feel it was worth the extra $.
title: It's OK

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Richard S.
content: Bought two of these speaker and they're a good value for the price.  The sound is decent, not eye-opening great but I don't expect that at this price point.  After setting up the speakers I signed up for Amazon Unlimited Music service.  A pretty good deal. Two concerns: 1.  When the music is loud, Alexa can't hear my commands.  This isn't really a gripe because I can't imagine how hard it would be to program a listening device to hear over the music but it might be something they can fine tune over time. 2.  Alexa is like a bad AM DJ from the 1970s.  If I ask for a song she ALWAYS talks over the beginning of the music.  This annoying trait means I'll probably cancel my subscription to Amazon Music Unlimited before the free trial expires.  This should be an easy fix.  C'mon Amazon, RESPECT the artists and the music.
title: Alexa Acts Like an AM Radio DJ

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Bob
content: The worst Alexa that I have ever owned. I can stand over the top of this and speak, i’ll have Alexa’s in another room pick up before this one. The sound quality is great, but it’s absolutely useless if I can’t communicate with it.
title: Worst microphones ever

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Matthew Spencer
content: I have an Echo Studio pair linked to a Fire TV Stick 4k. The sound used to be great. That last maybe half a year. Since then, the volume cuts out randomly. There's no easy-to-find advice from Amazon that fixes this. In addition to the audio completely failing, now sometimes just one of the Echo Studios goes silent. I have fast internet, and I have no problems with online services using other computers around the house. But the thing things annoyed me the most is the constant lag for audio when using the YouTube app. None of the other apps I use on the Fire Stick 4k has this problem. Again, nothing from Amazon other than a suggestion to restart the device. If a software update should solve these problems, I'll gladly add a few more stars to this review.
title: Audio sync issues for some apps, studio pairing goes mono

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: J Jackson
content: Glad Amazon finally got with the program and offered “HD” & “Ultra HD” music, although I do believe Tidal has a very slightly better sound.  In either case this Echo Studio rocks!  Very nice, full, crisp sound with Amazon HD stream; this speaker will fill just about any size room. We have an open floor plan with about 1,200 sf combo kitchen, living, dining and family room and this Echo is all we need for a impromptu dance party.
title: Flippin Awesomeness

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Kosoku
content: I was looking for a speaker for my garage / workshop and had it narrowed down to this and the one made by that fruit company. I was able to test the fruity model in the fruity store and was impressed with the sound.  I was a bit leery to buy this without testing it, but I decided to try it for the sole reason that it works with all products and isn’t limited to fruity devices.  It even has an aux input - every speaker of this nature should have this honestly. Now the actual performance of this speaker in a 17’ x 25’ room is phenomenal.  Smaller speakers made an echo effect.  This speaker fills the room with sound without any such effect.
title: Better than it’s fruity competition!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: grkgeorgy
content: I jumped and ordered this device as soon as I heard about it.  Setup was SUPER EASY!  If you accept to have your account added before it ships, when it arrives all you need to do is literally TURN IT ON.  It will automatically connect to your wifi by using your password saved via your account profile and activate in seconds! OK - so now to the sound.  I used the sample HD playlist they let you stream to see how that sounds.  It fills the entire room, with rich tones and dynamic range.  I cranked it to the loudest setting and noticed something.  The sound was still clear, but it was not blaring and distorted.  The sound just sounded clean and I enjoyed every song.  I walked to different rooms around the house and it actually travelled through.  I can only imagine pairing 2 studios, which I may do at some point in the near future. I also own an Echo and the sound is loud for this device - but it lacks the range.  It also feels harsh if you blast it.  The studio has definitely improved sound quality.
