As for the HD music, I did not subscribe since I have a Spotify account.  So I made sure my account had the highest bit rate streaming at 320Kb and guess what, it makes a difference using the studio.  I now enjoy listening to music whenever I’m home.  It feels great having good quality audio delivered at your command.  I’m happy with this purchase 😊
title: Stellar sound EASY SETUP

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jvoles
content: The sound is absolutely amazing.  I was completely blown away by It!  The only reason for not giving 5 stars is because of connectivity issues.  I was under the impression that I could use the studio as a center/main channel and use two dots as side speakers for surround but apparently that's not an option at the moment, I was told the studio could only pair with another studio.  Well, somehow I did get it to pair with both dots  (just not simultaneously) and if they could just update the devices to work together seamlessly then it would be a truly versatile sound system.  But without that capability, it's still just another Alexa, not a sound system.
title: Amazing sound, wish it paired with dots though.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Chris G
content: I'm not an audiophile, but I do listen to music just about all day long while I work.  In the past, I've purchased high-end equipment from Bose and Tivoli.  The Echo Studio certainly stands up to those brands, and for a fraction of the price.  Setup is quick and easy, and the sound quality is a noticeable improvement over the standard Echo, of which I've owned several over the years.  Very happy with this purchase.
title: Great quality and value

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: JAZZY62
content: The studio is rich and clear in sound. Remember to adjust the audio to your liking in the Alexa app.  I've tried several genres and they all sounded fantastic with good  sound separation.  Good job Amazon, and in keeping the cost affordable!
title: Excellent!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: lmederos
content: We purchased this item during Prime Day at a significant discount.  I was worried about the size, and yes it is bulky, but has an incredibly solid feel to it. Sound does not disappoint; it is clear, powerful, and "carries" much better than my old Echo 1st Gen device.  We can hear it clearly in multiple rooms without being extremely loud. My one frustration was that as the Echo devices that conform to the room, it requires resetting if you move it from one to another for proper detection of room acoustics.  That means I had to deregister and re-register; I am not sure why a command to reset the acoustics is not available.
title: Excellent audio, but bulky

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Bobio
content: My set up experience was quick and easy, contrary to reviews I read. Voice recognition is better than my 1st generation Echos. I wasn’t overly impressed with the default sound setting, but the user can adjust the bass, treble and mid-range sound to their liking and the size of room the speaker’s in. Buying it on prime day and using my points/credits on my Amazon Visa, I got it at half price. It’s still probably worth full price if you enjoy listening to music. I anxiously await more of Amazon’s music to be “3D.” The only bummer is you have to upgrade your music subscription to get the benefit of 3D music, but it’s just a few dollars a month.
title: Improvement to 1st Generation Echo & Easy Set Up

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Snagglepuss
content: So the one I got turned a solid green ring and wouldnt go into setup mode right out of the box, called tech support. They couldnt figure it out. Told me to hold down two buttons to do factort reset didnt work. Why i tried this i have no idea, but i unplugged unit and continued holding down the two buttons an replugged it in. Hope this helps some of you if you encounter this.bsound quality was full and sounded good. The bass a little muddy imn my opinion. If you dont yet own an alexa or want a high end alexa this is for you, we didnt like the setup failure hence we returned it
title: Solid green ring of light had hard time with reset

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Lev Mishkin
content: Alexa has gone deaf with this device after a couple of months. Sometimes we have to call her several times to get her attention, so I think we’ll start using our old one instead. This device must come with a defective microphone or software glitch of some sort.
title: Alex has gone deaf with this device

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: HeatherCoz
content: The echo studio sounded great right out of the box. We literally unwrapped it in front of the Christmas tree, plugged it in, and started listening. We've got an open floor plan with cathedral ceilings and the sound filled the room. No matter where I stood the sound quality remained. We now have it set up in our family room as the home theater and can't wait to get another to stereo pair. The only drawback that I can see if the ability to pair a studio with echo dots for stereo surround.
title: Room filling sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: M. Morgan
content: So incredibly disappointed! Purchased two Studios to "stereo" with my sub . . . Alexa only "hears" requests every third time and gets the "request" wrong half the time! I had two Echo (3rd gen) prior to owning these (traded them in), wish I hadn't, those were smart speakers! Yo, Amazon!? Did y'all rush the Studio, I think ya did . . . Completely lacking in excitement and quality - maybe I got two lemons but save your money and get two Echoes instead . . . Also, the light up "ring of recognition", is on top and you can't see if Alexa is paying attention or not . . . Damn shame Amazon, damn shame, y'all really dropped the ball! Update: Still hate them and wish I had not spent the money . . .
title: Don't do it!!!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: K.Todd T.
content: I'm Not a fan of Apple products, but I do have 4 Apple TVs in the house -  Terrible Remote! I wanted to buy a 4k Apple and thought I would give this 4k Fire Stick a try, I also purchased 2 Echo Studio Speakers to go with it as the full TV sound package. I have spent hours trying to get my Spectrum TV to download on this Fire Stick... Download the Downloader... Go to the Spectrum App... Download this... Download That... what a crazy mess! Apple has the Spectrum App on the opening screen, Menu, Guide it all flows. I just watched a movie that wasn't available on the Fire Stick, so I watched it on Apple TV, but you cannot use the Echo Studio Speaker if you're not watching the movie on the Fire Stick... So I just watched a Great Movie, with the nasty flat-screen TV Speakers... Right next to $400.00 Echo Studio speakers that aren't turned on because I'm not using the Fire Stick.  Not a good experience! **Update... Called Amazon Customer Service for help... "Sorry, Spectrum is not compatible". It is all being returned, Remote Cover, 4k Stick, 2 Echo Studio Speakers... $450.00 The Speakers sound Amazing!  For the 30 minutes, I listened to them before putting them back into the box.
title: Spectrum TV-Not Compatible with Fire Stick-No Fire Stick- No Speakers.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Sharon Benzil
content: This Echo Studio was purchased with an Echo 3rd gen to provide linked sound from our TV (using a Fire Cube) in the living room and another room (to listen to audio from the TV) and while the literature on the Echo speakers are fuzzy on the ability of these two specific speakers to link together, it is implied they can. Wrong. They cannot. Strike 1. After weeks and weeks of owning the Echo Studio, we have now RECONNECTED a Bose Mini Soundlink to the Fire Cube because after weeks and weeks of factory restarts, reconnecting, linking and pairing, pairing and unpairing, and countless hours on Amazon troubleshooting chats (the SLOWEST customer service chats ever), I have given up on the home theater pairing. Strike 2 and 3. The connections are tenuous, drop constantly, and even when the speaker is linked with the Fire Cube, the sound doesn’t come through the speaker and remains on the TV. So frustrating. The sound link between the speakers for multi room music seems to be fairly reliable and therefore, we have decided they can be used for music but not home theater. We’ve resorted to a less expensive, smaller and older Bose speaker for the TV that is flawless in its linkage and provides adequate and trouble-free sound. The $300 in Echo speakers are, for multi room music only, overpriced and I would have returned these speakers a long time ago except we live outside the US and sending these back to the US is prohibitively expensive, and during these COVID times, almost impossible. I would not recommend this speaker to anyone. Find something else. Anything else. Because clearly among all the things that Amazon does well, building a reliable, technologically capable, hi fidelity home theater speaker is sure not one of those things.
title: A total waste of time and money

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: WGW
content: Great speaker with great bass.  Several other High end speakers don’t support Bluetooth but  the Alexa Studio does. A primary use is Amazon prime music & bluetooth on my various Apple devices.  I’m very glad I purchased the Alexa Studio.
title: Great speaker great sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Andrew Weinberg
content: I like the size and the sound of the unit. the Alexa integrations work as expected, and I use it as the primary speaker for music in a room with another echo unit. Set up as the primary, I get no contention between the two; i.e.: Echo on kitchen counter responds to voice commands for shopping lists, automation, etc where the Studio just a few feet away plays the music when asked, yet when I am closer to the studio it responds and the kitchen unit does not interfere. The only thing I wished for was the unit had more power. Since the replaced a 13 year old JBL ipod capable room speaker (was twice the price), the volume is not as loud. Plenty to fill the room but in larger spaces it will need some help. Sound clarity at high volume remains clear, just an added note. Was worth the $149.00 on Prime day.
title: Nice bang for the buck!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ed Barton
content: I use this in my living room in an open concept home. The unit fills the area well - and there's a setting on set up that allows it to optimize for the room acoustics. As an Amazon Alexa enabled device, it is easy to set up and integrate into an Amazon ecosystem. The sound quality is significantly better than an Echo plus, but not up to par to a Bose or Sonos...yet. However, at the price point and with the full Alexa capabilities, it is worth your consideration as part of a smart home set up.
title: Easy Integration and Decent Sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: DM
content: They will only hook up through WiFi...when they hook up.  The whole process was exhausting and in the end?  They kinda suck.  Timing mismatch from one streaming platform to the next, horrible drop offs while streaming.  And... you can't leave your Fire TV hard wired while using them.  There is just no flexibility with these things... very disappointed.  I returned them and would not recommend for any kind of TV audio experience.
title: Not good for Fire TV connections

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: tLeander7
content: I've been an Amazon Echo user since the day the 1st Generation unit was released. Since then I've purchased additional units to include Echo Plus, Show 1st & 2nd Gen, Dot and the Amazon Tap. For a while now, I've had multiple units connected in a group for music throughout my apartment. Since I started using the Studio version, I no longer use the Group for music, because the sound from just one Echo Studio immersses my entire apartment with spectacular sound. The Studio also syncs better with the FireTv Cube for great TV sound than previous Echo's. I still use the other devices and have no gripes with them. But the Echo Studio is truly the best of the bunch.
title: Best sounding Echo yet...

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tennessee Phil
content: The sound quality for music is better than the basic Echo, but it's not in the league with a quality speaker.  The sound lacks "presence."  It sounds like it's in the distance or the sound is coming through a window. I tried my favorite speaker evaluation songs, and I was disappointed on each one.  I have a set of Klipsch ProMedia 2.1 THX computer speakers ($119) that provide much better sound.
title: Disappointing music sound giving the hype and price

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: LJAY
content: Let's just say I've been. Waiting some time deciding what I want as a home audio system. Sonos products look and sound great but I ultimately decided to go with the 3D studio for the more bass sound over highs.  I think the studio offers a good balance that's adjustable enough ( we'll come back to these said adjustments in a minute) to get the highs, why not as crisp as Sonos, pretty close indeed. Ok so let's be clear, the easy setup that I watched tons of videos before the product arrived wasn't easy. Yes it connected to WiFi and adjusted based on the placement of my room but getting it connected to my fire TV was almost a phone call away to tech support.  Actually I was on the phone waiting for tech support when I somehow miraculously connected it. It's a moment you will realize as a Firestick 4k owner that your Firestick does not update it's software automatically. The speaker itself is a little bulky but honestly it makes it look more of a beast than the Sonos product I was considering.  The one deciding point was the ability to connect other Bluetooth devices directly to the speaker and I'm glad I did. That feature is the most useful as someone using a phone, tablet, computer and fire TV to listen to music or watch movies it switches effortlessly between whatever audio I decide to play. The audio setting which allows some tweaking to the bass, treble and mids is probably my only complain for the moment.  I definitely think there's limited options for adjustments for the echo studio.  There should be some pre-sets to assist with adjustments for movies, music and games. There definitely should be a way to adjust the individual tweeter's that create the 3D sound, that by the way you don't get to hear unless you subscribe to Amazon music service. The surround sound provided by the stereo spacial enhancement does help to mimic that pretty good.  Also note adding thrid party software such as the Dolby and Atmos on my PC when using this device showed great improvement. It's unfortunate I can't carry that over to my Firestick and some other devices. My other complaint which I will contact support about is when I adjust the few setting options they give me it doesn't save and keep it.  At some point when I open settings option again it resets back to it's original options. Overall I enjoy the speaker and can't wait to purchase the subwoofer and a additional echo studio to complete the ultimate home audio.
title: Great beginning of a new home audio system

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Caroline Buswell
content: When it works it’s fabulous but there are to many issues.  While watching Marcella or Queen of the South on Netflix the sound is immense and theater like.  One drawback the sub is inoperative when watching tv, hopefully firmware will correct that.  When listening to music such as Caribbean Queen by Billy Ocean and Do It Again by Steely Dan the sound easily fills my 19x26 great room.  Two Echo Studios are paired with an Echo sub and they have plenty of power and punch for a $600 system.  Even though listening to tv and music with this system is enjoyable there are to many headaches.  Sometimes while sleeping Alexa will cycle the speakers and a tone is heard or you can hear her talking which is very annoying.  At times sound will come from one speaker only or an echo can be heard on Netflix.  Connectivity issues abound as well.  The system will work flawless for days on end.  Then they all loose connectivity or one is connected and the other is not or both indicate connected but no sound is heard.  Mine are connected via Bluetooth and if the issues continue I’ll connect them via Toslink cable.
title: 3 month Echo Home Theater Review

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Monte
content: Can not do stereo with other echo devices if you bluetooth to say your computer. Devices outside the echo studio connect stereo via wifi, not bluetooth. It will only be in a stereo mode (studio, 2 echos) if you play from amazon music or such. Not blueyoothed to anyother device like a computer. You cannot change the input to output like you can with the echo plus and echo. It is input only.  Amazon doesnt tell us these things, or at least any place I could find. Overall, I'm happy with the echo studio, just disappointed that the stereo setup will not work while the studio is blue toothed to a device such as a computer so i can play my own music.
title: Call Amazon support if you have questions and can not find answers before ordering.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: wendell
content: I have been using this speaker for a week now. Sounds better than I expected. I bought this to put in my bathroom which does not have the greatest acoustics of course. It runs the sound test on its on, was simple. The sound is open, the 360 does add a little extra to a song. It doesn't sound quiet as sweet as my Mirage Speakers but close and for much less money. It is definitely worth the sale price of $199. Now If JEFF BEZOS would please direct his team to design a higher end version of this speaker with WiFi 6 built in and be capable of combining 6 of these for a full wireless surround sound system that would be SWEET and I would  preorder one. UPDATE: I have been using this speaker for a little over 3 weeks and the more I use it the more I like it especially with ultra HD songs, now upgraded to 5 stars and plan on buying another for my kitchen when it goes back on sale.
title: Sounded better than expected

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Anna
content: Totally and utterly useless! Not sure why on earth amazon would create a speaker compatible with NOTHING! Want to connect to iphone? Not if you have an echo sub. Want to connect to your TV for surround sound? NOPE SORRY. This device is literally only compatible with itself. Doesnt allow any bluetooth devices to be connected. If your looking for a home audio system and want to integrate any other device this will not work  BY DESIGN! Thats literally the silliest audio device ive ever encountered. Unless you listen solely to amazon music and use alexa this is nothing more than a paper weight. Also customer service was useless in trying to exchange for another system. Returned both this and echo sub and went to bestbuy to purchase a functioning device. Dont waste your breath with this thing.
title: Only audio device compatible with NOTHING!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Nunya Bizns
content: I am so impressed with this device. The sound quality is amazing for such a small package. I then learned I could use it as a sound bar with the right Firestick. Then I learned I could hook them up in stereo and get Dolby Atmos for my TV. Just today the Echo Studio went on sale for $169 I had to buy my third Studio so I can enjoy the clean crisp sounds in my bedroom. They offer a subwoofer that I don't think is necessary because the bass is booming. Way to go Amazon!
title: Crisp, clean, and booming!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Roginator
content: I had a 48" TV in bedroom where I was a bit underwhelmed by TV speakers. And I really wanted Alexa capability so I could croak out in the morning, "Alexa, what time is it?" This solved both problems. Sound is decent. It can't compete with the $2000 sound system downstairs, but it's only $200. I had a little difficulty testing it with the free version of Amazon Music. Some tracks didn't play. (and why, oh why does it need the TV to play music?) I also tested what I THINK was a 5.1 stereo file. The stereo separation effect was minimal.
title: Seems worthwhile

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Green Guy
content: It's a good speaker and is good for the price but, given it's size, I was expecting it to perform more like a Sonos Play 5, but it's more in between a Play 1 and a Play 3.  Glad I have it... I will also say that I wish it came with a metal wrap like the Sonos because I'm a bit nervous that the fabric on the top and sides will get dirty or dusty, which prevents me from putting it in a lot of places I'd like to have one, but I'm using the echo dot for those places.
title: Decent for the price

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jim & Yvonne
content: I like it.  After the wife got out all connected,  works great with my fire tv cube. I have it paired with an echo sub. We have it in our master bedroom and it fills the room adequately as the speaker for the TV. Together,  the sub and studio were about 300. The soundbar and subwoofer I had before were more,  a sony, and the new setup is better. The fire tv cube automatically added the remote to the studio.  Can't do better for the money. It's not a movie theater,  but it's a great little home theater feel/sound.  The alexa Integration features are just as good at the other speakers which is a plus. Very happy.
title: Very happy with my studio.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: KMG
content: I don't like that these three units (Studio X2 & subwoofer) are sometimey with their paring; with only one speaker playing at times.  but if the other unit gets the command they might play together.  Long wait on hold with tech support (once I was able to FIND a tech support number). Then there still the problem with 20% of command being ludicrously wrong.  But would the programers code these things to at least stop giving you wrong response?  Of course not. Yes they are the best sounding Amazon echo speakers but the sound is middle of the road reasonable for a sound system compared to what's on the market.
title: Spare yourself the frustration!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Brent J.
content: I have several Echos. Nearly one in each room for various reasons. However my Gen 2 standard Alexa sounds excellent. We wanted to add one to another room, so we decided to replace our Gen 2 with an Echo Gen 2 with a Studio. We were looking forward to the improved sound. To be clear this thing is MUCH bigger than a standard Echo, our old one was on the coffee table, this one had to be moved to a side table, it's big. Don't get me wrong, the sound is good, but I expected more bass, and much better sound to justify the double in price. I would say it's closer to a 25% improvement in sound. I would say with the size and sound, it's not worth the additional price.
title: I would not call it incredible sound, not sure it's deserving of "Studio"

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: fellow shopper
content: I bought a set of these speakers as direct replacements for Sonos Play 1 speakers in the exact same configuration (i.e., room, stereo pair, source of music). I was hoping for better integration with Amazon music, but there is no difference; I wanted to like and dislike the songs being played and I was hoping Alexa could tell me what songs were playing. When playing music in stereo, Alexa says, "nothing is playing right now" every time I try to like or dislike a song. This shortfall has been documented previously with Amazon music, yet nothing has changed. Frankly, I like the Sonos better because there is more volume increments which benefits lower volume background music. And why can't I say "Alexa, volume 15%" (as opposed to one through 10). I'll admit, more time is needed to assess the speakers capability, but my initial assessment is merely mediocre for a speaker that has the hardware to create awesomeness. Fingers crossed they work as claimed with a 4k Firestick.
title: Good overall, but not clearly better than competitors

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Claudia Glaser
content: Love it. Although there is a lag between when I turn on fire tv to when sound picks up.
title: Using it as wireless sound bar substitute

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tim
content: The Echo Studio is a pretty good sounding smart speaker for the price and size. I like many things about this speaker, but it could've been better. So far the smart home hub feature has not worked for the three Phillips hue bulbs I own. I use to have a phillips hub but returned it when I got an Echo Plus. I sold that Echo last year and haven't had a way to control my smart bulbs since then. I am disappointed to say the Echo Studio does not work as a hub for my lights. There is a chance they are all malfunctioning or it is an operator error. As far as voice commands go, I recommend putting it about 12 inches away from any walls or solid objects. Since the speaker has 360 sound it will echo (pun intended) back to the mics and require you to pretty much yell to get Alexa to respond. I originally had it next to a wall and had experienced this so I can say for sure the speaker responds better being at least 12 inches from walls. The last thing I can think of that I really wanted but didn't get with this model is the ability to measure inside temperature like the Echo Plus does. I mean come on, really? I would have paid the extra 25 dollars for this convenience and to he honest I expect this feature from a semi high end speaker. You probably are wondering about the speaker sound at this point. It sounds great honestly. It is truly like a miniature home theater system with out the true stereo quality you get from surround sound speakers. There is a significant amount of bass and it actually blends well with the mids and highs. I can feel it vibrate my floor, but I should mention we have raised floors which are better at transmitting the vibrations than a concrete floor. I would give this speaker 5 stars had the hub feature actually worked and if it came with the ability to measure inside temperature like the Echo Plus. One last thing is not part of the review but more of a suggestion; if you get the Echo Studio, do yourself a favor and subscribe to music HD. I got my first month for half the cost which will normally run you 14.99/month for the cheaper subscription. The sound difference between regular Prime Music and the HD subscription is kind of like the difference between a regular speaker vs bass boosted headphones. Everything sounds more balanced and clear and you hear the sounds you normally only hear with a pair of headphones or a high quality speaker!
title: Not bad! Could've been better, though...

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Chris K.
content: I purchased the Echo Studio when it was on sale 169.99 and was excited to try this thing out. Well the excitement was short lived. The Bluetooth would connect just fine through Windows 10 PC (connected to my tv via hdmi) and would work fine until I asked Alexa to play a song. Once that happened the Bluetooth would disconnect and proceed to play the song forcing me to reconnect it. This happened every time right on que. Sometimes when the Bluetooth was reconnected there was no sound at all despite Windows 10 showing it connected. In addition the Bluetooth connection would also drop at random moments and while the speaker sounded pretty good at first that was short lived as well. One moment I had a great speaker and then for no reason it suddenly sounded like a cell phone speaker (no woofer/mids). Resetting or unplugging was no help. My Echo Plus was connected in the same fashion and produced none of the above problems working flawlessly. As mentioned in other reviews the placement of the light ring is annoying since you cant see it at eye level (where most people would probably have it) and the voice recognition would sometimes not work. Also I figured I would update the software to possibly fix any problems but the Studio reported back that it had the latest version. When I checked Amazon website the latest Studio software version according to Amazon site is 3389730436 however my Alexa app shows the software version as 3590965380 so I'm not sure if that matters? Well I decided I would give it another try since maybe I got a lemon? I proceeded to initiate a replacement ticket and was directed to a customer service chat. I was told this was not possible and that I could return the product and just buy it again. When asked about the sale and if they would honor that price the customer service rep just repeated that they could only return it. I asked why and again was just asked if I wanted to return it. This product and process was not what I usually experience at Amazon and the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because the refund process was great as usual. Now I have to decide if I will pick another one up during the next sale which will most likely be Prime Day but this experience has left me looking for alternative options.
title: bluetooth drops frequently

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: YUCHEN F.
content: As a person who wants to use it as a Bluetooth speaker only, I found it very good in the aspect of sound quality. Its subwoofer gives it a totally different performance compared to other speakers. However, I do find it hard to use sometimes with the connection logic. First, I need to download the app to start to use it and a lot of functions are only available through voice control. For example, I tried the radio function in the app but when I close the app in the background, it continues to play the music and I have to unplug it. Overall, I think it gives me the best sound experience in this price range($150-$250) e.g better than bose home 300! but I wish that there could be a function to let me use it as a pure Bluetooth speaker.
title: A powerful speaker but not easy to use

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: GayGuy Approved
content: I wanted an amazing sounding system that could control the music and the volume with my voice command...and boy does this do the trick!  The sound is brilliant. I bought two studios and the subwoofer- don't skimp, get the subwoofer too - you'll be extremely happy that you did.  I paired the studio(s), the subwoofer, an echo, and an echo dot to create an "Everywhere" network throughout the house. "Amazing" is the word to use for this.  Friends who have Sonos are jealous of how great my Echo system sounds and how easy it is to play the music you want.  One drawback - if you're having a party, everyone starts screaming "ALEXA play...."  I'd say it's worth that one drawback.  Definitely GayGuy Approved.  A+
title: Echo Studio Hits It Out of the Park!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jeff Entsminger
content: I bought the first series Alexa when it was released so I thought it was time for a upgrade so I did my research online and read about all the BUZZ on this new model called STUDIO so I went to my favorite electronic store and took studio for a test drive........WOW I have to admit I was blown away not only by the sound quality with the bigger woofer and added speakers which I started to draw a crowd because I really wanted to hear what this baby could do but also by the built in hub and all the things it could control which my favorite electronic store has a GREAT display area set up in one area, needless to say this  NEW studio Alexa came home with me and I couldn’t be happier. So Amazon one again you hit it OUT OF THE PARK with this upgrade keep it coming you make life so much more enjoyable!!!!!!!!!! So if you haven’t figured it out yet I HIGHLY RECOMMEND STUDIO!!!!!!!!!
title: The quality and sound is amazing!!!!!!!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tmothy J. Sierra
content: I have been waiting for the right time to buy this, and I am glad I did. I kept going back and forth on buying it mainly between do I need it or do I want it, well I figured I want it and need it, the sound quality is amazing in my apartment. I have been playing more music now that I am stuck at home cleaning and it's perfect, the music quality is better than my car system. I just wish we could stream other music via bluetooth. Hopefully amazon fixes that with an update.  I am glad I bought this and my next purchase will be the subwoofer.
title: It's a great product.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Todd & Melanie
content: I ordered this during Amazon Deal Days so I got it for a decent price. I think if I would have paid the full price I would have been more disappointed. It is a large speaker with a small footprint. The sound is good and they made sure to dial back the volume level a bit so it does not distort at full volume. Set up is easy as could be and takes only a few minutes to get set up and running. Voice recognition is good is a lot better than the smaller speakers. It is not my go-to speaker when I want to Rock but as a daily driver for when I want to just listen to a podcast or stream music for background music.
title: Good but not Great

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Mike Karr
content: I have a 3rd gen Echo, a couple of 3rd gen Echo Dots, and a couple of Echo Inputs connected to powered speakers. The Studio provides some next-level sound, comparatively, and I am very happy with the quality, particularly when using all together for whole-house audio. I was very pleasantly surprised by the audio synchronization between my Bluetooth connected Bose Mini Soundlink, directly connected bookshelf speakers and the Studio. I expected some delay somewhere in the mix, but nope, it's right on. I've struggled with the notion of adding an Echo Subwoofer too, but the lows provided by the Studio are quite good, and I'm not sure it would make much of a difference. I do have the Studio placed fairly close to a corner, so sound clarity suffers a tiny bit, but it's pretty large, so leaving it out in the open is not ideal in my space.
title: Easy to Integrate

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Cameron D.
content: This speaker is fine but I bought it hoping to use it for music but also as a speaker for tv. It has a problem when you use it with a 3.5mm cable where it won’t go back to tv after you do any Alexa commands without unplugging the cable and plugging back in. Lot of complaints about it online. Should have some my research. It’s basically just a big echo because there are better speakers for sound quality.
title: Disappointed

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: JOBOOCH (UCME)
content: Can't skip songs when playing Spotify and when you ask Alexa to play Spotify it plays it but it plays it with commercials like you don't have a premium account don't know why but it doesn't make sense also be aware that you may be forever changing the volume on the Alexa studio and from your phone because it doesn't connect together you Alexa maybe at one volume and your phone might be at another overall the quality of the sound is good but there is a lot of bugs that need to be fixed especially with Spotify it wants you to use Amazon for your primary listening but not everyone likes it it's not user-friendly on the app you have to go through several obstacles just to get to the device settings and overall my opinion about Alexa is she doesn't listen well especially when asking to play something thru Spotify.
title: Alot of bugs with Amazons format and should be more user-friendly

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Mockingbird
content: This is a much larger speaker system than the standard and smaller Echo units.  It is heavy (as it should be for a good bass speaker magnet), and quite loud.  Do not compare this to a dedicated audio device costing a lot more.  It is quite good for the price, totally helpful in that it has full Echo functionality, and easy to install.  It is heavy for its size, so shelf placement and support needs to be carefully done. This is for streaming music as you do something else and still want to hear a full-range sound. It is not a replacement for Home theater, except perhaps for a very small room.
title: Excellent music for working and background as well as musical wakeup

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Trent Young
content: Sorry to say but in the store the speaker sounded great. I put it into my home environment with normal furniture and artwork,,, it sounded tinny at best. Tried to love it... I really tried... but had to send it back.
title: Sorry to say...

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Rylan
content: Same height but about twice the diameter of the regular Echo. Also sounds 4x as good in terms of power output and clarity. I do not use the hi res audio option ( I tried it as a free trial using my laptop with a hdmi cable to my receiver and floor standing Polk audio speakers) I honestly couldn’t tell which songs were 44 kHz sampling vs 192. Maybe if I was younger I would have been able to). I did notice that streamed audio from my IPhone didn’t sound great, ostensibly due to compression.  Maybe because it is clearer, these differences are more apparent. I’d buy another one.
title: I’d buy another one

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: GigglinGoth
content: Alexa is always amazing. We are so in love with this speaker! It gets LOUD! The bass is awesome! I am not an audiophile so I'm not going to ramble on but for us "regular" ppl this is stunning. I don't necessarily recommend it for apartments since even taking the base to its lowest setting is still pretty intense. The only issue, and it is pretty minor, is that it seems to have some difficulty when we tell it what playlist we want to hear. Considering that we only have one right now, it's frustrating when she comes up with random lists. I'm going to change the name if our playlist to see if that helps
title: Quite amazing, that Alexa!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Alex L.
content: Got this as a Xmas present and upgraded from the gen 1 echo to this one. It is a complete night and day difference. I'm not an audiophile by any stretch but I can hear the difference in sound quality between this and the gen 1 echo. The sound on this speaker is so much deeper, richer and clearer. The only downside is that the light ring isn't visible on the side of the device and the response ding isnt as loud as on the gen 1 so I can't as easily tell if the echo heard me. With that being said it does a very good job of hearing me and understanding what I'm asking. There has only been a handful of times where it didnt hear me and its when it was blasting music. I would definitely recommend if you are looking for a good sounding smart speaker.
title: Great Speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Big Damn D
content: I love my Studio! It's my favorite smart device so far. The bass on this is excellent.  I bought mine as soon as it was announced in 2019. This speaker looks good anywhere you put it. Amazon music service works flawlessly on this device. I even bluetooth my phone with it and use it to play the sound to some pinball games for maximum affect. We also use the drop in feature with a granddaughter who loves to check in. To summarize, this speaker has added true value to the home in multiple ways. I look forward to see the coming developments of Alexa and this speaker-bot.  With all the mic's built-in, the guard feature is worth the expense by itself.
title: Best Speaker-bot ever!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: DixonFire
content: I really wanted to like the echo studio but to be honest it's just ok at best. It MIGHT be a $200 speaker sound wise but that's it. Certainly not impressive sounding to myself. Functionally it's pretty sad. Apple Music is not functional. Yes, it will play music but if you make the mistake of buying this and wanting to use Apple Music, you will understand my frustration. Some songs show in the app, some don't. You can't shuffle anything. If you do get it to actually shuffle, it's not the whole play list only the handful of songs it decides to show in the Alexa app. Amazon really dropped the ball on this!!!! I would not buy this again under any circumstance.
title: D0 NOT BUY if using Apple Music!!!!......read this

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: sweetils
content: This speaker is AMAZING. When visiting my hair stylist, he turned this thing on and the sound blew me away. I had to see where it came from because the sound was so vibrant, clear, and amazing. This small speaker is PERFECT. Immediately I purchased while there, BB had for $199 but it came with 2 other items and the next day, on sale for $169 with extras so price was adjusted. I received and the setup was a bit much but it sounds-adjusts to the room. I love and since I'm able to pair with my appliances, i love even more. Highly recommend and the sound is far better then any of the other high priced speakers.
title: I love it

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Vincent K
content: This is a very high quality unit. The sound is quite good. It does require more volume though to sound good then the standard Echo device. IMO at lower volumes the regular Echo sounds better. For a large room the Studio is a must unless you have multiple standard Echo units. The sound of the Studio is huge and clear when you get past half volume. At low volumes the Studio lacks bass were the standard Echo does not.  The Studio is worth the money IMO. It is quite larger in size and hosts 5 speakers instead of the single speaker in the standard unit. 2 standard Echoes might be a viable option to 1 Studio.
title: Great Sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: B. Stokes
content: I love my Echo Studio. It truly has high fidelity sound. The highs are crisp and the lows are loud. Midrange is clear (voices). My brother has a regular Echo and the Studio is amazing sound compared to my brother's. The Studio automatically adjusts to the room acoustics to best put out Hi-Fi sound. Just one Studio fills the room with music but I added an Echo Sub to my Studio to power up the bass. They are awesome together. I even want to use it instead of my ear buds at night because it sounds so good. Amazon has outdone itself! Also, see my review of the Echo Sub - you'll want one.
title: Professional sound at a reasonable price. I love it!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: PNW_GAL
content: It seems that Amazon pushed out an unfinished product. When it works, the sound is great! However these are the issues I face: - Every few hours the sound completely drops for a minute or two. Very irritating if you are watching a movie. - It won't respond half the time, or it will respond even if you are not talking to it. Overall this is a waste of $200.
title: I have a ton of Amazon devices. This is probably the worst one.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: mazarmi
content: My first echo studio worked flawlessly and sounded amazing first day then two days later I decided to play some music and only the woofer worked and all other speakers were dead. Customer service was very helpful but all troubleshooting led to them sending me another device. The new device showed up in different packaging which is a concern since a 3 day old device should be replaced with a new.... but out of the box the speaker was popping and crackling like an old record when the speaker was active using voice or audio. So customer service tried again and the third device I opened had the same plain black box with no power cord and same popping and crackling. I’m so disappointed in this speaker!!!!! Sending it back for a 3rd time this time I thinks it’s time to find a different speaker.....
title: Might still be a beta product

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: RobDad
content: This has been my biggest Echo device disappointment.  The Echo Studio works horribly when you pair it with a Fire Stick.  The sound constantly cuts out, every 30 seconds or so. I searched for a solution online only to discover its been a problem for roughly a year already.  How could Amazon *not* come up with a fix for this? Both the Studio and the Fire Stick are only 15 feet away from my router and the Fire Stick never had a problem before I paired it with the Studio.  I'm going to give it another week or so, but if it doesn't clear up I'll be returning it.
title: Do NOT use with a television

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Sean D
content: I love the sound quality and its small form factor. My only complaint is this: I have my computer feeding through the unit via a physical jumper from the audio output on the computer to the hard-wired audio on the Echo Studio. When I wake up in the morning and power up the computer to watch the news, the sound comes through perfectly . . . until I bump my phone and it comes on. Bye-bye audio from the computer. I have to access the Alexa app to disconnect the Bluetooth and then wait a bit for the Studio to remember it has a line in. Not a big deal overall, just a small annoyance.
title: Its connection jumps about a bit.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Sonny D
content: I love that you can hook it up to the fire cube so I can use the remote I can hook it up to my original sound system but now I definitely want another Echo Studio to pair together, but just one still pumps major sound
title: Dolby digital plus

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Wire Mesh Basket
content: Quite the step up from my Echo Dot.  First off, the sound is great.  Bass can be a bit much, but can be adjusted in the app.  Also, seems much more responsive than my Echo Dot.  Takes up little space for the amount of sound it produces.  Paired it with my Fire stick 4k, and it improves the audio immensely.  A bit pricey, but compared to a decent sound bar, you get a lot more value, considering it can replace your Echo altogether.  Overall, I can definitely recommend the upgrade, especially if you are in the market for a sound bar, and use (or plan on using) Alexa integration in your home.
title: Great sound, an Echo on steroids

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Marcia Blount
content: The Echo Studio is excellent for music beyond any of the other Echos!  I have almost every version of Echo, including the newest 10" Echo Show.  I also listen to music a lot on my Echo Show 8", and it sounds great - especially in my bathroom.  I got the Studio as a gift for my hubby's birthday to use in our enclosed sunroom, and the sound is amazing.  I liked it so much, I ordered one for my living room!
title: You will love music even more with the Echo Studio!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: El Dodo
content: I’m really enjoying my Echo Studio. It really pays homage to its name with excellent volume and sound quality for a single speaker in a 14ft x 14ft x 8 room with mixed reflecting and absorbing acoustics. Not only the baseline sound is very good but I can tune it further with bass, mid, and treble controls. I’m really enjoying listening to each one of my favorite songs and re-enjoying it again. Aside from the playback quality it can listen to me even if playing really loud so I can control the playback by just saying “Alexa...” Amazon really hit this one out of the park! Great job! This is going to develop a following!
title: Couldn’t have asked for more!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Alex MacKenzie
content: Update: streaming music works 15% of the time for multi room music. Customer service has done nothing to solve this issuse. Pathetic!!! Since installing this into my network of 6 echo dot's nothing works.  I can no longer listen to music on my everywhere group I can no longer adjust the volume using my voice. After spending 4 days contacting customer service finally I have been told that it might start working EVENTUALLY if the software is able to update. I  Feel like I have not only wasted my time but my money. Amazon has offered no solutions has offered nothing to compensate me for my frustration or time. After spending hundreds of dollars I am completely let down and dissatisfied with Amazon Alexa
title: Cannot stream music.. Ruined my smart home network.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Justin K.
content: I have two in my living room as my sound system for my TV. For the price it's pretty great sound system. It also connects to my PS4 via a bluetooth dongle with no issues at all. I even set a voice command to have it connect when using my PS4. For movies it's pretty amazing for movies and works perfectly with my fire tv. Only downside for me is if I just ask alexa to play music directly it will only play from one speaker.. if i use the amazon music app through fire tv then I can get them both. Since the fire tv is what allows them to pair together it makes sense though.
title: Two of these in stereo pair is pretty awesome

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: T. Person
content: I recently moved and have been looking at the Studio for a while.  I'm so happy I pulled the trigger on this bad-boy!  Shortly after plugging it in, it performed a room test to optimize the sound.  Once completed, I had it play one of my favorite songs.  It did NOT disappoint. The sound is SO good, my 20-year old son heard it and immediately purchased one for his apartment.  The bass was so loud, his neighbors had to tell him to turn it down one-night last week.  If you're looking for great sound at a fair price AND Alexa integration, don't wait, just get it.
title: Rocking Echo!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: MDVasta
content: I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised. It's not as good as the Homepod in sound quality (but honestly, Siri is still terrible) and not nearly as good as the Google Max speakers (the best of the lot) but, for the price, they've come a long way. I paired two together for a decent, acceptable sound. Clear mids and highs, the bass is adequate and not too "boomy" or muddy. The pair can get pretty loud without breaking up. Decent speaker(s) either by itself or as a pair when they go on sale. DO NOT waste your money on the sub-woofer. That's a joke and Amazon should be embarrassed by that failure.
title: Not bad for the price when they're on sale

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Cheng Hui
content: Have many speakers. Try many speakers. This echo studio sound quality doesn't surprise me at all. The only thing it wow me. It's the set up sound. After that. I'm sure I will only pay less than hundred bucks for the sound. Even echo input with my old computer speaker sounds much better than this. LoL 3d music!!???  No difference at all..
title: Not sure this worth 200 bucks. Feel so so.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Rob71350
content: I love the device and the sound it produces but there's a very annoying problem with Alexa Echo Studio recognizing some music artists.  For example, it would not recognize famous singer, Jack Jones but repeatedly played Jax Jones.  It also does not recognize foreign sounding names either.  I contacted support and was told the device is new on the market and there are issues that still need to be resolved.  Really disappointing because I bought it thinking it would play what I wanted. 8 months later as of July 31, 2020,  still no improvement in Alexa Studio recognizing a number of commands.  Often trouble recognizing my playlists. I sometimes need to spell the name before recognition works. I speak clearly, loudly and slowly and even that sometimes doesn't work.  The sound is wonderful but Alexa's ability to recognize what is being asked is very unstable.
title: Alexa Echo Studio not recognizing some music artists

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Bluffdad
content: I really wanted to be wowed by this speaker.  I mainly purchased it to substitute for the television speakers. The speaker sounds really good, wide range with good dynamics, but as a point source.  I expected to hear sounds emanate from the sides of the room, above me and behind me. For me, it doesn't. Now, if I didn't have these expectations I likely would be satisfied.  I also would be really grateful if the speaker had a digital output to pass high resolution music from the speaker to an audio amplifier to appreciate fully Amazon Music UHD music.
title: Wanted to be wowed.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Gagandeep
content: Incredible! I just replaced my Sonos 5.1(Play bar, Sub and SL’s) with this one. I was very reluctant to try echo studio home theatre in the beginning but after reading so many tech articles and watching YouTube positive response I decided to have it a try. The sound quality is just phenomenal and beyond my expectations. I always had an issues with Sonos play bar with low mids and vocal. This echo studio setup has great mids and vocals. If your living room is too big like mine (20x20) you definitely wants to pair echo sub with it.
title: Great for home theatre with fire tv!!!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Matias Podesta
content: Such good sound quality, super happy with this purchase
title: Super happy

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Leigh Wood
content: The Echo Studio smart speaker came well packaged and in a timely manner. Easy set up and fairly easy to add Spotify and Apple Music services. The device is solidly built and weighs a couple of pounds. The device responds to my voice even when I have the thing on max volume. The bass is deep and I haven’t heard any distortion of the other speakers. Alexa can be a little bit annoying when it doesn’t understand the words I’m saying so I have to ask it a few times using different ways of saying the same thing. Over all I like this device and I’d certainly recommend it.
title: Loud sound with deep bass.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Robert Werden Replica Props
content: I'll be honest, I bought this for the native hub integration. My Smartthings hub got some sort of firm ware update or something that caused half my led lights to stop responding. The hub became unusable. So the Studio connected to most of them, but not all. Some of the really old non zigbee are done, but they were really old. All of the silvania br30 color bulbs instantly connected to the studio, and all the AGSHOME ZIGBEE Motion Sensors connected perfectly. Really wish Echos had this hub from the start, these off brand devices are always horrible, but now they all work.
title: Great speaker, let me throw out my smartthings hub

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Nello
content: I had wanted to order another Echo Sub to pair with the Echo Show I use in my office, but it seems those are no longer available. I'd not heard of the Echo Studio, but took a chance and ordered one. The set up proved easier than any of my previous Echoes. Which is simply to say it worked immediately with little effort from me. I'm using the Echo Show for most Alexa purposes, so just created a speaker group with the Studio, and turned off its microphone.  This combination is doing just what I wanted; great sound quality with the two working in tandem, and the bass coming from the Studio is a great improvement.
title: Just What I Needed (Almost)

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: T. R.
content: It is not a $500 studio speaker, but close enough to be well worth the price and taking two into your home, for music and for Alexa smart speaker functions.  And it can pump out a lot of volume without perceivable distortion.  I am so glad I bought them, two of them.  Buy two of them. Set them as a Stereo-Pair. They will fill the largest living room with super clear sound.  Just say, "Alexa, play Run by Leona Lewis" and these two stereo speakers will blow your mind!  Or say, "Alexa, play WBUR" and use them to listen to "the radio".  I am completely satisfied with these.
title: Great as a stereo pair, in my living room

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Michael Ashe
content: I've been using the original first generation Alexa/Echo for years and have been waiting for a unit with more volume/bass, now I have it!  Yes, I like it for music (although vocals in some songs can get drowned out a bit) but for listening to audio books, or just asking Alexa/Echo questions, the voice is too loud has way too much bass and sounds unnatural/muddy.  Also, I use the timer all the time while cooking, it always blasts way too loud. Hopefully Amazon can tweak the settings for lower volume for everything other than music, and more natural sounding voices.
title: Great for music, not great for Audible and alarms

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tyson
content: I have to press setup like every day and go through the process of setting it up on my phone. I like when it actually works. Extremely hard to keep connected with Bluetooth from phone. It cannot pick how it wants to play and from what. Alexa app on my phone constantly interrupted my "Alexa" commands! Then echo says "no internet" When I say Alexa both my phone and echo respond. I use Alexa at home and with my car.
title: Extremely upset with connectivity. Or lack there of.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Coy Kringelhede
content: I initially place the Echo Studio on the top shelf of my work station.  This was OK while I was sitting at the workstation.  It wasn't until I walked away from the workstation into the middle of the room I realized how much fuller and vibrant the sound was.  I relocated the Echo Studio to lower shelf close to level of my ears while sitting and it is a VAST improvement. I have a few other Echos so I was familiar with Alexa and this device handles Alexa like all the others. With the home automation, you need to have a home automation system (I have Wink) that integrates with Alexa.  This is not clear in the Echo Studio description.  It infers home automation directly with Echo.  This is the same function as with the Echo Dot.
title: Awesome sound, but placement is key

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: kurz04
content: This is surprisingly  a great addition to my home entertainment!!!! At first I was a little skeptical because I've always been a BOSE fan but I have to say for there first try at a  high end room filling sound system there pretty close not quite there yet bit I'm sure just like all there other speaker products they will nail it on the next generation model...
title: Close guys keep up the good work!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: John Haider
content: So I use this speaker oll over the house.....yes it sometimes doesnt sound as good in spots....but it's meant to be a 3d like speaker for all around....so placing it near walls and stuff would effect its sound. Ive used this speaker out doors....and it can really rock an outside party. Soooooo loud. Sounded more amazing outside to be honest. As always there are flaws.....but these flaws are tyoically based on Wi-Fi. Like lower end Wi-Fi that cant support too many items. I know the 3.5 is optical....but it says aux too so I tried it....and it in fact works....but at half volume. The only app I use now is Amazon music. But even with that....i dind myself searching for songs.....unkike YouTube where my songs typically pop up when listening to other similar songs. Amazing music varied so much each time I chose the my music playlist. I never liked ANY of the songs. All in all this speaker is pretty good. I ordered an toslink to mini toslink optical to see how it sounds for home theatre. Love love love this speaker. Gonna order another for 400watts of power.
title: Looooooove this speaker. Needing another to pair

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: MB
content: This purchase was a leap of faith into the world of smart speakers that turned out to far exceed my expectations.  As always, the studio was easy to set up (took less than 2 min) and the resulting sound was absolutely impressive, complete night and day difference when compared to older echo.  Although the bass was strong, clear and added the needed depth I was so impressed with the studio that I purchased the echo sub along with a second studio to create a true stereo environment feeding off of my prime music HD subscription.  With the price point, quality and ease of use, Echo Studio is an absolute win for Amazon...and for me the end user.
title: Game changing update to the Echo line

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: GDD
content: Definitely not impressed with the sound quality. I made the decision to purchase based on various online reviews rating it closely to another product I own which is a Marshall Kilburn yes I know the Kilburn costs $100 more than the Studio but reviews were comparing them as close.  Next i know the Kilburn is not the best measure but I happen to own one because I love the convince of being able to carry it around and take it outside. Lastly If you have a large room 20x25 with vaulted ceilings it just doesn’t fill the room. It gets loud but again it doesn’t seem to surround you. If you have audiophile grade or even close to audiophile grade equipment I would recommend going with another option.
title: Not even close to audiophile quality audio

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Holly Slabbinck
content: I bought the Alexa echo studio And it was delivered today. Set up took no time and the sound quality is powerful and clean. I have a background in music and studio engineering and although a single speaker doesn’t always deliver what a more complex system can deliver, I’ve never heard a single speaker that does more than this one. I love it. It’s so simple practical and powerful.
title: Great speaker- powerful sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Outdoer
content: I really like the relatively small and unobtrusive size of the studio.  It really does a good job on it's own, however, I think it kicks up a notch just by simply pairing it with a couple of echo dots also in the room.  If I had a couple of Echo's paired instead I am sure that it would even be a richer experience than it is now.  I am curious as to how the echo sub added to the mix would improve the sound.  Currently the bass delivered by the Echo Studio alone isn't bad at all.  Maybe I will make that addition in future, but right now I am quite satisfied.
title: Big Sound small package

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: wofse
content: Update ;  The yesterday the speaker started cutting in and out using the Fiber Optic input while watching TV and after a 3 email volley a new speaker arrives tomorrow (YEA to customer service). What do you say when the speaker is smarter then you? This is a GREAT sounding speaker that initially sets it self up... great, then you try to tweak it like utilizing BT from your Samsung Series 7 and nothing works, after 1 week still can’t make it happen.  Then try switching between optical cable from TV to Amazon Music and back.  Not happening YET. This is a speaker in progress at this time.  It’s good and worth $200 it’s just not a refined product yet.
title: A work in progress...& getting better

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Anthony Lunn
content: So I own this and an Apple HomePod. I A-B this right next to an Apple HomePod in my house with my music. The Apple HomePod is definitely higher fidelity, but the HomePod is a one trick pony in my opinion and there are a few other disappointing elements of the HomePod. The Echo Studio is all around the better “smart” speaker especially if you already have echo or Alexa infrastructure in your house. The sound is fairly solid; after some EQ in the app you can get it to perform. I think the sound has a better gelling compression as well so songs sound more stereo. There is a 3D mode that works on Amazon music that adds enough separation and sparkle to sound more like a HomePod if you really like a lot of clarity in your home audio. I saved this for last, I was a sound engineer for over a decade and I think both speakers are pretty good for a single speaker that auto adjusts to your environment. You’ll be pretty happy to save the space and have the assistant with either. In the end I go with Echo studio because it can connect to Bluetooth which allows me to stream anything I want to it. The HomePod only allows Airplay.
title: I choose Echo Studio over the Apple HomePod

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Cesar tellez
content: Big disappointment. I was really excited to receive this speaker for Christmas and for the reviews it was receiving and what a let down. I’m just going to make it quick and simple. The sound quality is good not great, you’re better off going with a Marshall Kilburn which also has Alexa built in for around the same price with a much much better sound. The build is really good but the weight in it is really heavy. Don’t understand for what though. Lastly and the most important for me at least. Is the connectivity, it states is Bluetooth compatible but it is not , unless it is connected with WiFi. If you’re not connected on WiFi it is a useless speaker which will not work on anything. And that is the reason I recommend not to buy it. Please you are better of with a Marshall Kilburn any day over this inferior product. As I will be buying.
title: Let down!!!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: John W.
content: It's an ok device, but not that much better than the 2nd gen echo plus. Pros: -Like the other echos, it's all-around a great smarthome device. -Decent music compared to the smaller echos. -I can tell the audio quality has slightly more range than the echo plus and can be moderately louder than the plus. Cons: -Despite having more audio range the music doesn't actually sound that much better than an echo plus. This is not really acceptable when the device takes up twice the space. In some scenarios, the audio is worse. Disabling the sound enhancement feature helps the audio quality for most songs. I can tell it was updated at some point to work better, so you can leave it on now, but still needs more patching. -The Alexa voice level is under volumed compared to the music volume. -The ring at the top is slightly too high for proper visibility. -The microphone does not pick up commands as well as the echo plus that was located in the same spot. Not just when music is playing either.
title: Not much better than the 2nd gen echo plus. Wait for the 2nd generation.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: 🌟 Dad Joke Loading 🌟
content: This is a great speaker to listen to all your music on. It has five speakers and 300 w certainly a very loud speaker and sounds great from all angles and directions. Make sure to subscribe to the HD Service as it's great. I did run into a little static problem after I upgraded to the HD service but simply saying to the studio to check for software updates it did an update and fixed the problem. This is my favorite speaker among my many different echo devices. Get 2 of them for an incredible stereo experience. Maybe future versions might incorporate an echo show style screen as well. Quite a bargain for $199
title: Excellent 5 speaker unit!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Stanhope
content: I have 6 Apple Home Pods grouped into 3 pair.  I would say that the echo studio sounds as good as a single one.  The first echo studio was defective but Reggie at Amazon customer service was outstanding.  I am completely pleased with the purchase and it cost far less than the home pod.  I am buying another one this week.  Buy with confidence.
title: Like it very much

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Nathaniel Wall
content: The main point of this thing is supposed to be it's increased bass over its predecessors. Does it have a bit more bass? Sort of. No matter what I do with the EQ, it still just sounds empty. The bass is dissapointedly lacking. I don't get it. It has a decent woofer speaker, but it's just not there. The homepod and Bose SoundLink mini 2 sound so much deeper than this thing. I guess it's proof that a bigger cone doesn't equate to quality bass. I'll be returning and going back to just the plus.
title: Bass is somehow lacking

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Rich H.
content: My Wife and I had a problem setting the Echo to our WIFI, but after contacting Amazon Tech support we were able to connect. The sound of the music is incredible, and the base is great for a 5  1/2 in speaker. The sound fills the room of  the four speakers making each instrument clear and realistic. I can't praise the Echo Studio any  higher. Love the amount of music available from Amazon.
title: Echo Studio.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jana
content: You would think, that spending $200 on a speaker would be a guaranteed way to listen to music but it never works. It'll play 1 song and then stop and then I can never get it to play another. I've tried Bluetooth-ing my phone to it and still, will not work. If you're not planning on listening to music, everything else works fine. But that was the whole point of me buying it.
title: Doesn't play music

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: R. J. King
content: I've found that, ultimately, the Echo Studio is a good product. You just have to be sure your internet connection and your WiFi is set up correctly. I was having a lot of problems, until I checked my modem (not the router). It's seems that Xfinity had stopped supporting my modem, and I didn't realize that. After replacing my modem, I have had a good experience with two Echo Studios set up in Home Theater mode with my tv.
title: Good product

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Brian
content: I have plenty of Echos in my house. I really didn’t need another one but I was looking for something to give me more bass when I play music through the whole house. I’ve tried placing this on a shelf, in an entertainment center and even just sitting on the floor. None of these places have me the bass I was hoping for. Don’t get me wrong, this is an amazing echo device. The sound quality from the other speakers in this is great. If you were to pair this with another Studio I’m sure it’d sound amazing. My problem is, for the price, this is not worth it.
title: Not worth it. Yet.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ancient Mariner
content: This is far superior in sound quality to the Echo 3rd generation, and a really good buy at the current discount price. Fills my moderate sized living room with solid feel at only half volume. Alexa responds very well even while noise level is moderate. Base is good for a 5.25" woofer. Upper and midrange frequencies very clear. A really good speaker. Best I've heard anywhere near this price point and I have a pair of BA bookshelf speakers of lesser sound quality at a higher price. Stereo feel of the Studio is better than the BAs somehow. Ingenious design.
title: This is a great product.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Kenny L Nipp
content: I got this to go in my garage to play music and TV audio. I have a 2 car garage and it works okay for this. The volume of sound has to be set at maximum to enjoy music. Any lower and it becomes too low to hear. -I've discovered that the volume issue is the volume level from bluetooth connected devices. The volume from streaming services is much louder. I only wish a person could augment the Alexa voice to respond differently. Like wehn I ask it to play jazz, instead of saying 'Sure....'  I'd love to make it say 'Ok Daddy-oh...' Just more personalized.
title: Great quality sound. Wish I could make it to be more personalized with it's affirmatives.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Criss
content: Using this paired with a Fire TV Cube. My wife says it sounds better than the LG sound bar and sub that was living under our LG TV. The sound really is able to fill a large living room and can get plenty loud. I'm updating this review as the optical connection is unreliable. The sound through the optical input drops out and restarts repeatedly. This is a great speaker for use with the cube, but can't seem to handle being connected to the cube and a TV at the same time.
title: Sounds Great! If you only use fire TV

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Wanchese West
content: This device was purchased to use outside and on decks. For that purpose it gets the job done. Plays plenty loud and it's easy to follow the party around the house,just unplug and go. Set up was effortless. Inside the house though, the sound falls short. Everything sounds diffuse, and the speaker seems very directional. I have found no instances where the speaker 'disappears'. The breathy tone/delivery of music on the device makes me wonder if the high bit rate of Amazon Music HD isn't totally wasted with the Echo Studio.
title: Maybe, Mehby Not

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: J. Evans
content: I bought this because of the audio in jack. I run an audio wire from my PC out to the audio in on the Studio. I have an Amazon Music HD subscription which allows me to download Ultra HD audio to my computer for playback on the Studio. The sound of the Studio is outstanding, but I didn't get the full benefit I wanted until I adjusted the equalizer on the Alexa app on my phone. I brought the bass, mids and highs over to the plus side and that worked for me. The sound quality of the Studio is great. I'm very happy with my purchase.
title: I love it. Make sure to adjust the equalizer in the Alexa App

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: GadgetAngel
content: I LOVE THIS DEVICE.  and I love that Amazon has done what no other company has done.....update the Audio streaming format so that you get better than CD quality. You can actual tell a cow bell is being used on a song, instead of it just sounding like a pot is being hit.  I have not heard anything about Apple doing this (3D) yet and they started the whole music library bit. So a BIG thank you to Amazon for the 3D format.  This Echo has the best speaker sound!! I would definitely buy another one.
title: Fantastic Sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Larry Bell
content: Great echo device. After having an echo 1st generation for years, it was time to upgrade. Since we listen to music so much, I wanted one with better sound and this has that in spades. Listening to music through the Studio is a much better experience. Bigger (around) and heavier, but that is and should be expected. It's not audiophile quality, but that's fine - it's more than good enough. Even though the bass response (which is tight and loud) is fine, when the echo sub is available again, I'll be adding that. Very happy with the echo studio!
title: Great sound and a good upgrade.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: AskGenie
content: I just received my Studio yesterday and I couldn't have been more disappointed. I'm an avid and seasoned Alexa user. Historically I have owned dots and shows. I never got into the echo's because sound bars are so cheap for a descent sounding setup. I expected the Studio to blow that setup out of the water. I am so disappointed. I have an $89 sound bar with subwoofer that sounds way better. My only consolation is that I was able to purchase it from Dell for $70 using a rebate offered on a credit card. For $70 bucks I'll keep it. Otherwise, I would already have it packed up to go back. IMHO, epic fail.
title: Does not live up to it's billing

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: GregA
