content: If you have weak wi fi signal Alexa will shut down and not restart until you give verbal instructions.  So unless you have a very strong wi fi signal do not not bother with this.  I had it for a week and it constantly shut down when wi fi signal wavered and will not resume unless you give verbal instructions to restart.  No good in an area like mine where ATT signal is weak.  Am returning the Alexa studio.  cannot understand why a restart program is not a crucial part of this device when wi fi signal is weak or lost.
title: No good with weak wi fi signa

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Review King
content: We got this for our main tv. Sometime you give her an instruction and the audio stays on quiet. Then you tell her to turn the volume up and it jumps up so loud. None of our other devices do that.  The sound quality is great and we use it for everything. The integration with the gen 1 fire cube can be spotty as well.
title: We have Alexa everywhere

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: M. Jacks
content: I upgraded my Echo + to the Studio for 2 reasons. One was to get 3D music and better sound from Amazon Music which this works well for. The second is to utilize the Studio to get Atmos from my Toshiba FireTV. This is where I was let down. It turns out that the stereo integration only works with Gen 3 TV's. My TV is a Gen 2. It would be nice to get a firmware update to the TV to allow integration so I can use it for Atmos. Music does sound great though. I may pair it with an Echo sub for better bass.
title: NIce for music

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Joel Fradkin
content: I bought two and a sub to replace my 17year old home theater it sounds super great for music and fire stick 4k. I tried using bluetooth for spectrum tv stuff was awful. Cant hook to theatre group and awful lag. I'm going to try hulu they have dvr and premium channels.  I'm paying 84 a month now but hulu be more like a 100, but sound through firestick is really great. Be worth 17 a month.
title: Great great sound.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Cmull
content: Bought 2 studios for the sole purpose of integrating them with my my fire TV. The sound is great, if it works. The problem is that the speakers are in and out. The speakers often lose connection and the Alexa app is useless. It really is annoying and at over 300 for the two, it’s a complete waste of money. My faith in Amazon products is waning.
title: Not dependable

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Media Mogul
content: I bought an Echo studio to use on my patio for summer gatherings. The sound is okay for a portable speaker, but like all these types of portable speakers they desperately need a complimentary sub woofer. Like with my Samsung sound bar, it has decent sound, but it sounds a heck of a lot better with its two satellite speakers and matching sub woofer. For whatever reason Amazon appears to have stopped making the sub woofer for the Echo studio speaker and so I sent my Echo studio back. I'm Still looking for a good sound solution for my patio.
title: Would be much better if only it had a matching sub woofer

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Lysa Dahlin
content: I have an Echo and 2 echo dots,  and traded in the former for this new product.  I am so disappointed, I wish I could have my old Echo back.  Alexa is very slow to respond and often cuts out and delays in the middle of a sentence.  (It is not my home wireless, because the echo dots continue to work flawlessly.)  The sound is strong for playing music, which is the only reason I didn't give it one star.  However, the overall performance is so disappointing and underwhelming for the price (actually, at any price.)  Don't bother until they work out some obvious bugs and issues.
title: Very highly disappointing

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tracy
content: The wife and I have many devices from Amazon and we always said if they come out with a premium device we will buy it.  So we were happy to see this come available. I ordered it and it took about month to get it because of back orders. I was very excited to get it in our home and start streaming music. We play a lot of music here. We mostly play classic rock but it will go all over the place. We play everything.  This device sounds good but we really expected a bigger jump in sound and volume. The range is good but not there for us.  If this is your first device you will be blown away. Pair this with music unlimited.  For us we expected more room filling sound.
title: Looking for the next level. This wasn't it. Still good.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: John G. Bennett
content: The sound quality is better than my Echo, but not a lot.  The main problem is if I want to use them both to play music they not only don't integrate, but Alexa tries to sell me a $14.95/mo subscription to be able to stream simultaneously.  This may be compounded by the fact of having an Amazon TV cube in the same room.  And if I ask Alexa to do something I never know which one is going to reply. I'm considering returning the unit as it makes the Echo sort of useless even if I take it upstairs or to another room.
title: Somewhat Disappointed

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Chase Coxxx
content: I have two of the Echo Studio speakers paired with an Echo Sub and now my all of Spotify music and TV viewing through my Fire TV 4K streaming stick have deep, rich sound that fills the room. It has enough volume to block out any background noise that Manhattan can throw your way. I like the sound and the Alexa integration, I wish I were able to give each Echo Studio a separate wake up command  the way I was able to do with my Echo Plus stereo pair, but both speakers seem to act as one now. Another grip is how long it takes for the audio to resume after I give a command while content is playing.
title: Sounds good enough to be better than the sound system that most of your friends and family have.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: N. Fuller
content: Loved it.  I preordered it and got it October 8, 2019.  Loved it. It worked great in our family room which is large.  But this last month she had problems connecting to the internet.  I knew it wasn't my internet because I have an echo plus in the kitchen  and she she great would overhear us asking the studio plus (who was having trouble communicating) and would answer the question.  I unplugged the studio, I reset her and then last last night she won't even turn on.  I know she is getting power because the microphone light is on.  Sad.  I missed the chance to return it by 4 months.  I did not get the extended warranty  because I have had such good experiences with Amazon products.  But if you are considering one, I would get the extended warranty.
title: Great Echo but only lasted18 months. Great while it lasted.  Get the extended warranty!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Richard B.
content: Update: 5/23: Revising my review since the issues with audio loss requiring me to reboot the Fire TV Stick 4K and the Echo Studio a few times a week are gone. Most likely it was a bug that was fixed in a software update to one of the devices. My only complaint now is that the only multichannel input for non-Fire TV devices is optical and thus limited to DD and not DD+ or Atmos. Original Review: I bought this to improve the sound from my TV. Since I use a Fire TV Stick 4K as the only source, I was excited to give it a try and I really love the integration with the volume control from the Fire TV remote controlling the Echo Studio perfectly.  I'm also happy with the sound quality and really enjoy it when it is working. The problem that brings me to two stars is that the audio will occasionally cut out when playing from the Fire TV Stick 4K and the only way to recover is to reboot the devices. Thinking it was network related I tried a different access point with WiFi to both, ethernet to just the Stick 4K, ethernet to just the Echo Studio, ethernet to both, and the issue does not go away. It happens often enough (every 2 days or so) that I had to go back to the TV speakers to stop my family from complaining so now the Echo Studio sits collecting dust.
title: Sounds good, but loses audio every couple of days

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Dustin Hunt
content: When I bought this, I was skeptical that the quality of sound would not be in the same league of the big sound companies such as Bose.  After listening, I said straight to hell with Bose.  I swear on a stack of Bibles that this is the best sounding speaker I have ever heard.  And while it isn't even comparable to the Echo dot in sound quality and volume, it still lacks that bonecrushing volume that you want when you're trying to blow out the walls and raise Elvis from the grave with some Mötley Crüe or such.  I suppose I am just going to have to wait until Amazon comes up with a 3 foot tall Echo floor speaker.  Or if other companies would finally get their head out of their @sses and come up with something similar to that WITH Echo MRM capability.  Amazon opened the door to that a while back, but surprisingly no one has really jumped on it! Overall, this speaker is well worth what you pay.  I would suggest setting them up in stereo if you can afford it though.  I can't imagine how good this thing would sound with two of them in a room!
title: Best speaker available with Echo MRM capability

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Sweetestjoy
content: This probably has just as much to do with Apple as it does Alexa's programming, but seriouisly, it shouldn't take me 30 tries to get it to my play my playlists!! I get so upset at it that I started yelling at her, which if course doesn't help the situation and I have to get my voice back under control. I try all different combinations of saying things to get her to play. Sometimes it works instantly. Great! But it should work, oh, maybe 90% of the time. Please hook up with Apple and get that working!
title: I really like this device, but

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Erik
content: These speakers are a great value for the money, easy to set up, sound great and overall just an awesome way to transform your home into a theatre like experience.  In regards to the reviews from the audiophiles trashing the quality; they're just completely off for what these studios are meant for.  Actual studio speakers are meant to sound flat for production purposes. A home entertainment system, unless you're going to pay crazy money, is meant to be loud, clear and not distort. These are great for music and streaming in a living room to give you that theatrical feel. If you want to install an actual theater in your house, then yes, go spend way more money on better speakers. The sounds is really impressive for the price point.  I have studio monitors in my music studio that cost hundreds more per speaker, and what can I say? I'm just impressed with what they're delivering for the price. My current set up is a Fire TV Cube with 2 Echo Studio speakers. One placed on each side of the television for a true stereo experience. When listening at really low volumes, I double checked a few times to make sure the sound was coming from speakers because the stereo imaging really is that good.  Dialogue centers right to the TV and the ambiance is great, not to mention the panning of sound effects from left to right (you'll feel it when you see that plane fly across screen, bullets fly from one side of the room not to mention movie scores sound great).  The room analyzer really is fantastic and uses your walls to reflect sounds for a great experience. The speakers are balanced and my only recommendation for the EQ is to open up the Alexa App, throw your "Highs" all the way to the top (to the far right of the slider), your mids to the middle and give yourself just a little boost for the bass.  Now we're talking!  If you push your bass or mids too far it's going to sound muddy.  Again, these aren't studio speakers and I think the EQ provided is more than sufficient. I've tried watching with just one speaker to see how it sounds. The speaker auto adjusts to the room and does give a convincing stereo feel to your experience, however, if you double the speaker, you double the power—this means you're gonna get way more punch and I can't recommend it enough.  If you're on a budget or on the fence, just try one. Overall the sound is good, set up is easy and EQing them on the app is a breeze. So big checks for all of these things. Within 30 minutes (read about the delay below) I was re-watching favorite action and sci movies just to hear them in my living room and I was really impressed with the quality of the highs, mids and even the bass. I don't understand why one would invest in the Echo Sub — just get 2 Studio speakers and the combined power of them is going to give them all the "UMMF" you need.  The woofer in these guys is plenty at higher volumes. In comparison to the apple home pods: As someone who almost exclusively uses apple products, I couldn't be happier with these.  Apple is just charging way too much for their speakers for slightly better quality and they will sound not much better to the untrained ear. It's simply not worth the extra money. So why aren't these getting 5 stars? Well to be honest, I wasn't aware that they would only connect as a studio pair with Fire TV over wi-fi. Read that carefully. Yes, they still have a quarter inch in (like for your headphones on your phone) and they are blue tooth enabled, but in order to take advantage of using them in stereo they need to be connected over wifi and so does the sound source. Therefor, you aren't having a party and letting people just connect to the pair to play their music (unless it's one speaker at a time). Not a big deal if it's mainly for entertainment, but I do wish I would have known. In addition to that, one of my primary frustrations was purchasing the Fire TV Cube so we could easily stream 4k media without longer buffering or drop outs. Well, the way you do that is by connecting your Cube to your ethernet. Unfortunately, the stereo pair has to be connected to the Fire TV over Wifi, so that means the Cube has to be connected to wifi as well. They will NOT  work for your cube/firestick if you're connected over ethernet. This was a bit frustrating and caused some minor hiccups in my setting up... so instead of 10 minutes it took me about 30 to delete and reinstall the pairs. So this leads me to my one BUYER BE WARE: if you are trying to stream 4k, make sure you have a good internet speed and if not you better have your modem nearby or you'll want to buy a wifi router to plug in to increase the signal near your TV, firestick or cube.  In the end, I had a router next to where my TV was to extend our wifi throughout the house, but there's NO WAY everyone has this set up and I would have been really upset if I had major issues watching 4k. Luckily, I have not and I don't have super fast internet (about 55mbps) so I'm hoping most buyers are not put in that position. With that said, I do believe some of this could be fixed with a firmware or software update, so I'm hopeful. If they do, I'd change my review to 5 stars. Overall navigating and using Alexa is what it is and there's plenty of reviews about that elsewhere. One thing to note: if you have the cube and 2 speakers, they do not overlap well when listening for voices. I highly recommend you mute 2 of them (I muted one speaker and the cube with the microphone mute button on top of the unit) so we're only giving voice commands to one speaker. In summary, if you're looking to add theatre like quality sound and punch to your living room, you cannot go wrong with these guys. Make sure you have descent internet for streaming 4k (55mbps or higher) and don't be afraid to play around in the Alexa app to tweak your set up to your liking. Even as someone who lives and breathes audio, I was impressed. Not because they are the best sounding speakers but for what they deliver, how easy they do it and for what price they are doing it at.
title: Honest Review from a Sound Designer, Musician and Video Streaming Nut!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: James M. Rowan
content: easiest to set up Echo, best sounding echo..wish we had ordered 2 to start..Amazing sound from the Echo Studio.. the vocals are amazing... at an amazing price for great sound and a hub to boot...now waiting for the second to arrive in December...Now have 2 WOW.
title: Terrific sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: O. Zachary
content: Pro: The sound quality of these speakers are really exceptional i love them. I bought two of them along with two speaker stands and they look great in our living room.  The speakers are well made and have a very sleek design. Cons: Voice recognition is not as good as the Echos or Echo dots.  I dont know if it's because Amazon focused more on sound quality when designing these but my experience has been that these speakers do not hear as well as their cheaper counterparts in the Amazon smart speaker line up.
title: Great Studio Sounds

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: lapercussion
content: The speaker is great but the EQ settings do not hold on unless the app that was used to set them is left on. This sucks because we have it in a slightly enclosed space and we found it sounded better with the bass turned down a bit but we lower it with the app and then when the app is shut off the setting goes back to normal. The setting to turn off the dreaded 3-D setting is remembered thank god... We contacted Amazon via email they blamed it on a glitchy app installation which is nonsense we tried it on an android phone and two iphones each time the EQ settings reverted to flat.
title: it's great but....

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: RC
content: I combined a pair of these with my FireTV in Home Theatre mode. After a week or two the grouping would fall apart and I would have to re-create the grouping in the Alexa app.  I blamed my home network/wifi and upgraded it to a Ubiquity Unify mesh system (which rocks). Alas, to no avail, the home theatre grouping eventually failed. This time after 2+ weeks but it continued to fail until my wife asked that I get rid of them and put the old stereo speaker pair back.  During this time I upgraded the devices in the hope that it was a firmware/OS issue but it didnt help.
title: Wanted this to work but they are lemons when combined in Home Theatre mode with FireTV decvices

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: noah ziegler
content: Voice recognition and sound quality is great.  It was so great I decided to buy a second Amazon Echo Studio.  My delivery showed up and I raced downstairs like a kid at Christmas. I Opened the box and took the speaker out of it’s nice presentation bag.  Plugged it in and created a home living room group.  Threw on some dirty bird house music which has very good low end and through Spotify they were bumping!  It wasn’t until later that I open up one of my DJ apps on my iPad Pro and try to connect them both through YouTube that I realized I made a mistake.  There’s no way to pair or daisychain these off of Bluetooth they will only play out of the Alexa app or through a fire stick.  I think I'm going to do is buy a dongle with a HDMI out and use a fire stick.  Currently that HDMI out is going to a big screen for visuals but we'll figure it out at work around.
title: Great speakers but limited through Alexa

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: TLucida
content: This was received as an upgrade to the original Echo that we've had for several years.  The sound quality with the subwoofer is pretty amazing -- we do often use it to play music and it's a noticeable upgrade.  Also the response rate with the old model had gotten somewhat laggy lately and this responds right away.  The only minor improvement would be to keep the light up circle around the edge or elevate it slightly in the middle so that it is easier to tell when the device is actively listening/responding.
title: Much better sound than the original Echo

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Remo Felix
content: I can only speak my truth on this one. I wasn't sure what to expect. All I know is that the echo plus that we purchased for our son sounded great on its own. However for someone that likes sound right in their face with definition. The echo plus wasn't enough. When I came across the echo studio I definitely had to see what it was about. Like all excitement I couldn't wait. Once delivered and after powering and connecting to our network. All I can say it was More than worth the wait. I've watched and read quite a few reviews on this particular device. Long story short none serve this product justice. With that being said nor will mine. This is going to be something that you'll definitely have to judge for yourself. Although let me say this in regards to price point sound quality and capability hands down beat some of the high-priced dollar setups that are out and available. Put it like this if you were to put one in each room along with two plus a sub in your living room there's no reason why you should miss a beat while moving throughout your home and in some cases even in your front or back yard just saying.
title: Dramatic sound with a non dramatic price

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tedjen
content: Great speaker, but I'm having problems connecting my TV to this studio echo throght Bluetooth, I had a echo plus and others and works perfect with this android tv, but the studio has issues with Bluetooth connection maybe will be fix with a firmware update. Also the led ring on top of the alexa studio in a zone of this ring has a problem with the leds, the blue color its fade, i got this alexa on a quick promotion moment, for a good price, i thought was a new product, but seems like was a refurbished or something.
title: Nice speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jones
content: This unit has excellent sound as a loudspeaker and it will fill open areas with nice music. Our home has much Alexa enablement with firetv sticks, 8 Alexa echos and lighting.  I mention this as this unit in two different rooms experienced confusion with an echo show picking up directions.  We adjusted the configuration to make this work but i mention this as this seems to be an Amazon opportunity for teams to do better testing on products. Primarily, i purchased this one over Bose for the intent of sound quality and Alexa integration.  My only caution is on two small points.  First, the unit lacks the low volume quality sound that my Bose units have.  I am picky but this is comparable pricing to Bose and I can redirect my audio to my Bose at low volume and have a much more relaxing experience.  Second, the unit lacks universal micro volume control.  The volume jumps from too much to too little for some scenarios.  Other than these two details, the unit will rock at mid to high volume with the best speakers.
title: Nice Loudspeaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Gary W. Yates
content: I purchased this when it went on sale for the first time since bowing in. Upon setting it up with my subwoofer(which was an easy setup). I just didn't feel it was impressive enough. I had been playing two Echos that were paired with sub. After comparing the two setups I concluded that for my use. The Echos beat it hands down. Had I purchased two Studios and paired with the Echo Sub it may have been a different story, but the size of the Studio did not lend itself well in my opinion to purchasing two. Not a bad product, just not what I had hoped for.
title: Not enough to really top two echos.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Amazonian
content: After watching countless YouTube reviews about this speaker, I took the plunge and bought it. At first the sound was good but not great (It maybe because I have the speaker in an open room) but my biggest issue is syncing this speaker. It's always out of sync, I even purchased AmazonBasics Optical Toslink to Mini Toslink Jack Digital Audio Cable for a direct connection "STILL out of SYNC".
title: Somewhat disappointing

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tod R.
content: I bought this to use in my office since I’m now working from home. I wanted better sound and the Echo Studio does not disappoint. The sound is clear and it’s range is far better than any other home assistant that I’ve heard yet. It does have occasional  issues with voice recognition, but that’s in the Alexa software, not the device. I’m sure Amazon will continue to improve in that. Frankly, though, it may be overkill for my office and I may swap it with the first generation that I have in the family room.
title: Great little speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Iris
content: We wanted to like this BUT we had so much difficulty connecting especially when you have multiple devices. We also got the Echo Sub which only worked when my husbands phone was connected to it but for the life of me I could not get the sub to work when connected to my phone.  This device only seemed to work well with Amazon Music services. I could not get this to work with Apple Music at all or any other services.  It got so frustrating we decided to return it. We are pretty technically savy and this was the most annoying products to use compared to other wireless Bluetooth players. Lots of work still needs to be done to improve the technology.
title: So Frustrating!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Alistair Crowley
content: When you first get it, the sound is flat like a big wet fart.  SOLUTION:  Just tell Alexa raise treble (3 times) and raise mid range (2 times) and raise bass (1 time).  I wondered how good Alexa would be on being my research analyst assistant . . . . well, there's a long way to go.  Very light subject topics she seems to handle well.  Anything esoteric like stock market factoids seems to leave her stumped.  I have yet to research government economic analysis . . . starts tomorrow.  I think things will improve enormously, a simple reflection of "Moore's Law."
title: Don't Despair . . . . . .

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: charles
content: Stereo with 2 studios only works with streaming not Bluetooth ( plenty of headphones play stereo with Bluetooth with 2 separate speakers). Also like others, when streaming it either stops and says it has a hard time or doesn’t stream at all after confirming the command.  My iPhone on the same WiFi works just fine streaming. Maybe a first gen chip problem.  Streaming will work when initiated thru the alexa app. Not ready yet
title: Music playback is disappointing so far

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Brian Moore
content: We were very thrilled to try the new studio, so when the Studio announced that you could hear the great quality by asking Alexa to play the 3d music playlist, with my son in the room with me, imagine my shock when the very first thing I hear is Cardi B and her WAP or Wet A** P****Y song lyrics start echoing through the room! So many obscene words and I was so shocked that this is the first thing that Amazon wanted new owners to hear that I couldn't speak for a minute and had to pull the plug to make it stop. I am all for freedom of speech for artists and people to listen to what they want, but was not at all prepared for this to be the first song that Amazon plays from a playlist to highlight a new product. As a parent I was not at all ready. Please correct this!
title: DO NOT try the 3d music playlist it suggests out of the box! Shameful!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Snow Loon
content: We have four echo devices in our home.  The echo studio is the latest.  It does have solid sound.  My main issue with it is the number of volume settings.  I haven't counted, but it may be nine or ten levels.  The A/C comes on and we need to increase the volume.  It goes off and we need to drop it.  A half setting (3.5) would likely reduce that problem.  When you can't find the right volume level to begin with it just requires constant fiddling.  It is much larger than our echo and the black color is not pleasing.  The tiny volume buttons are black on black, so I never use them because they're impossible to see.
title: The echo studio has limited volume settings.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: AQE
content: Very disappointing and frustrating. Communication not enabled yet it constantly shows green light for incoming messages. Voice commands work on Roku TV, but sound still only comes through TV speakers because, apparently, that function will only work with Fire TV. App is flaky and often unresponsive. Volume fluctuates with no adjustment, as do equalizer settings. I set them how I want and 30 seconds later the bass and volume jump up or down.. Tech help was no help. I'm considering returning it, as my primary interest was listening to HD music and improving TV sound. Speaker quality doesn't live up to what's advertised. Trying to think of a reason to keep it, but don't see the point. Consider what you plan to use it for before purchasing - doesn't really live up to sound quality claims.
title: Pffffft whatta dud

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: David Mike
content: Honestly, for the size and price, this little speaker is AMAZING. I bought one to connect with my fire tv cube for home theater use and to play HD and 3D music off of my Amazon Music HD subscription. It worked so well and sounded so great that I ordered a second one a day later. Now I have two and can use for proper home theater effect (including Dolby Atmos -- which is very, very cool, btw!).....and with two I can enjoy stereo when streaming music. The low end that even ONE of these echo studios delivers is pretty awesome. With the three midrange drivers facing L, R and one toward the ceiling it really does make these units sound larger than they are by bouncing mid-frequency sounds off of walls and ceiling, very spacious and full sound. Highly recommend. Five stars!
title: Experience to believe, WOWW.....

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: R. Cooling
content: This has great sound and I am glad I purchased it. However like most wireless speakers today it doesn't seem to go as loud as I would like it to truly fill the large room I have it in. Also it is quite heavy so it isn't something you are going to want to move around from room to room. Also, I can't figure out why Amazon doesn't create these Echo's with a rechargeable battery? I purchased a battery base for my previous Echo but there isn't one designed for this version of the Echo.
title: Great sound. Wish it was louder.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Harald Wilke
content: This speaker has some BASS response. It's pretty amazing how much you miss with speakers that don't have any real kind of woofer. I have this paired with a Fire TV Stick 4K to turn my TV into an Entertainment Center. I just ask ikt to play something from Amazon or Apple Music, and t does. The TV lights up yo show me what's playing, and when listening to Amazon Music, the lyrics appear so you can sing along! It's the best Echo ever for music! I like this so much that I plan on ordering a second.
title: I love this thing!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Peewee
content: I have a pair of old sonos 5. I'm very disappointed  with sonos  for not supporting  the old sonos five,  so I decided to buy the echo studio.  Man I'm so glad I bought  it. Aside from looking very slick and nice, the sound is quite amazing.  Better than sonos. I'm waiting for the echo studio to go on sale again so I can purchase another one and connect them directly  to my fire stick . The sound is very loud and crisp, u have to listen to believe it. I just hope amazon does not become  like sonos...
title: very impressive  sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Sushi Fan 99
content: The studio is a very nice audio upgrade for the Alexa ecosystem. It integrates with other Alex equipment smoothly and easily. The sound quality really is a big improvement over other Alexa equipment. However, for the price, I would like to see a bit better sound. Moreover, when it comes to price, you really are going to get the best out of the Studio if you set it up in a pair. Of course, that puts you into a different price category. Still, I'm pleased with my purchase. My ears are pleased with my purchase.
title: Great Addition to Echo

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Bill
content: First, understand that I am old school ... vinyl off a single action fully manual turntable through a Class A amp and above average speakers for serious listing.  I bought the Echo Studio, actually 2 of them, for casual listening ... background/dinner music if you will in a multi room installation ... I will be getting a third so the main floor of our house is completely covered because I am pleased with what they are for what they cost ... with the additional benefit of Alexa.
title: real good, not great but really very good

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: TeeJay
content: I was and am severely disappointed in the sound quality. I thought this was supposed to be a decent sounding speaker but it is not much better than a transistor radio from the 70s. I need to use my smartphone hotspot as a source of Internet and have done this successfully with a couple echo dots in the past. This was an absolute nightmare to set up in such a manner but I was finally able to accomplish it. Overall it has been an unpleasant experience to get it up and running and the resulting sound as I mentioned is terribly disappointing. Everybody's idea of good sound is different and you may not be as demanding as I am so others may be quite pleased with this awful sounding trash can.
title: Very disappointing sound quality

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Gerald Heston
content: I hoped to use this as a computer speaker. I like to listen to music in my home office and I wanted good sound. However, there's no input for a standard 3.5 mm speaker plug, so the only way to connect to a PC is with Bluetooth. But the lag is about 1/2 second, so when I watched a video with people speaking, the delay was really obvious and distracting. This probably wouldn't be an issue if I just wanted to stream music. Also, every time I woke the laptop up, the Echo shouted "Now connected to ___ computer" at full volume - super annoying. According to the support forums, this can't be turned off. I'm returning the Echo Studio - I guess it's just not designed to be a computer speaker.
title: Not a good computer speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: JMW59
content: I bought 2 of these in February 2020, they were easy to set up and I thought the sound was pretty decent. But over the months I’ve owned them I’m becoming more and more frustrated with them, voice recognition is terrible, I have to stand next to them and yell. They are constantly out of sync, I am constantly unplugging them. I’m beginning to regret my purchase. My older Amazon Echo devices may not gave the sound quality of the studios but the voice recognition is much better.
title: Disappointed

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Dx P
content: Had to be defective. Only tweeter worked. Took 5 shots to get it paired to my WiFi as it was sitting right next to working Firestick 4K. Noticed tiny sound. Called tech support and they had me update software, reset, etc. Nothing worked. Sent back for full refund. My original order 2 weeks ago stated I would not receive the unil Jan 11th. Got it on Dec 24. I assume it was a defective unit or damaged in transit. The shipping box had no air cushions or anything and the echo studio inner box has no foam or anything.
title: Echo Studio Received Defective Unit- Sounded like a clock radio

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ruth A Weatherford
content: The only issue I have run into is when you have the Studio set up as a home theater, you cannot play music.  I read this in other reviews, but not until after I purchased.  I have not found an answer anywhere on how to correct this, so I just use it for music but would love input how to use as a home theater and also ask Alexa to play music. A review I read, the reviewer called Amazon for support and they were not able to address the issue.  I will update my review if I ever call Amazon support and the issue can be corrected.
title: Cannot ask Alexa to play music and use as a Home Theater Group

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: David Hansen
content: Holy smokes this sounds awesome for how puny it is.  I have huge klipsch atmos set up with my home theater already, this was purchased for another room. When you first get it, it tunes/optimizes the echo based on your surroundings. Then you can sample some 3D music.  It sounds terrific, bright and clear with solid bass but not overwhelming.  It also can be paired with another echo studio speaker and used with the fire TV for theater sound. My daughter instantly wanted one after hearing the music. It really fills a room.
title: This sounds terrific!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Cherie Y. Small
content: I owned an original echo and decided to take advantage of a trade in program Amazon ran earlier in the year and purchased a new Echo  Studio.  Am I ever glad I did!  The sound quality is a huge improvement over my Echo and we really enjoy listening to music on it. In our backyard we have a large covered patio so that’s where we placed it and it allowed us to stream music and listen to Yankee’s games outside all summer long. It is now Fall and our nights have gotten significantly cooler so I’ve brought it inside. I think  I will hook it up to our tv in the Family room for the winter. Setting it up was as easy as it has been for all other Alexa products (4), it took less than 5 minutes for the setup process.
title: Great sound, easy setup and portability at a good price point.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Federico Grijalba
content: I've owned several speakers in my life, but this is the first smart speaker I buy. Here are the things I liked and disliked about this Echo Studio. Things I like: - The sound is excellent. Is not perfect and is not the best sound I heard in a speaker. Given the 199$ (or 169$ if on sale), this is great value for money. The bass is punchy but not extremely powerful, and the mids and treble are somewhat muffled and covered by the low frequencies. An adjustment with the Alexa app makes a big improvement. - The "Stereo Spatial Enhancement" really gives the sound a nice touch. I can feel the speaker fill the room. - Alexa's voice recognition is almost perfect. It always heard me, even several ft away. The problem was when whispering. 30% of the time Alexa just wounldn't recognize me. - The ability to connect via Bluetooth to a phone or computer is simply a must. The Homepod does not have this capability, but Echo does. Things I don't like: - The sound is loud, but not as loud as one expects given the size and weight of the speaker. Other speakers are way smaller and give the same or more volume. - Alexa's skills may not work on all devices and/or regions. As an example: I have two smart switches from Xiaomi and I couldn't make them work with Alexa (I could with Google Assistant). Also, Spotify (and maybe even other platforms) is not functional in regions outside US or Europe. I live in Argentina and had to change my location before connecting Spotify with Alexa. Overall, given the price I'm absolutely pleased with the speaker. Having read other reviews, I'm convinced that pairing two studios with an Echo Sub makes a powerful and great sounding combo, for not that much money.
title: Excellent sound for a modest price!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Clarkyule
content: I did a lot of research on the Studio and various soundbars in this price range before settling on this and the Vizio sb3621. (I got the studio when it went on sale for $169). I hooked up an echo dot to the sound bar so they would have equal amazon integration. They are both excellent values but the Studio sounded better for music. The sound was more balanced and was certainly better at lower volumes. The soundbar w/sub was great if played loudly but this was probably due to the impressive bass and when played at low/mid volumes the bass either dominated or just didn't fit with what the bar was putting out. The studio's bass was sufficient for me but I could always add the sub down the road. We ended up hooking it up through a firestick and now our TV plays through it as well. It's not the same as our home theater set up in the basement but it's great for what we watch most of the time. I"m not sure about the 3D music effect but think if I ever paired it to another one that it would be an amazing set up.
title: Excellent sound quality and easy to use

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Brent Jackson
content: I'm a sound guru, and I was hoping this speaker (2 of them) would sound good enough to use as left and right hooked up to my TV setup for movies/theater in living room. My first disappointment was the sound quality. Just not a good mix of lows and highs, sounds imbalanced. Then, the base just wasn't enough for me even at full in EQ. Thrid, and most importantly, there's just not enough volume coming out. Full blast is what I would expect for medium volume. Granted it would be a little better with 2 of them, but I'm just too disappointed to keep it. Sending back.
title: Not Enough Sound Volume OR Quality

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Abelardo Cabrera jr
content: After having a set it up myself without any help from your service department it works very well I would like to see that your service people do not know what they're talking about and it's hard to understand many of them with their accents. The girl kept trying to send me a new one but there was nothing wrong with the one I had the system takes a while to upload everything into it and make everything function properly the only other thing is that it's very weak when it comes to connecting it to outside source through the plugin the audio is not as loud as it should be I believe that is one thing they should work on, but overall the product is good it works fine with Amazon music but can use it as a second source from something that you want to plug into it desires much to the listening pleasure.
title: Works but needs improvement!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Bosleydawg
content: First off, I have owned virtually every echo device since inception.  I will make this a short and sweet review for you.  I can appreciate and do like my echo 3rd generation but if I had to do it all over again, I would pass on it and go straight to the Echo studio.  I know, I know.... the price.  Well, simply put... bigger, better, louder and the foot print of the device is good.  Its not too big and its not too small.  It also has a built in hub and I believe it has the appropriate value proposition for what you get. Read the reviews, Take a deep breath of air, relax and have realistic expectations, and you won't be disappointed.  If you love Amazon and like their products, then you will love this one.  This is what I do with everything  I purchase and I am rarely dissatisfied as everything has pros and cons.
title: Skip the 3rd gen Echo and get this!!!!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Joel Jenkins
content: A great sounding speaker and I can stream music from my Plex program on my computer, which makes my selection much more tailored to my tastes than the Amazon channels. Early in the morning, it's a little hard of hearing and I have to repeat my request twice. It's a lot like asking your children to do something.
title: Great Sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tim C. Edgerly
content: I bought a pair of these for two reasons. First, to use with Amazon Music HD for which they are excellent, but secondly as an experiment which was successful. In my eighth decade I began to recognize hearing difficulties with the dialects in BritBox and AcornTV. Realizing that hearing aids would be a good idea, I purchased some last summer which helped some. This year I wondered if it also might be my 50 year old six foot high speaker arrays. These speakers work well for music, but, due to aging components, don't clarify dialogue. The Echo Studios restore the crisp dialogue that I want.  Now, depending on the program material, I can choose to use either system, but I certainly could get by with the Echo Studios alone.
title: The experiment is successful!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: chris moreno
content: I wanted to get a sound bar for our bedroom.  Something with decent sound, however, I didn't want to get a sound bar with a separate subwoofer.  I read about this new speaker and I thought it would be the perfect solution, not quite.  You are able to connect this to your Cube of Amazon 4k fire steak and connect wirelessly and the sound is good, however, your are only able to access the full sound potential through the input for you Amazon Fire device.  So  if you have not cut the cord and are still using cable you are not able to access the full sound potential on that input.  I did order the 3.5 optical cable and plug that in but the sound was not good.  I heard no difference in the volume set at 5 or 10.  The sound is definitely better through the Amazon device. I called tech support and they were not much help.  The answered I received was, I don't know if that would work some people say it does and good for them.  I realize this is a new product but it seems the tech group with have a basic working knowledge of their product. As a stand alone speaker this sounds good, but not as good as the Sonos one.
title: Not a soundbar replacement

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Walter Gandra
content: So far I enjoy them, with the exception of some things... I use them paired with a fire tv and not having the cables around is awesome! The issues I have are: - I have 2 in my family room and an echo show in my kitchen... sometimes I want to play music in my family room and the one who picks up the commands is thr one at the kitchen - The audio stops playing sometimes, so I need to reset the fire tv device - The sound quality is lower when compared with Sonos, Google version of their sound bars
title: I enjoy these, but they have some flaws and the quality is not premium

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Eric
content: The Echo Studio is head and shoulders above any of other Alexa devices in my home.  I am running two of Echo Studios (Left & Right) along with an Echo Sub.  I'm extremely happy with the rich, full, clear sound quality.  The speaker optimizes itself for the room acoustics as part of setup. At $199 it represents a very good value.  The sound quality is on par with other much more expensive wifi smart speaker systems that I also own (not sure if I'm allowed to name the brand).  Both sound great but the Echo Show costs less than half as much!
title: Alexa now has GREAT SOUND!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ed OB
content: I bought this primarily as a wireless BT speaker for my MS Surface laptop. It was to replace an existing BT speaker. The sound was very good, but the lag was enough to make it unusable to use for video meetings and you tube. It also had an annoying "feature". When I muted my laptop, the Echo Studio would start streaming amazon music. So if you want the best sounding and listening Alexa device, the Studio is awesome.  The BT is excellent for music, but not very good for video meetings.
title: Great for Music, Fair for Video Meetings

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Brendan O'Leary
content: Do yourself a favor and google Spotify playback issues with Alexa before purchasing. The sound quality is middle of the pack, not bad but honestly very little noticeable difference between this and my much smaller and older Alexa device. My biggest issue is that the device won’t play Spotify after 3 songs. It just stops. I can reopen Spotify and resume playing where the device stopped, but that kind of defeats the purpose of a hands free device. To be clear, I also have a google nest and it works perfectly with Spotify.  After contacting amazon Customer service and getting the run around, I’ve learned that “they’re aware of this issue and working very hard to fix it”. A quick google search indicates that this has been an issue since 2018, so their crack squad of IT folks are perhaps on a 2 year vacation. Seems like they’re trying to promote revenue and usage of amazon music by nerfing competitor interface. Before you buy, do some research.
title: Stops playing Spotify after 3 songs

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jeff
content: Well made, easy to set up for basic use, exceptional sound quality given the price and size.  However, if basic setup leaves you with any questions, it is hard to get answers.  There appears to be no separate support as you have to go through Amazon Device pages to find FAQs and there is no link to chat, phone, or email support.  You can post questions to forums and get a response is a day or two, but that seems a little weak given that this is an Amazon core branded product.
title: Great Sound Quality - Support is Weak

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Alan Hoffman
content: I bought one echo studio a couple of months ago.  It sounded pretty good so decided to buy another to pair for, what I thought would be, great stereo sound.  Unfortunately, there is a software glitch that Amazon needs to FIX.  When paired, the studios will work nicely for just a few days.  Then they will drop audio consistently.  It is so annoying I stop using them as speakers.  The problem cannot be fixed because it is a software problem.  AMAZON! PLEASE FIX!!
title: Needs improvements

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Steve H. in Austin
content: This is an excellent speaker for the price. The sound quality is immediately noticable compared to any other echo; excellent bass and aural separation.  I am very happy with the purchase and would highly recommend it. A friend has a Sonos setup, and I think the Studio is fully comparable.
title: This is a great speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Grady
content: I bought the original Echo and have enjoyed it. I purchased this one as an upgrade primarily for the sound quality and secondly for the built-in Zigbee hub. Pros; Sounds great Cons; It has trouble hearing me in a quiet room. A friend has one and it has no troubles - may just be mine. Zigbee hub has limited range. Suggestions; Include a wired network option for future models. Make Alexa smarter. Not as bad as Siri but not by much.
title: Upgrade, sort-of

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Mario Chiaramonte
content: The sound is great.  Does everything our first Gen Echo did, except for one thing, and that’s proving 360 degree sound.  We keep this on the bar separating our kitchen from the living room, so have to rotate it towards the kitchen or living room to get the clearest sound.  I really want good sound in both at the same time.  My intention was to get two of these, but I am not thinking I may be happier to return this and just get too Gen 3 Echos and add the Echo Sub, so I can have clear, stereophonic sound in the kitchen and the living room at the same time.
title: No 360 degree sound😫

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ryan
content: Absolutely sounding amazing wish it was more affordable for more people pretty big price tag I wish it was affordable so I can get too of them so I can make surroundsound worth the money if you love Alexa sounds good 👌🏼 I recommend if you do not own Alexa and you are into music worth it
title: Are you into music?

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: David Doyle
content: I was quite impressed by the sound quality.  Fills my room.  I have a small living room but it’s filled by this speaker.  It’s neat to see the sub moving in the gap. I was amazed how easy the setup was.  Plug and play. I have a very old Bose system with 5 speakers and a sub.  I’m planning to replace the entire system with just this Echo Studio.  It does the job perfectly for my needs.  It plays my music, it’s good sound quality, and it’s compact size.  And has Alexa, which is great feature.  What’s not to love about this speaker system?!
title: Highly recommended.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: TB
content: Amazon, get with it. You practically own the planet. Your Alexa app is trash. Are you purposely trying to raise your customers blood pressure?! I have a Studio. I love the sound. I HATE the fact that 50% of the time it won’t do what I ask it to. Alexa, lower volume. NOPE! DENIED! And the ABSOLUTE TOP OF THE HEAP....NUMERO UNO REQUEST!!! SEPARATE CONTROL FOR ALEXAS VOICE!!!! I set my living room volume at about 3 for music. I then want to check a notification so I ask. I can’t hear her! It’s too low! Any chance you can implement that update?
title: READ BEFORE BUYING! AVOID MEGA FRUSTRATION!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Mr. Chuck
content: I had to have this so I can listen to Amazon Unlimited HD and Ultra HD. Believe the Hype! terrific 3D sound! Plus the Echo Studio has a jack so you can plug anything with a standard plug! I ran a wire from my computer thru a DAC and plugged in!! Great result! No brainer, just get one!
title: The Future is here!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jay F. Grissom
content: Better than I expected. I’ve replaced a Bose airplay speaker with this device. The setup was seamless. I just plugged it in and opened the Alexa app on my iPad and everything was setup for me automatically. Wonderful! The sound is fantastic. Rich base with really clear mids and highs. I’ve only had it for about an hour now but I am thinking this was absolutely worth the price. The only con I can find is that the cord is about 6 inches shorter than I needed it to be (trivial).
title: The entire experience is much better than I expected.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Jeff lane
content: The sound is FLAT.... With the equalizer adjusted all the way(which is a joke because there’s only three settings bass, mid range and treble) the sound is like a $25 blue tooth speaker you buy at Walmart. I purchased 2 of these and now they are basically echo device. If you’re seriously considering getting this because you think it will be a 360 surroundsound experience or something of that nature you will be heavily disappointed. My problem is I bought these didn’t use them right away and once I started I only had a week to play with them. And now it’s too late to return them. I would rate the current value of each one of these devices at no more than $50 and the price is only that high because you can use them as a hub. Huge disappointment again. This was their second attempt at some cool surround sound with a Alexa hub I don’t know if anybody remembers the echo bass speaker, but that actually sounds better. Amazon makes a lot of good products,  This one though they got completely wrong again. Please Amazon if you decide to make another version of this have some of your quality control guys listen to the device before they sell it on the market. And if those guys don’t come out of that room after listening to the music with a smile on their face then you know you did not get the speaker right again. You’re supposed to hear music you’re supposed to feel music you’re supposed to feel the punch it’s supposed to excite you or calm you down not disappoint you. Just my opinion from some random guy decided to make a purchase
title: Worst sound in the industry, Bluetooth speaker quality at best

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Thomas N.
content: Overall, very pleased with Echo Studio.  Incredible sound quality for such a small package.  I'm not an audiophile,  but I can remember a time when it took a rack of equipment and pricey floor speakers to get sound like this. Voice recognition is a bit sketchy, particularly if you're some distance away, but overall pretty good. Alexa integration is very good. I have 2 Phillips Hue bulbs, Fire TV stick and two additional echo devices  integrated  for audio and the 'drop in skill. Pretty cool gadget!
title: Viva Echo & Alexa!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Matthew Pennington
content: Really have enjoyed this new speaker. It's got great sound, nice solid bass, great volume and Alexa built-in make it really a nice addition to my kitchen. It's nice to be able to just say "hey alexa play some jazz" while you're doing the dishes and have it sound great, or even with guests as you're all gathered round the kitchen area like so many parties are. Anyway, we love it, highly recommended, does everything it says it does, and sounds really great. I'll probably get a second one.
title: Awesome speaker

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Ralph J. Shenyo
content: Great value for the money! I use the in pairs. I have 4 of them so far! I subscribe to Amazon Music as well as Pandora and the interface with both is flawless. I have music playing throughout my home on a Everywhere Group and I am really impressed with the amount of control and flexibility I have in controlling the music content and environment! My music is also linked to a Echo Show 8 and a Echo Show 2nd Generation and they also contribute to enhancing the whole house sound field. Amazon has hit a home run with Echo and Alexa!
title: Awesome......

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: steve dowell
content: Great sound, nearly rivals my home stereo.  Controls lets you adjust bass and treble to your liking.  Music is clear and crisp.  I play a lot of music, both from streaming companies like Siris XM and I play a lot of individual picks of my own.  When telling Alexa to play a song, the title must be exact as it is on the album.  Contacted Amazon support and they have been very helpful in assisting me to understand how to voice my commands for certain songs.  One note, Alexa only supports 2.4gh so ensure your connect to that channel.  Overall for the price, the performance could not be better in my opinion.  Can't wait to try it with 3D music as it becomes available without having to pay extra for it.
title: Quality Sound at good price

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Garrett Lee
content: I really liked this speaker when I received it last month. I didn’t like the default “stereo spacial enhancement” setting. I thought it just muddied the waters. However, with the past number of firmware updates, I feel that this feature has been greatly improved. I’ve switched “stereo spacial enhancement” on again. This speaker just keeps getting better and better. There’s one thing I really hope Amazon considers with the next Echo Studio: Place individual tweeters above the midrange drivers on the left and right hand sides of the unit. Remove the center forward firing tweeter. I believe these changes will give the Echo Studio a better, more realistic stereo soundstage.
title: It’s getting better!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: TechWarrior
content: I love the volume level and sound on this unit it rivals my Harmon kardon speakers. Also the voice recognition is better than my echo dot or regular echo. The only thing that was disappointing was when I went to demo it to my family Alexa asked me if I wanted to hear the best of 3D audio playlist..... of course I said yes... in a very poor corporate decision it blurted out the first song “Wet Ass Pussy” by Cartie B an absolutely terrible pick with the vulgarity in the lyrics. I emailed corporate directly they responded then nothing afterwards.  Poor choice of “Songs?” to feature..... None the less the Echo Studio is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
title: Absolutely Great

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Gio
content: I asked for the Studio for Christmas, because I wanted to seriously upgrade the sound of my original Echo. While the studio sounds pretty good, it was definitely not a major upgrade. The other problem I have is that the volume is not that loud on this speaker. The Klipsh sound bar for my tv sounds way better and has good volume. I will use it for a while and then maybe try a different brand speaker in order to get better sound. Over all, I do not think this speaker is a good value.
title: I Expected More

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Catlizg
content: Deciding it was time to upgrade from our Echo Dot, and having added locks, thermostat and Hue bulbs, we decided to bite the bullet and order the Studio, both for its sound and for its integrated hub.  Yes, it took a bit to get all the devices hooked up - not a fault of the Echo, but making sure the programs were integrated properly.  Got everything working within an hour while I enjoyed the sound quality.  We are quite pleased with the purchase
title: Big Sound in A Little Package

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Boda
content: Received this today.  Set up was a breeze.  Ran a bunch of songs off my playlist on it to see how it sounded.  Bass is full and big, and the vocals are tight and crisp.  This is a very nice upgrade to the Alexa speaker line.  I highly recommend this speaker.  My only complaint is that I wish it got a bit louder.  It's great for filling a room with great sound, but it's just a pinch short to use for a house party.  Overall very satisfied....!
title: Very nice addition to the Alexa line up.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: MdBandit 03
content: it sounds good but the bad part is u gotta buy 2 of them for it to sound like a 2.1 because u can listen to the studio in hd or ultra and if u dont have the sub then it sounds like some of the voice is lower than the band...and they say the more u buy (and u can connect 100's of units and subs and the sound will then feel like a big theatre) it sits well on my dresser and beside it is a show 10 but my review is 2 thumbs up for the echo! 😎
title: Echo Studio

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Techmeister
content: If you are looking for the best sound, including best bass, built in to an echo the studio is the one to get.  While it is an impressive step up with wide ranging sound it still doesn't compare to have a surround sound system.  If you want the best audio you need to connect your echho to a high quality surround sound system.  Still, this was sooo much better than previous versions I kept it and like it very much.
title: Best Echo Yet

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Eduardo
content: Huge headache. It’s disappointing because when it works it sounds great. Have it paired with my 4K fire stick for the home theater experience. The problem is it won’t connect for at least 5 to 10 minutes after turning on the tv. I have tried every option to try to get this issue resolved. I don’t have this issue when I go through a mini toslink but I have to unpair it from my fire stick for echo studio to do so. If paired it will only speak to the fire stick through WiFi regardless if you plug in an optical cable. But this defeats the whole purpose of my echo home theater dreams, might as well get a sound bar. I have reached out to customer support but as sweet as they were they really had no clue how to help me. I was on the phone with them for over an hour for them to only wish me luck and hope my issue is resolved. This is already the replacement for the first studio that I got which kept freezing and get stuck in a loop. I also bought it new but the replacement I got was clearly opened before. It was delivered in its own package, taped all over with the delivery address slapped on the side. It’s been a huge headache, which is a shame because when it works I love it.
title: Huge disappointment

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: mrleok
content: After my first purchase of the Echo Studio I wasn't sure it was worth the price but the more I listened to it the more I appreciated the sound quality. When Amazon ran the special on this speaker I purchased a 2nd one for the bedroom. $200 is a bit steep for the speaker but $150 made it more acceptable. Great sound with nice bass and you can use the equalizer on the app to customize your sound. I play them loud and they sound great!  Rock On Echo, Rock On
title: This makes Echo Studio #2 for me.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: TruthMaster
content: I really wanted to like this, but I'm sick and tired of repeating myself to Alexa. It's like the Studio needs to wake up or something before it can respond. In perfect silence, I'll be right next to it, and ask it something, and nothing happens. I ask again in the same tone of voice, and then it works. Makes no sense. Happens all the time. It sits on the same quiet shelf as my previous Echo devices, but it doesn't hear nearly as well. For this reason, I like my 2nd Gen Echo Plus much better.
title: Not a good microphone - makes me repeat myself

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Rae Sunshine
content: This is not ready for the limelight as a serious home entertainment center speaker, and it’s not for the sound. This thing will NOT stay paired to any fire device. There is a huge amount of lag, even while both devices are on a gigabit network, right next to each other and the router. The Alexa app will report completely different wifi networks than what the devices are actually connected to, which is the most ridiculous problem, and gets the most frustrating “Cannot connect, make sure the devices are on the same network” error message. YEAH, THEY ARE. It’s been a huge nightmare, and I’m considering completely trashing the home theater setup. The optical input apparently doesn’t work for certain devices as well, so this has become the most expensive dedicated PS4 soundbar. Huge disappointment. Sound quality is amazing tho! Feels like you’re in a movie theater, even just on its own.
title: Great on sound, trash on connectivity.

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: 17Soup76
content: This little speaker the size roughly of a large coffee can will fill a room with sound like a big stereo. It's actually amazing how well it works. Just one word of caution I had these issues with playback. Do not use the Tidal integration piece it doesn't work and you will get errors like I can't find your music. So stick to Amazon music or Blutooth and you will be ok.  I wish they would fix that but I can see why they wouldn't because it's the direct competitor to Amazon Music HD.
title: Fills a room with sound

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: herodotus
content: Awesome sound. As good or better than a apple pod. We have ours in the same room (den) as a show 10 and have the show 10 control it. Basically we setup a room “den” in alexas app and put both devices in it. Then set the speaker for The room “den” to be the studio. So when I tell alexa via show 10 to play music it sends it to the studio. Only issue is I would like to be able to turn off the mic disbabled red lights on the studio when it is just operating as a speaker.
title: Awesome but one minor issue

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Xpert Shopper
content: This is my 5th echo product and arguably the worst. Very disappointed in sound quality. For the money I was expecting much richer and deeper sound. To my ear it sounds much too tinny and “shallow”. Also when I tell it to play Michael Bublé it says playing MB on Spotify buts then does nothing.
title: Very disappointing!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Kaleb McWhorter
content: Great product! I pre-ordered and received day one. I have it set up in my living room and listen every day. Great sound quality, even at max volume. $200 is a little pricey but if you listen to a lot of music, especially in a home setting, I highly recommend.
title: Great Speaker, worth every penny

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Edwin Howard
content: I have been looking for a good Dolby Atmos theater sound system that was cheap for a long time. This speaker was my solution. I bought the Amazon fire TV stick 4k so I could have this speaker connect wirelessly. The sound is so good that I am going to buy another one soon so I can have full Dolby surround sound. Don't hesitate to by this!
title: Best Home theater speaker!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: GWS
content: I have two echo studios connected to a fire TV cube as a home theqter pairing. I like these when they are working, but I have been incredibly frustrated by bugs. I occat want to use Bluetooth headphones, but this inevitably breaks the home theater pairing. I have had major issues getting it to work again. I suspect the home theater pairing is not built to work with self organizing home networks (one SSID for both 2.4 and 5 radios). This needs to be fixed or there will be more and more customers with issues as this is pretter standard on new routers.
title: Software fixes needed

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Tom S
content: Sound was very clear and highs awesome.  The bass was something to be desired.  I had the bass up to Max and with pairing these with a second echo studio and echo sub I was not impressed. I called tech support and they said it’s a common problem and they are hoping to have a over the air update to fix this.  I returned mine and will wait until it’s right.  For the money they should be much better.  If they cost half the price I wouldn’t complain.
title: Good but not good enough for the $

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: tek-nique
content: Really great sound quality, Alexa functionality.  I couldn't configure remote from Samsung Smart TV, Amazon Fire Cube and Echo Studio to work together.  Remote works fine with TV, Cube and current sound bar but replace soundbar with Studio, remote no longer works for Cube or sound. However basic setup eg linking Studio to Echo is easy, can control both cube and studio via voice commands but shouting commands while watching movies isnt for everyone.
title: Great Sound,  Alexa, basic setup easy but home theater can be tricky

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: L. Lyon
content: The audio cuts out when using it as a home theater speaker with a Fire TV.  It was going to be a great solution to the audio for my projector with Fire Stick TV.  However, I keep getting enough random audio drops to make it annoying.  The new router is sitting in the same room as the Fire TV and the Studio.  I don't know how to give it a better network.  My mesh network doesn't have a lot of optimization features.  I really don't want to have to set up a separate network just to get audio, but that looks like the only solution.
title: I really want to like it, but the audio cuts out when used as a Fire TV home theater

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Greg Felty
content: Love the sound of the new echo Studio. It has superb sound quality. Pairs with my Fire TV. I was initially concerned with the volume output. I have since retracted that opinion. Once I paired it with my other Echo devices it filled our entire home with crystal clear music. Absolutely ingenious.
title: Love it! Get great, clear, quality music at an exceptional price!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Maurice
content: Best sounding Echo device! It has all the features that a standard Echo provides but now with bass!!! Also a nice feature is that you can Bluetooth stream from your phone or tablet or laptop. You can also sync it with your fire stick 4K and have audio play the speaker.
title: Echo with Bass

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Joe
content: Ended up replacement my high end Surround sound stereo and speakers for 2 of these and a sub woofer.  These sound nice, while not as high end as Amazon would like to make you believe but still very nice,  My wife and I are happy with the choice,  as these are so much smaller than my stereo and speakers and with far less wires!  All in all it was a good choice and a HUGE upgrade from the previous Echos.  If I were still i my 20's I would say the sound quality is not good enough for a stand alone music system, but I am in my 50's and do not hear as well as I used to anyway so these fit the bill nicely
title: Not a bad Choice

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: tomc
content: I enjoy listening to  high quality audio when I go to bed at night, so I decided to give Echo Studio a try. The sound quality is great. Bass is excellent, but not overwhelming. All of the Alexa functions work as expected. All in all I’m very pleased with my purchase.
title: Nice rich sound in my bedroom

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: BraveNewWorld
content: This product is excellent in many respects. Everything most people would want to do with it it does very well. There are some caveats however: with Bluetooth the speaker volume is very low so you have to pretty much crank it up to max to stream audio from your devices to it. This means when you use Alexa it’s way too loud. There needs to be better control over various inputs as far as volume goes. Then the most disappointing: I wanted to use it for my television since it has optical audio in. I though great! Issue is that the lag time for the optical audio is ridiculous. You can’t watch movies or tv with it as the Audio source because of the delay. I’ve never seen a delay like this with optical audio and I am kind of irritated. If it’s paired with amazon’s products for streaming the software handles the delay but if you are using anything else you pretty much can’t use this for your television.
title: Overall very good however the input lag for the optical audio is awful

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Gas4Harley
content: You need to be standing up to see if Alexa is listening to you which is a big hassle. She already hard of hearing. The color ring is to far recessed on the top to see if Alexa is listening. Back to the drawing board. Hey it's just the first version. The second one will be better and we'll all have go buy the newest one.
title: you can't the see blue ring when Alexa is listening to you,

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: J Critic
content: Other reviews are accurate when saying sound is MUDDY and no way to adjust. Not to mention bass is only heard at high volume 8 or above.  also true you can't see the ring if a couple steps away so you never know if it heard you.  annoying.  Cant believe they couldn't do better after having been doing echos for so long.  Super disappointed, i also paired with echo sub and just is not worth the price as was expecting way more umpf.
title: No where near premium sound!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Mastermas619
content: pretty disappointed. my echo dot  paired with echo sub sounds better. This is not ready for prime time. I really thought it packed a punch, by the way a whole lot of reviewers were "blown" by it. Trust me after trying it for a week. i can tell you, the base is nowhere that powerful as how the you tubers make it seem. These are obvious paid reviewers. well this is my honest opinion from one end user to another. safe your money.
title: Do not go into the hype!!!

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
author: Mel K
content: The sound is so much better and clearer then the other echo plus I was using. You can hear the bass more. So far I am very happy with it
title: Much better then Echo Plus

product: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
